grief, in the

original: Vinā upekkhāya sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāvippayuttasaddhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: vinā upekkhāya sa hetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā vippayutta saddhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: When those with faculties of both equanimity and faith are being reborn spontaneously, when their mind-accompanied consciousness has arisen without the faculty of equanimity,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam saddhindriyam na uppajjati
translated: at the very moment of their rebirth their faculty of equanimity does not come to be, but their faculty of faith does come to be.

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttasaddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: And at the moment of the arising of mind-accompanied consciousness without the faculty of equanimity and without the faculty of faith,

original: nirodhasamāpannānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati saddhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: nirodha samāpannānam asaññasattānam tesam upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: and in one who has attained cessation and in non-percipient beings, their faculty of equanimity does not come to be, and their faculty of faith does not come to be.

original: Yassa vā pana saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: “Or is it that when the faculty of faith does not come to be, the faculty of equanimity does not come to be?”

original: Ahetukānaṁ upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāvippayuttaupekkhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: ahetukānam upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā vippayutta aupekkhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: When those without faculties are being reborn spontaneously, when their mind-accompanied consciousness has arisen without faith but accompanied by equanimity,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam saddhi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam upekkhindriyam na uppajjati
translated: at the very moment of their rebirth their faculty of faith does not come to be, but their faculty of equanimity does come to be.

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe saddhāvippayuttaupekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe saddhā vippayutta aupekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: At the instant of the arising of consciousness accompanied by equanimity and not accompanied by faith in one who is dying…

original: nirodhasamāpannānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ saddhindriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: nirodha samāpannānam asaññasattānam tesam saddhi indriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: in one who has attained cessation…in an apparitional sentient being devoid of equanimity, the faculty of faith does not arise and the faculty of equanimity does not arise.

original: Yassa upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tassa paññindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: When the faculty of equanimity does not arise, does the faculty of understanding not arise?

original: Vinā upekkhāya ñāṇasampayuttānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāvippayuttañāṇasampayuttacittassa
analyzed: vinā upekkhāya ñāṇa sampayuttānam upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā vippayutta ñāṇa sampayutta cittassa
translated: In the case of those who are dying with equanimity and with consciousness accompanied by knowledge, in the course of an existence with consciousness accompanied by equanimity and unaccompanied by knowledge, at the instant of arising of consciousness accompanied by equanimity and unaccompanied by knowledge,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam paññindriyam na uppajjati
translated: the faculty of equanimity does not arise, but the faculty of understanding does arise.

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttañāṇavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: At the instant of the arising of consciousness accompanied by equanimity and unaccompanied by knowledge,

original: nirodhasamāpannānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati paññindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: nirodha samāpannānam asaññasattānam tesam upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati paññindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: in one who has attained cessation, in an apparitional sentient being devoid of equanimity, the faculty of equanimity does not arise and the faculty of understanding does not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: When the faculty of understanding does not arise, does the faculty of equanimity not arise?

original: Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇavippayuttaupekkhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: ñāṇa vippayuttānam upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa vippayutta aupekkhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: When those disjoined from knowledge are being reborn, when knowledge-disjoined-neutral consciousness is present in the cognitive series,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam paññindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam upekkhindriyam na uppajjati
translated: at the instant of arising of that consciousness, the faculty of understanding does not arise in them, but the faculty of equanimity does arise in them.

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe ñāṇavippayuttaupekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe ñāṇa vippayutta aupekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: At the instant of the arising of all consciousnesses other than that, at the instant of the arising of knowledge-disjoined-neutral consciousness,

original: nirodhasamāpannānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ paññindriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: nirodha samāpannānam asaññasattānam tesam paññā indriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: in those attained to cessation, in non-percipient beings, the faculty of understanding does not arise, and the faculty of equanimity does not arise.

original: Yassa upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa upekkhā indriyam na uppajjati tassa manindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: When the faculty of equanimity does not arise, does the mind faculty not arise?

original: Vinā upekkhāya sacittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe🔽tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ
analyzed: vinā upekkhāya sacittakānam upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe  tesam upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam manindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam
translated: When those with consciousness are being reborn without equanimity, when equanimity-disjoined consciousness is present in the cognitive series,🔽at the instant of arising of that consciousness, the faculty of equanimity does not arise in them, but the mind faculty does arise in them.🔽At the instant of the arising of all consciousnesses other than that, in those attained to cessation, in non-percipient beings,

original: cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ upekkhindriyañca na
analyzed: cittassa bhaṅga khaṇe nirodha samāpannānam asaññasattānam tesam upekkhindriyam ca na
translated: the faculty of equanimity does not arise,

original: uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: or the mind faculty has arisen and the equanimity faculty has not arisen.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjati tassa upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā upekkhindriya mūlaka  yassa saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa paññindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Or when someone’s equanimity faculty has not arisen, has their mind faculty not arisen?🔽When someone’s faith faculty has not arisen, has their wisdom faculty not arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa saddhindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or when someone’s wisdom faculty has not arisen, has their faith faculty not arisen?

original: Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇavippayuttasaddhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: ñāṇa vippayuttānam sa hetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa vippayutta saddhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: When those with faith not connected with knowledge are being reborn, when their mind is being produced without knowledge and connected with faith,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam paññindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam saddhindriyam na uppajjati
translated: at the moment of conception their wisdom faculty has not arisen, but their faith faculty has not arisen.

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe ñāṇavippayuttasaddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe ñāṇa vippayutta saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking of all those with a mind without knowledge and not connected with faith,

original: nirodhasamāpannānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ paññindriyañca na uppajjati saddhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: nirodha samāpannānam asaññasattānam tesam paññā indriyam ca na uppajjati saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: and at the moment of rebirth-linking of those without perception, and of those who have attained cessation, their wisdom faculty has not arisen and their faith faculty has not arisen.

original: Yassa saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa manindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: When the faith faculty does not arise in him, does the mind faculty not arise?

original: Ahetukānaṁ sacittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: ahetukānam sa cittakānam upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: In those without root-cause, in those with consciousness arisen by mind-reading or mind-making, in those being reborn, in the course of an existence, in one whose faith faculty is unarisen, at the moment of arising of consciousness without root-cause and not associated with faith,

original: tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ🔽cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ saddhindriyañca na
analyzed: tesam saddhi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam manindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam  cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannānam asaññasattānam tesam saddhindriyam ca na
translated: in all those dying, in those attaining the cessation of perception and feeling, in those without consciousness, the faith faculty does not arise, and the mind faculty does not arise.

original: uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: But in those whose faith faculty does not arise, the mind faculty does not not arise.🔽When the mind faculty does not arise in him, does the faith faculty not arise?

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjati tassa saddhindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā saddhindriya mūlaka
translated: In those without root-cause, in those with consciousness arisen by mind-reading or mind-making, in those being reborn, in the course of an existence, in one whose mind faculty is unarisen, at the moment of arising of consciousness without root-cause and not associated with faith,🔽in all those dying, in those attaining the cessation of perception and feeling, in those without consciousness, the mind faculty does not arise, and the faith faculty does not arise.🔽But in those whose mind faculty does not arise, the faith faculty does not not arise.

original: Yassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa paññā indriyam na uppajjati tassa manindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: When the understanding faculty does not arise in him, does the mind faculty not arise?

original: Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ sacittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: ñāṇa vippayuttānam sa cittakānam upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: In those without root-cause, in those with consciousness arisen by mind-reading or mind-making, in those being reborn, in the course of an existence, in one whose understanding faculty is unarisen, at the moment of arising of consciousness without root-cause and not associated with understanding,

original: tesaṁ paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa
analyzed: tesam paññindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam manindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa
translated: for them the faculty of wisdom does not arise, but the faculty of mind does arise. For all who have attained the first absorption,🔽

original: bhaṅgakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ paññindriyañca na uppajjati
analyzed: bhaṅga kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannānam asaññasattānam tesam paññindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: for them the faculty of wisdom does not arise, but not for them the faculty of mind does not arise. And at the moment of the dissolution of all consciousness of those who have attained the cessation of perception and feeling, and of those free from craving who are entering Nibbāna, the faculty of wisdom does not arise,

original: manindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: manindriyañca na uppajjati
translated: and the faculty of mind does not arise.🔽But if the faculty of mind does not arise, does the faculty of wisdom not arise? The reverse is to be said.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjati tassa paññindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā paññindriya mūlaka
translated: (The faculty of wisdom is to be expanded as above.)

original: 10.2.1.1.5. Paccanīkaokāsa
analyzed: paccanīka okāsa
translated: .... The reverse order

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yattha vā pana sotindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tattha sotindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā  yattha vā pana sotindriyam na uppajjati tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Where the eye faculty does not arise, does the ear faculty not arise? The reverse is to be said.🔽Or where the ear faculty does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise? The reverse is to be said.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Where the eye faculty does not arise, does the nose faculty not arise? The reverse is to be said.

original: Yattha vā pana ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or where the nose faculty does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Asaññasatte arūpe tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati no ca tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati asaññasatte arūpe tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: In the fine-material sphere, the nose faculty does not arise there, but the eye faculty does arise there. In the immaterial state and in the case of the non-percipient beings, neither the nose faculty nor the eye faculty arises there.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Where the eye faculty does not arise, there the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty does not arise, does it?

original: Yattha vā pana purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana purisa indriyam na uppajjati tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or where the masculinity faculty does not arise, there the eye faculty does not arise?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Asaññasatte arūpe tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati asaññasatte arūpe tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: In the fine-material sphere, the masculinity faculty does not arise there, but the eye faculty does arise there. In the immaterial state and in the case of the non-percipient beings, neither the masculinity faculty nor the eye faculty arises there.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Uppajjati.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti uppajjati
translated: Where the eye faculty does not arise, there the life faculty does not arise, does it? It arises.

original: Yattha vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yattha vā pana jīvitindriyam na uppajjati tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati iti natthi
translated: Or where the life faculty does not arise, there the eye faculty does not arise? There is none.

translated: “Are there any instances where the eye faculty does not arise, but the joy faculty does?”🔽“Are there any instances where the joy faculty does not arise, but the eye faculty does?”

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?

translated: “Are there any instances where the eye faculty does not arise, but the equanimity faculty does?”

original: Arūpe tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Asaññasatte tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati.

translated: “In the formless realms, the eye faculty does not arise there, but the equanimity faculty does. In the case of the non-percipient beings, neither the eye faculty nor the equanimity faculty arise.

translated: Where the mind faculty does not arise, there the eye faculty does not arise.🔽Where the nose faculty does not arise, there the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty does not arise.

translated: Where the masculinity faculty does not arise, there the nose faculty does not arise.🔽Where the nose faculty does not arise, there the life faculty does not arise.🔽Where the life faculty does not arise, there the nose faculty does not arise.

translated: In the fine-material sphere, the nose faculty does not arise there, but the joy faculty does arise there. In the immaterial state and in the case of the non-percipient beings, neither the nose faculty nor the joy faculty arises.

original: Yattha vā pana somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.

analyzed: yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjati iti

translated: Or where the mind faculty does not arise, there the masculinity faculty does not arise? No.🔽Where the life faculty does not arise, there the joy faculty does not arise? No.

analyzed: yattha vā pana somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti uppajjati

original: Yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Natthi.

translated: Where the life faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty … the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the mind faculty not arise there? There is none.

translated: Or where the mind faculty does not arise, does the life faculty not arise there? It arises. (The life faculty base.)

original: Yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Where the joy faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty not arise there? It is possible.

original: Yattha vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Or where the equanimity faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty not arise there? It is possible.

original: Yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Where the joy faculty does not arise, does the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the mind faculty not arise there? It is possible.

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam na uppajjati tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā somanassindriya mūlaka
translated: Or where the mind faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty not arise there? It is possible. (The joy faculty base.)

original: Yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: “Where the faculty of equanimity does not arise, do the faculties of faith… of mindfulness… of concentration… of wisdom… of the mind not arise there?” “Yes.”

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.

translated: “Where the faculty of the mind does not arise, does the faculty of equanimity not arise there?” “Yes.”🔽“Where the faculty of faith does not arise, does the faculty of wisdom… of the mind not arise there?” “Yes.”

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.

translated: “Where the faculty of the mind does not arise, does the faculty of faith not arise there?” “Yes.”🔽“Where the faculty of wisdom does not arise, does the faculty of the mind not arise there?” “Yes.”

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam na uppajjati tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā paññindriya mūlaka
translated: “Where the faculty of the mind does not arise, does the faculty of wisdom not arise there?” “Yes.”

translated: When those not possessing a nose but possessing eyes are being reborn, nose faculty has not arisen in them,🔽but eye faculty has not not arisen. When those not possessing a nose and not possessing eyes are perishing,

original: Yassa vā pana yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti

translated: When women who are not yet fully grown are in the process of becoming fully grown, their femininity faculty has not arisen,🔽but their eye faculty has not arisen.

translated: When those who are not women, or when those who are women but are not yet fully grown, die and are reborn in the realm of the ghosts, in the animal realm, or in the lower worlds, or when those who are not women die and are reborn in the realm of the ghosts, in the animal realm, or in the lower worlds, their femininity faculty and their eye faculty have not arisen.

translated: When those who are male with eyes are being reborn, their male faculty has not arisen,🔽but their eye faculty has arisen. When all those who are dying who are male without eyes

analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti  acakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam  tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca

translated: Those who arise in the formless world without equanimity, their equanimity faculty does not arise there,🔽but their eye faculty does not not arise there. Those who die as non-percipient beings,

Those without eye faculty who are not making an appearance with understanding faculty,

analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati iti

original: Na purisānaṁ saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati,🔽no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ aghānakānaṁ
analyzed: na purisānam saghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati  no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam na purisānam a ghānakāna
translated: In the case of those who are not male and are not nose- possessors, when they are being reborn, the male faculty does not arise there,🔽but the nose faculty does not not arise there. In the case of all who are dying, who are not male, and who are not nose- possessors,

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjati ghānindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: the male faculty does not arise and the nose faculty does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Aghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti  aghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha
translated: Where the nose faculty does not arise, does the life faculty not arise there?🔽In the case of those who are not nose-possessors and are being reborn, the nose faculty does not arise there,

original: jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati
analyzed: jīvitindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: but the life faculty does not not arise there. In the case of all who are dying, the nose faculty does not arise there

original: jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati
translated: and the life faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Or, where the life faculty does not arise, does the nose faculty not arise there?

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Where the nose faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty not arise there?

original: Aghānakānaṁ somanassena upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no🔽ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ vinā
analyzed: aghānakānam somanassena upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati no  ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam aghānakānam vinā
translated: In the case of those without nose who are being reborn with joy, there is no nose faculty there, but🔽there is no non-arising of the joy faculty there. In the case of all those dying without nose who are being reborn without joy, there is no nose faculty there, and

original: somanassena upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: somanassena upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: there is no arising of the joy faculty there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, where the joy faculty does not arise, does the nose faculty not arise there?

original: Vinā somanassena saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati,
analyzed: vinā somanassena saghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati
translated: In the case of those being reborn with nose without joy, there is no joy faculty there, but

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ vinā somanassena
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam vinā somanassena
translated: but their nose faculty does not not arise there. Of those dying with joy

original: aghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjati ghānindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: aghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjati ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: and being reborn without joy, their joy faculty does not arise and their nose faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Aghānakānaṁ upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti  aghānakānam upekkhāya upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati no ca
translated: “If anyone’s nose faculty does not arise in a certain place, does his equanimity faculty not arise there too?”

original: tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ vinā upekkhāya
analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam aghānakānam vinā upekkhāya
translated: Those dying without joy and being reborn with equanimity have their nose faculty not arising there, but their equanimity faculty does arise there.

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: Of those dying with joy and being reborn without joy, their nose faculty does not arise and their equanimity faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: “If anyone’s equanimity faculty does not arise in a certain place, does his nose faculty not arise there too?”

original: Vinā upekkhāya saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati,🔽no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ vinā upekkhāya
analyzed: vinā upekkhāya sa ghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati  no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam vinā upekkhāya
translated: Those who arise in the company of non-percipient beings, for them the nose faculty does not arise there,🔽but the nose faculty does not not arise there for those who die and are reborn.

original: aghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati ghānindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: aghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati ghānindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: For those who die and are reborn in the company of non-percipient beings, the nose faculty does not arise there, and the nose faculty does not not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: “When someone’s nose faculty does not arise, does his confidence faculty not arise too?”

original: Aghānakānaṁ sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no🔽ca tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ ahetukānaṁ
analyzed: a ghānakānam sa hetukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati no  ca tesam tattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam a ghānakānam ahetukānam
translated: Those who are percipient of form and are percipient of unity, for them the nose faculty does not arise,🔽but the confidence faculty does not not arise there for those who die and are reborn.

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati saddhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam ca na uppajjati saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: For those who die and are reborn in the company of non-percipient beings, the nose faculty does not arise there, and the confidence faculty does not not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: “When someone’s confidence faculty does not arise, does his nose faculty not arise too?”

original: Ahetukānaṁ saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no🔽ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ ahetukānaṁ aghānakānaṁ🔽upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca na uppajjati ghānindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: ahetukānam saghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati no  ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam ahetukānam a ghānakānam  upapajjantānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati ghānindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: Those without faculties who are being reborn without faculties have faculties that do not arise there.🔽Those without faculties who are perishing have faculties that do not arise there.🔽Those without faculties who are being reborn without faculties have faculties that do not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Aghānakānaṁ ñāṇasampayuttānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati,
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati iti  a ghānakānam ñāṇa sampayuttānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati
translated: “When someone’s nose faculty does not arise, does his wisdom faculty not arise too?”🔽Those without faculties who are being reborn with consciousness have nose faculties that do not arise there.

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam aghānakānam ñāṇa vippayuttānam
translated: But their wisdom faculties do arise there. Those without faculties who are perishing without consciousness🔽and those without faculties who are being reborn without faculties have nose faculties that do not arise there.

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati paññindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam ca na uppajjati paññindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: And their wisdom faculties do not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: “When someone’s wisdom faculty does not arise, does his nose faculty not arise too?”

original: Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati,🔽no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ
analyzed: ñāṇa vippayuttānam sa ghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati  no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam ñāṇa vippayuttāna
translated: Those who are without consciousness and are not destined for reappearance, and those in the intermediate state of the sense sphere, and those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, do not acquire the nose faculty.🔽But it is not that they do not acquire the mind faculty.

original: aghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca na uppajjati ghānindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: aghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha paññā indriyam ca na uppajjati ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: All those who die and are not destined for reappearance in the sense sphere, and those in the intermediate state of the fine-material realm, and those in the immaterial realm, do not acquire the nose faculty and the mind faculty.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: In the case of those in whom the nose faculty does not arise, the mind faculty does not arise.

original: Aghānakānaṁ sacittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no
analyzed: a ghānakānam sa cittakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati no
translated: Those not destined for rebirth who possess mind and are being reborn, do not acquire the nose faculty,🔽but it is not that they do not acquire the mind faculty.

original: ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ acittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ
analyzed: ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam acittakānam upapajjantānam
translated: All those who die and are not destined for rebirth in the sense sphere, and those without mind who are being reborn,

original: tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: do not acquire the nose faculty and the mind faculty.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Ghānindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā ghāna indriya mūlaka
translated: Or, does one in whom the mind faculty does not arise, in him the nose faculty not arise? The answer is: Yes. (The nose faculty is the base.)

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati iti  purisānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha
translated: In regard to the question: “In whomsoever the femininity faculty does not arise, does the masculinity faculty not arise in him?”🔽In men reappearing in a realm, the femininity faculty does not arise, but the masculinity faculty does arise.

original: purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ na purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ
analyzed: purisa indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam na itthīnam na purisānam
translated: In all those passing away from the realm of neither perception nor non-perception, and in women not reappearing in any realm,

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati purisindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: the femininity faculty does not arise, nor does the masculinity faculty arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, does one in whom the masculinity faculty does not arise, in him the femininity faculty not arise?

original: Itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tāsaṁ tattha
analyzed: itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tāsam tattha
translated: In women reappearing in a realm, the masculinity faculty does not arise, but the femininity faculty does arise.

original: itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ na itthīnaṁ upapajjantānaṁ
analyzed: itthi indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam na purisānam na itthīnam upapajjantānam
translated: for all who die as men and are not reborn as women

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjati itthindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: for all who die as men and are not reborn as women, the male faculty does not arise and the female faculty does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Na itthīnaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti  na itthīnam upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha  jīvita indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: “Where the female faculty does not arise, does the life faculty not arise there?”🔽For women who are being reborn, the female faculty does not arise there, but not the life faculty.

original: jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati  yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: For all who die, the female faculty does not arise and the life faculty does not arise.🔽“Where the life faculty does not arise, does the female faculty not arise there?”

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: “Where the female faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty not arise there?”

original: Na itthīnaṁ somanassena upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no🔽ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ vinā
analyzed: na itthīnam somanassena upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no  ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam na itthīnam vinā
translated: When those who are reborn by way of joy of women, for them there is no arising of the female faculty there,🔽but there is no non-arising of the joy faculty there for them. For all those who are dying, not for women,🔽

original: somanassena upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: somanassena upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: When women are reborn without joy, then the female faculty has arisen in them, but not the joy faculty.🔽When all who are dying without joy are reborn without joy, then both the female faculty and the joy faculty have arisen in them.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: When the joy faculty has not arisen in any given person, has the female faculty not arisen in that person too?

original: Vinā somanassena itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati,🔽no ca tāsaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ vinā somanassena
analyzed: vinā somanassena itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati  no ca tāsam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam vinā somanassena
translated: When women are being reborn without joy, then the joy faculty has not arisen in them,

original: na itthīnaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjati itthindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: na itthīnam upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: but the female faculty has arisen in them. When all who are dying without joy are reborn without joy, then both the joy faculty and the female faculty have not arisen in them.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Na itthīnaṁ upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca🔽tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ vinā upekkhāya
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam na uppajjati iti  na itthīnam upekkhāya upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca  tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam na itthīnam vinā upekkhāya
translated: Whose femininity faculty does not arise there, their equanimity faculty does not arise there?🔽Women who attain through serenity, for them the femininity faculty does not arise there, but their equanimity faculty does arise there.

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: For all who die, for women who do not attain through serenity, for them both the femininity faculty and the equanimity faculty do not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhā indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, whose equanimity faculty does not arise there, their femininity faculty does not arise there?

original: Vinā upekkhāya itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati,🔽no ca tāsaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ vinā upekkhāya
analyzed: vinā upekkhāya itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati  no ca tāsam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam vinā upekkhāya
translated: Women who attain without serenity, for them the equanimity faculty does not arise there,

original: na itthīnaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati itthindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: na itthīnam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: but their femininity faculty does arise there. For all who die, for women who do not attain without serenity, for them both the equanimity faculty and the femininity faculty do not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Na itthīnaṁ sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no🔽ca tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ ahetukānaṁ

translated: Whose femininity faculty does not arise there, their faith faculty does not arise there?

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati saddhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati saddhi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: Those who are women and possess causes for arising do not arise there with femininity faculty, but they do not arise there without faith faculty. All who are dying and not women and possess causes for arising do not arise there with femininity faculty, and they do not arise there with faith faculty.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Ahetukānaṁ itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca🔽tāsaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ ahetukānaṁ na itthīnaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti  ahetukānam itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati no ca  tāsam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam ahetukānam na
translated: Or, those whose faith faculty does not arise there, their femininity faculty does not arise there?

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca na uppajjati itthindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha saddhi indriyam ca na uppajjati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: Those who are women and do not possess causes for arising do not arise there with faith faculty, but they do not arise there without femininity faculty. All who are dying and not women and do not possess causes for arising do not arise there with faith faculty, and they do not arise there with femininity faculty.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha paññā indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Whose femininity faculty does not arise there, their wisdom faculty does not arise there?

original: Na itthīnaṁ ñāṇasampayuttānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati,🔽no ca tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ

translated: In the case of women who are not in association with knowledge and are being reborn, their femininity faculty does not arise there,🔽but their wisdom faculty does arise there. In the case of all those dying and not being reborn as women,

analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati paññindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: and in the case of those not in association with knowledge and being reborn, their femininity faculty does not arise there, and their wisdom faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha paññā indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti

original: Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati,🔽no ca tāsaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ
analyzed: ñāṇa vippayuttānam itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati  no ca tāsam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam ñāṇa vippayuttāna
translated: In the case of women not in association with knowledge and being reborn, their wisdom faculty does not arise there,🔽but their femininity faculty does arise there. In the case of all those dying and not being reborn as women,

original: na itthīnaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca na uppajjati itthindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: na itthīnam upapajjantānam tesam tattha paññā indriyam ca na uppajjati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati

analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, in the case of anyone in whom the faculty of equanimity does not arise, does his faculty of life not arise too?

original: Vinā upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ🔽tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati.🔽Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na
analyzed: vinā upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe  tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati  sabbesam cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na
translated: In the case of those who are reborn without equanimity and in the course of an existence of those whose consciousness is accompanied by equanimity at the moment of rebirth and at the instant of dissolution of consciousness at death,

original: uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjati jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: their faculty of equanimity does not arise, but their faculty of life does arise.🔽In the case of all those dying and in the course of an existence whose consciousness is not accompanied by equanimity at the instant of dissolution of consciousness at death, their faculty of equanimity does not arise and neither does their faculty of life.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: In the case of anyone in whom the faculty of life does not arise, does his faculty of faith not arise too?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, in the case of anyone in whom the faculty of faith does not arise, does his faculty of life not arise too?

original: Ahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: ahetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those without root-cause who are being reborn and in the course of an existence of those whose consciousness is not accompanied by faith at the moment of rebirth and at the instant of dissolution of consciousness at death,

original: saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ
analyzed: saddhi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam
translated: for them the eye faculty does not arise, but not for them the life faculty does not arise.

original: cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca na uppajjati
analyzed: cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: And for all who are perishing, at the moment of the mind’s dissolution there the eye faculty does not arise,

original: jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati.🔽Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati  yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: and the life faculty does not arise.🔽“Where the life faculty does not arise, does the mind faculty not arise there?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: “Where the mind faculty does not arise, does the life faculty not arise there?”

original: Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ
analyzed: ñāṇa vippayuttānam upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: For those disjoined from the cognizance-set who are being reborn, at the moment of arising of the cognizance-set dissociated from knowledge there

original: tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati
translated: the mind faculty does not arise, but not for them the life faculty does not arise.

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca na
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam tattha paññindriyam ca na
translated: And for all who are perishing, at the moment of the mind’s dissolution there the mind faculty does not arise,

original: uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjati jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: and the life faculty does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā  yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Whose ever the life faculty does not arise, his mind faculty does not arise? Yes.🔽Or whosever the mind faculty does not arise, his life faculty does not arise?

original: Acittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ
analyzed: acittakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha  jīvitindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe
translated: Of those who are without consciousness and are being reborn, their mind faculty does not arise, but not so their life faculty.🔽Of all those who are dying, when the mind is perishing at the moment of the break-up,

original: tattha manindriyañca na uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjati jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjati jīvitindriya mūlaka
translated: their mind faculty does not arise, and their life faculty does not arise. (The life faculty is the root.)

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Whosever the joy faculty does not arise, his equanimity faculty does not arise?

original: Upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāsampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha
translated: Of those who are being reborn without equanimity, and at the moment of the arising of the mind associated with equanimity,

original: somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ
analyzed: somanassa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati sabbesam
translated: their joy faculty does not arise, but not so their equanimity faculty. Of all those who are dying,

original: cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe somanassavippayuttaupekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ🔽tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Somanassena upapajjantānaṁ pavatte somanassasampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ🔽tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati.🔽Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttasomanassavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe🔽asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe somanassa vippayutta upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe  tesam tattha somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhā indriyam ca na uppajjati  yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati iti  somanassena upapajjantānam pavatte somanassa sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe  tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati  sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta somanassa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe  asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati somanassindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: At the instant of the mind’s dissolution in one who is dying without joy and without equanimity, and at the instant of arising of the mind without joy and without equanimity in one who is being reborn without joy and without equanimity, and in the Non-percipient Beings,🔽there is no arising of the joy faculty and no arising of the equanimity faculty.🔽Or alternatively, in any instance where the equanimity faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty not arise too?🔽In the case of those dying with joy and in the course of an existence in the happy destinies, at the instant of arising of the mind accompanied by joy,🔽there is no arising of the equanimity faculty, but there is arising of the joy faculty.🔽At the instant of the mind’s dissolution in one who is dying without joy and without equanimity, and at the instant of arising of the mind without joy and without equanimity in one who is being reborn without joy and without equanimity,🔽and in the Non-percipient Beings, there is no arising of the equanimity faculty and no arising of the joy faculty.🔽🔽

analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati iti
