original: Vinā somanassena sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte somanassavippayuttasaddhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: vinā somanassena sa hetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte somanassa vippayutta saddhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: When those with faculties who are without joy are being reborn, when those with faculties who are without joy are continuing, when consciousness is arising and is accompanied by faith but unaccompanied by joy,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha saddhindriya
translated: at the moment of the arising of their consciousness, the joy faculty does not arise in them, and the faith faculty

original: na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe somanassavippayuttasaddhāvippayuttacittassa
analyzed: na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe somanassa vippayutta saddhā vippayutta cittassa
translated: does not arise in them. At the moment of the arising of their consciousness, when consciousness is arising and is accompanied by faith but unaccompanied by joy,

original: uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjati saddhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca na uppajjati saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: at the moment of the arising of their consciousness, the joy faculty does not arise in them, and the faith faculty does not arise in them.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: But when someone’s faith faculty does not arise, does their joy faculty not arise too?

original: Pavatte saddhāvippayuttasomanassasampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ
analyzed: pavatte saddhā vippayutta somanassa sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha saddhindriya
translated: When consciousness is arising and is accompanied by joy but unaccompanied by faith, at the moment of the arising of their consciousness,

original: na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa
analyzed: na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa
translated: their faith faculty does not arise, and their joy faculty

original: bhaṅgakkhaṇe saddhāvippayuttasomanassavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: bhaṅga kkhaṇe saddhā vippayutta somanassa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of understanding,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of coming to know that which one does not know,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,

original: tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati somanassindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of coming to know that which one does not know,

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,

original: Vinā somanassena ñāṇasampayuttānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte somanassavippayuttañāṇasampayuttacittassa
analyzed: vinā somanassena ñāṇa sampayuttānam upapajjantānam pavatte somanassa vippayutta ñāṇa sampayutta cittassa
translated: at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha paññindriya
translated: at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,

original: na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe somanassavippayuttañāṇavippayuttacittassa
analyzed: na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe somanassa vippayutta ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa
translated: at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final knowledge,

original: uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjati paññindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca na uppajjati paññindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of wisdom,🔽at the instant of the arising of the mind without joy and without the faculty of final

original: Yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, when someone has not made an appearance of the faculty of wisdom, has he not made an appearance of the faculty of joy?🔽When those not associated with knowledge are being reborn with joy, in the course of an existence that is not associated with knowledge and is accompanied by joy,

original: Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ somanassena upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇavippayuttasomanassasampayuttacittassa🔽uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ
analyzed: ñāṇa vippayuttānam somanassena upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa vippayutta somanassa sampayutta cittassa  uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassindriya
translated: at the moment of the arising of consciousness,🔽at the moment of the arising of the mind that is not associated with knowledge and is not accompanied by joy, and in the case of those without consciousness,

original: na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe ñāṇavippayuttasomanassavippayuttacittassa🔽uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjati.🔽Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe ñāṇa vippayutta somanassa vippayutta cittassa  uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha paññindriyam ca na uppajjati somanassindriyam ca na uppajjati  yassa yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: the faculty of wisdom has not appeared, and he has not made an appearance of the faculty of joy.🔽When someone has not made an appearance of the faculty of joy, has he not made an appearance of the faculty of the mind?

original: Vinā somanassena sacittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte somanassavippayuttacittassa
analyzed: vinā somanassena sa cittakānam upapajjantānam pavatte somanassa vippayutta cittassa
translated: When those without joy are being reborn with consciousness, in the course of an existence that is not accompanied by joy,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriya
translated: At the moment of their arising, the faculty of joy does not arise in them, nor does the faculty of the mind.

original: na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca
analyzed: na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyañca
translated: At the moment of the arising of consciousness of all who have attained the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, and at the moment of the arising of the mind that is without initial thought and without sustained thought, the faculty of joy does not arise in them, nor does the faculty of the mind.

original: na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjati  yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā somanassindriya mūlaka
translated: But if someone’s faculty of the mind does not arise, his faculty of joy does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: If someone’s faculty of equanimity does not arise, his faculty of faith does not arise.

original: Vinā upekkhāya sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāvippayuttasaddhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: vinā upekkhāya sa hetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā vippayutta saddhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: In the case of those without root-cause who are being reborn, in the course of an existence in the Sensuous Sphere with the mind-element accompanied by equanimity and associated with the root-cause of faith,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha saddhindriya
translated: at the moment of the arising of that consciousness, the faculty of equanimity does not arise in them, nor does the faculty of faith.

original: na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttasaddhāvippayuttacittassa
analyzed: na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta saddhā vippayutta cittassa
translated: At the moment of the arising of the mind-element accompanied by equanimity and dissociated from faith,

original: uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati saddhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: At the moment of arising of those without consciousness, the faculty of equanimity and the faculty of faith do not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, alternatively: When someone does not acquire the faculty of faith there, does he not acquire the faculty of equanimity there too?

original: Ahetukānaṁ upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāvippayuttaupekkhāsampayuttacittassa🔽uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe saddhāvippayuttaupekkhāvippayuttacittassa
analyzed: ahetukānam upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā vippayutta aupekkhā sampayutta cittassa  uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriya  na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe saddhā vippayutta aupekkhā vippayutta cittassa
translated: When non-percipient beings arise by way of the equanimity faculty, in the course of an existence with the mind-faculty but without faith,🔽at the moment of arising, the faculty of faith does not arise there, but the faculty of equanimity does arise there.🔽At the moment of the arising of all other types of consciousness, at the moment of arising of those without consciousness, and at the moment of arising of those with the mind-faculty but without the equanimity faculty,

original: uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: the faculty of faith does not arise there, and the faculty of equanimity does not arise there either.

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: When someone does not acquire the faculty of equanimity there, does he not acquire the faculty of wisdom there too?

original: Vinā upekkhāya ñāṇasampayuttānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāvippayuttañāṇasampayuttacittassa🔽uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ
analyzed: vinā upekkhāya ñāṇa sampayuttānam upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā vippayutta ñāṇa sampayutta cittassa  uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha paññindriya
translated: When those disengaged from equanimity, possessing knowledge, are being reborn, when their consciousness is accompanied by equanimity and disengaged from knowledge,

original: na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttañāṇavippayuttacittassa
analyzed: na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa
translated: at the instant of arising, their equanimity faculty does not arise, but their understanding faculty🔽does. At the instant of the dissolution of the consciousness of all those disengaged from equanimity and disengaged from knowledge,🔽and at the instant of the arising of the consciousness of those without thought, their equanimity faculty does not arise, and their understanding faculty

original: uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati paññindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati paññindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: does not arise either.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇavippayuttaupekkhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti  ñāṇa vippayuttānam upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa vippayutta aupekkhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: Or alternatively, when someone’s understanding faculty does not arise, does his equanimity faculty not arise too?🔽When those disengaged from knowledge, possessing equanimity, are being reborn, when their consciousness is accompanied by equanimity and disengaged from knowledge,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriya
translated: at the instant of arising, their understanding faculty does not arise, but their equanimity faculty🔽does.

original: na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe ñāṇavippayuttaupekkhāvippayuttacittassa
analyzed: na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe ñāṇa vippayutta aupekkhā vippayutta cittassa
translated: it does not arise. And at the moment of the arising of the mind that is without-thought and without-reflection,

original: uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha paññindriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: and in the case of the Unconscious Beings, the faculty of understanding does not arise and the faculty of equanimity does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: In the case of those whose faculty of equanimity does not arise, does their faculty of mind not arise?

original: Vinā upekkhāya sacittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: vinā upekkhāya sacittakānam upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: In the case of those who are without equanimity and are being born, in the course of an existence, at the moment of the arising of the mind that is without equanimity,

original: tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjati
translated: their faculty of equanimity does not arise, but their faculty of mind does arise.

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati
translated: And at the moment of the arising of the mind that is without-thought, and in the case of the Unconscious Beings, their faculty of equanimity does not arise

original: manindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: manindriyañca na uppajjati
translated: and their faculty of mind does not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā upekkhindriya mūlaka
translated: In the case of those whose faculty of mind does not arise, does their faculty of equanimity not arise? In the case of those who are without equanimity and are being born, in the course of an existence, at the moment of the arising of the mind that is without equanimity,🔽their faculty of mind does not arise, but their faculty of equanimity does arise.🔽And at the moment of the arising of the mind that is without-thought, and in the case of the Unconscious Beings, their faculty of mind does not arise🔽and their faculty of equanimity does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Is it the case that whenever the faith faculty does not arise in anyone, the wisdom faculty does not arise in them?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or is it the case that whenever the wisdom faculty does not arise in anyone, the faith faculty does not arise in them?

original: Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇavippayuttasaddhāsampayuttacittassa🔽uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe ñāṇavippayuttasaddhāvippayuttacittassa
analyzed: ñāṇa vippayuttānam sa hetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa vippayutta saddhā sampayutta cittassa  uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha saddhindriya  na uppajjati sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe ñāṇa vippayutta saddhā vippayutta cittassa
translated: In the case of those not generally concentrated, when they are being reborn and when their consciousness is being reborn connected with the faith faculty but not with the wisdom faculty,🔽at the moment of their death, the wisdom faculty does not arise in them, but the faith faculty does arise in them.

original: uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca na uppajjati saddhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha paññindriyam ca na uppajjati saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, in the course of an existence in the immaterial world, and at the moment of rebirth-linking of those without perception, the wisdom faculty does not arise in them, and neither does the faith faculty.

original: Yassa yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Is it the case that whenever the faith faculty does not arise in anyone, the mind faculty does not arise in them?

original: Ahetukānaṁ sacittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: ahetukānam sa cittakānam upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: of those generating fine-material-sphere consciousness without root-cause, and of those being reborn-connected mind-consciously, at the instant of arising of mind without faith,

original: tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati.🔽Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca na uppajjati
analyzed: tesam tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjati  sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: their faith faculty does not arise, and their mind faculty does not not arise.🔽And at the instant of the dissolution of all consciousness of those without consciousness, and of those generating immaterial-sphere consciousness, and of those being reborn-connected without consciousness,

original: manindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: manindriyañca na uppajjati
translated: their faith faculty does not arise, and their mind faculty does not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā saddhindriya mūlaka
translated: But if anyone’s mind faculty does not arise, his faith faculty does not arise? All. (The faith faculty is finished).

original: Yassa yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: If anyone’s understanding faculty does not arise, his mind faculty does not arise?

original: Ñāṇavippayuttānaṁ sacittakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: ñāṇa vippayuttānam sa cittakānam upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: Of those without understanding, of those generating mind-consciousnesses without understanding, and of those being reborn-connected mind-consciously, at the instant of arising of mind without understanding,

original: tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjati
translated: their understanding faculty does not arise, and their mind faculty does not not arise.

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca na uppajjati
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha paññindriyañca na uppajjati
translated: At the instant of the fall of consciousness of all those in the immaterial states, and of those in the egg-born and womb-born states, and of those sentient beings without consciousness, the faculty of mind does not arise,

original: manindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: manindriyañca na uppajjati
translated: and the faculty of life does not arise.🔽Or, if the faculty of life does not arise in any given case, does the faculty of mind not arise in that case too?🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the future.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the present.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā paññindriya mūlaka
translated: The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past and future.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.

original: 10.2.1.2. Atītavāra🔽10.2.1.2.1. Anulomapuggala
analyzed: atītavāra  anuloma puggala
translated: The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the future and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past and future.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa sotindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa sotindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.

original: Yassa vā pana sotindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana sota indriyam uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.

original: Yassa vā pana ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.🔽The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past, future, and present.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: The faculties of life and mind are not found together in the past,

original: Yassa vā pana purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana purisa indriyam uppajjittha tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or does the male faculty arise where the eye faculty arises?🔽When the eye faculty arises, does the life faculty arise?

original: Yassa vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa vā pana somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or when the life faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise?🔽When the eye faculty arises, does the joy faculty arise?🔽Or when the joy faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise?

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the eye faculty arises, does the equanimity faculty arise?

original: Yassa vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or when the equanimity faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise?

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the eye faculty arises, does the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty arise?

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā cakkhundriya mūlaka
translated: Or does the mind faculty arise where the eye faculty arises?

original: Yassa ghānindriyaṁ …pe… itthindriyaṁ … purisindriyaṁ … jīvitindriyaṁ … somanassindriyaṁ🔽… upekkhindriyaṁ … saddhindriyaṁ … paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa gha an indriyam pe itthi indriyam purisa indriyam jīvitindriyam somanassindriya  upekkhindriyam saddhindriyam paññindriyam uppajjittha tassa manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: (The same question is to be asked of the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the femininity faculty, the masculinity faculty, the life faculty, the joy faculty, the base-of-all faculty, the faith faculty, and the wisdom faculty.)

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa paññindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjittha tassa paññindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or does the eye faculty arise where the mind faculty arises?🔽(The same question is to be asked of the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the femininity faculty, the masculinity faculty, the life faculty, the joy faculty, the base-of-all faculty, the faith faculty, the energy faculty, the mindfulness faculty, the concentration faculty, and the wisdom faculty.)

original: 10.2.1.2.2. Anulomaokāsa🔽Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha sotindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: anuloma okāsa  yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tattha sotindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: ..... Anulomaokāsa🔽Where the eye faculty arises, does the ear faculty arise there too?🔽Or where the ear faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise there too?

original: Yattha vā pana sotindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana sotindriyam uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā 🔽yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Where the eye faculty arises, does the nose faculty arise there too?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacare tattha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha no ca tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha kāmāvacare tattha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjittha ghāna indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the fine-material sphere, there is the arising of the eye faculty there, but not the arising of the nose faculty there. In the sense-sphere realm, there is the arising of both the eye faculty and the nose faculty there.

original: Yattha vā pana ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where there is the arising of the nose faculty, is there the arising of the eye faculty there?

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Where there is the arising of the eye faculty, is there the arising of the femininity faculty there … the masculinity faculty there?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacare tattha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjittha.🔽Yattha vā pana purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha no ca tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha kāmāvacare tattha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha  yattha vā pana purisa indriyam uppajjittha tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: In the fine-material sphere, there is the arising of the eye faculty there, but not the arising of the masculinity faculty there. In the sense-sphere realm, there is the arising of both the eye faculty and the masculinity faculty there.🔽Where there is the arising of the masculinity faculty, is there the arising of the eye faculty there?

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where there is the arising of the eye faculty, is there the arising of the life faculty there?

original: Yattha vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or where the life faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise there?

original: Asaññasatte arūpe tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha. Pañcavokāre tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: asaññasatte arūpe tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha pañcavokāre tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the immaterial state, there the life faculty arises, but there the eye faculty does not arise. In the five-constituent becoming, there both the life faculty and the eye faculty arise.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yattha vā pana somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yattha vā pana somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where the eye faculty arises, does the joy faculty arise there?🔽Or where the joy faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise there?

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where the eye faculty arises, does the equanimity faculty arise there?

original: Yattha vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or where the equanimity faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise there?

original: Arūpe tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha. Pañcavokāre tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: arūpe tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha pañcavokāre tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the immaterial sphere, there is the arising of the equanimity faculty, but there is no arising of the eye faculty. In the five-constituent kind of becoming, there is the arising of both the equanimity faculty and the eye faculty.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where there is the arising of the eye faculty, there is the arising of the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty, is it the case that there is the arising of the mind faculty?

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or where there is the arising of the mind faculty, is it the case that there is the arising of the eye faculty?

original: Arūpe tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha. Pañcavokāre tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.

translated: In the immaterial sphere, there is the arising of the mind faculty, but there is no arising of the eye faculty. original: Yattha vā pana purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana purisa indriyam uppajjittha tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or where there is the arising of the masculinity faculty, is it the case that there is the arising of the nose faculty?

original: Yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.

original: Yattha vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?

original: Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacare tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.

analyzed: yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati  rūpa avacarānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriya
translated: When the eye faculty arises in a person, does the nose faculty arise in him too?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material sphere, the eye faculty arises in them but the nose faculty does not arise in them.

original: uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjittha ghāna indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the sense sphere, both the eye faculty and the nose faculty arise in them.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or when the nose faculty arises in a person, does the eye faculty arise in him too? Yes.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacarānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha purisa indriya
translated: When someone has obtained the eye faculty in a certain existence, has he obtained the femininity faculty in that existence?

original: uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: Those in the fine-material sphere have obtained the eye faculty in that existence, but they have not obtained the femininity faculty in that existence. Those in the sense-sphere have obtained the eye faculty in that existence and they have obtained the femininity faculty in that existence.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: But when someone has obtained the femininity faculty in a certain existence, has he obtained the eye faculty in that existence?🔽When someone has obtained the eye faculty in a certain existence, has he obtained the life faculty in that existence?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: But when someone has obtained the life faculty in a certain existence, has he obtained the eye faculty in that existence?

original: Asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: Those in the immaterial sphere have obtained the life faculty in that existence, but they have not obtained the eye faculty in that existence.

original: cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha. Pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha pañcavokārānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: the eye faculty has arisen. For those having five faculties, there the faculties of life,

original: cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: cakkhu indriyañca uppajjittha  yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: and of the eye have arisen.🔽“When someone’s eye faculty has arisen, has his happy faculty also arisen?” Answer: “Yes.”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “Or when someone’s happy faculty has arisen, has his eye faculty also arisen?” Answer: “Yes.”🔽“When someone’s eye faculty has arisen, has his equanimity faculty also arisen?” Answer: “Yes.”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: “Or when someone’s equanimity faculty has arisen, has his eye faculty also arisen?”

original: Arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ
analyzed: arūpānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhundriya
translated: For those in the formless realms, there the equanimity faculty has arisen, but not the eye faculty.

original: uppajjittha. Pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjittha pañcavokārānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: For those having five faculties, there both the equanimity faculty and the eye faculty have arisen.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Has the eye faculty arisen in anyone in whom the ear faculty has arisen? … the nose faculty … the tongue faculty … the body faculty … the mind faculty has arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Has the mind faculty arisen in anyone in whom the eye faculty has arisen?

original: Arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha.
analyzed: arūpānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha
translated: In those in the immaterial sphere, the mind faculty has arisen, but the eye faculty has not arisen.

original: Pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: pañcavokārānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In those in the five-constituent becoming, both the mind faculty and the eye faculty have arisen.

original: (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: cakkhu indriya mūlaka  yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: (Eye Faculty)🔽Has the nose faculty arisen in anyone in whom the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty has arisen?🔽Has the masculinity faculty arisen in anyone in whom the nose faculty has arisen?

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Has the life faculty arisen in anyone in whom the nose faculty has arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or does the nose-faculty arise in one in whom the life-faculty arises?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In those in the fine-material sphere and the immaterial sphere the life-faculty arises, but not the nose-faculty.

original: ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: ghānindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In those in the sense sphere the life-faculty arises and also the nose-faculty.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: In those in whom the nose-faculty arises, does the joy-faculty arise?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or in those in whom the joy-faculty arises, does the nose-faculty arise?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ
analyzed: rūpa avacarānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriya
translated: In those in the fine-material sphere the joy-faculty arises, but not the nose-faculty.

original: uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha ghānindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In those in the sense sphere the joy-faculty arises and also the nose-faculty.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Is it the case that when the nose faculty arises in a certain person, the equanimity faculty arises in that person?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or is it the case that when the equanimity faculty arises in a certain person, the nose faculty arises in that person?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material sphere and the immaterial sphere, the equanimity faculty arises in them, but not the nose faculty.

original: ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: ghānindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the sense sphere, the equanimity faculty arises in them and also the nose faculty.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Is it the case that when the nose faculty arises in a certain person, the faith faculty arises in that person?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha saddhi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or is it the case that when the faith faculty arises in a certain person, the nose faculty arises in that person?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material sphere and the immaterial sphere, the faith faculty arises in them, but not the nose faculty.

original: tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: Herein, the nose faculty arises.

original: ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: ghānindriyam ca uppajjittha  yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: The faith faculty and the nose faculty arise.🔽“When the nose faculty arises in a certain person, does the mind faculty also arise in him?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghān indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: “When the mind faculty arises in a certain person, does the nose faculty also arise in him?”

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha  ghāna indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjittha ghāna indriyam ca
translated: The mind faculty arises in those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, but the nose faculty does not arise in them.🔽The mind faculty and the nose faculty arise in those in the sensual realm.

original: uppajjittha. (Ghānindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjittha ghāna indriya mūlaka
translated: (The nose faculty is to be combined with the mind faculty in the same way as the eye faculty was combined with it.)

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “When the female faculty arises in a certain person, does the male faculty also arise in him?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā …pe….🔽Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā pe  yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or does the femininity faculty arise in one in whom the masculinity faculty arises?🔽In all those in whom the masculinity faculty arises, the life faculty arises.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or does the masculinity faculty arise in one in whom the life faculty arises?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial realms, the life faculty arises in them but the masculinity faculty does not.

original: purisindriyañca uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: puris indriyam ca uppajjittha  yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: In the sensual realm, the life faculty arises in them and the masculinity faculty arises.🔽In all those in whom the masculinity faculty arises, the femininity faculty arises.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or does the femininity faculty arise in one in whom the masculinity faculty arises?🔽In all those in whom the masculinity faculty arises, the happiness faculty arises.🔽Or does the masculinity faculty arise in one in whom the happiness faculty arises?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ🔽uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: rūpa avacarānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha purisa indriya  uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those of the fine-material sphere, their faculty of joy arises there but not their faculty of man.🔽In the case of those of the sensual-sphere, their faculty of joy and their faculty of man arise there.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: In the case of those in whom the faculty of man arises, there arises also the faculty of equanimity … the faculty of faith … the faculty of understanding … the faculty of mind.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those in whom the faculty of mind arises, there arises also the faculty of man.🔽In the case of those of the fine-material sphere and those of the immaterial sphere, their faculty of mind arises there but not their faculty of man.

original: purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca
analyzed: purisa indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca
translated: In the case of those of the sensual sphere, their faculty of mind and their faculty of man arise there.

original: uppajjittha. (Purisindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjittha purisa indriya mūlaka
translated: (The section on the faculty of man is finished.)

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Is it the case that when the life faculty has arisen in any given instance, so too has the joy faculty?

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ dutiye citte vattamāne asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha,
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam dutiye citte vattamāne asaññasattānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the second absorption of the Pure Abodes, and in the case of those in the non-percipient realm, the life faculty has arisen,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam
translated: but not the joy faculty. In the case of those in the four and five-constituent type of existence,

original: tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: both the life faculty and the joy faculty have arisen.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or is it the case that when the joy faculty has arisen in any given instance, so too has the life faculty?🔽In the case of those in the first absorption, and in the case of those in the four and five-constituent type of existence, the joy faculty has arisen,🔽but not the life faculty. In the case of those in the second absorption of the Pure Abodes, and in the case of those in the non-percipient realm, and in the case of those in the four and five-constituent type of existence,🔽both the joy faculty and the life faculty have arisen.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Is it the case that when the life faculty has arisen in any given instance, so too has the equanimity faculty?🔽In the case of those in the non-percipient realm, the life faculty has arisen,

original: Asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriya
translated: but not the equanimity faculty. In the case of those in the four and five-constituent type of existence,

original: uppajjittha. Catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: uppajjittha catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: both the life faculty and the equanimity faculty have arisen.

original: upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha  yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: and the equanimity faculty has arisen.🔽Is it the case that whenever the equanimity faculty has arisen, the life faculty has arisen?

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam uppajjittha ati  asaññasattānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha paññindriya
translated: Is it the case that whenever the life faculty has arisen, the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty has arisen?🔽In the case of those without thought, the life faculty has arisen there but the wisdom faculty has not arisen.

original: uppajjittha. Catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: uppajjittha catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those with four faculties and those with five faculties, the life faculty has arisen and

original: paññindriyañca uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: paññindriyañca uppajjittha  yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha manindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: the wisdom faculty has arisen.🔽Is it the case that whenever the wisdom faculty has arisen, the life faculty has arisen?🔽Is it the case that whenever the life faculty has arisen, the mind faculty has arisen?

original: Asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha manindriya
translated: In the case of those without thought, the life faculty has arisen there but the mind faculty has not arisen.

original: uppajjittha. Catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: uppajjittha catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: in the case of those of four and five bases, there the life faculty and

original: manindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: manindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: the mind faculty arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā jīvitindriya mūlaka
translated: Or, in the case of those in whom the mind faculty arises, there the life faculty arises.🔽(The life faculty is the root.)

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: In the case of those in whom the joy faculty arises, there the equanimity faculty arises.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsānaṁ dutiye citte vattamāne tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsānam dutiye citte vattamāne tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no
translated: Or, in the case of those in whom the equanimity faculty arises, there the joy faculty arises.🔽In the case of those in the second conscious moment in the Pure Abodes, there the equanimity faculty arises,

original: ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ
analyzed: ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam
translated: but there the joy faculty does not arise. In the case of those of four and five bases,

original: tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: there the equanimity faculty and the joy faculty arise.

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When someone has the joy faculty arisen there, does he have the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty arisen there?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or when someone has the mind faculty arisen there, does he have the joy faculty arisen there?

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ dutiye citte vattamāne tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca🔽tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam dutiye citte vattamāne tesam tattha man indriyam uppajjittha no ca  tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam
translated: When the second consciousness of the Pure Abodes is occurring, there is the mind faculty arisen there, but there is no joy faculty arisen there.

original: tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ ca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjittha somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha somanassindriya mūlaka
translated: When the first consciousness of the fourfold and fivefold groups is occurring, there is the mind faculty arisen there, and there is also the joy faculty arisen there.

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When someone has the equanimity faculty arisen there, does he have the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty arisen there?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā upekkhindriya mūlaka  yassa yattha saddhi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā saddhindriya mūlaka  yassa yattha paññindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
