original: 10.2.1.2.4. Paccanīkapuggala
analyzed: paccanīka puggala
translated: In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa sotindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa sotindriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.🔽In all.

original: Yassa vā pana sotindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa vā pana sota indriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi  yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: Or does anyone in whom the ear faculty does not arise not have the eye faculty? None.🔽“When someone does not have the nose faculty, does he not have the eye faculty? None.

original: Yassa vā pana ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa vā pana ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi  yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: Or does anyone in whom the eye faculty does not arise not have the nose faculty? None.🔽“When someone does not have the eye faculty, does he not have the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty? None.

original: Yassa vā pana purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.🔽Yassa vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa vā pana purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi  yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi  yassa vā pana jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: Or does anyone in whom the masculinity faculty does not arise not have the eye faculty? None.🔽“When someone does not have the eye faculty, does he not have the life faculty? None.🔽Or does anyone in whom the life faculty does not arise not have the eye faculty? None.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: “When someone does not have the eye faculty, does he not have the joy faculty? None.

original: Yassa vā pana somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa vā pana somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi  yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: Or, if the joy faculty does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise? There is none.🔽If the eye faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty not arise? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhā indriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: Or, if the equanimity faculty does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise? There is none.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: If the eye faculty does not arise, does the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty not arise? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi cakkhundriya mūlaka
translated: Or, if the mind faculty does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise? There is none. (Eye Faculty)

original: Yassa ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ … jīvitindriyaṁ🔽… somanassindriyaṁ … upekkhindriyaṁ … saddhindriyaṁ … paññindriyaṁ … manindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam
translated: If the nose faculty does not arise, does the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty … the life faculty …

original: na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: the joy faculty … the equanimity faculty … the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty not arise? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi …pe….🔽Yassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa vā pana man indriyam na uppajjittha tassa gha an indriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi pe  yassa paññindriyam na uppajjittha tassa manindriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: Or is it the case that for one in whom the mind faculty does not arise, the nose faculty does not arise? There is none.🔽For one in whom the wisdom faculty does not arise, the mind faculty does not arise. There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa paññindriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi paññindriya mūlaka
translated: Or is it the case that for one in whom the mind faculty does not arise, the wisdom faculty does not arise? There is none. (The section based on the wisdom faculty is to be expanded in the same way.)

original: 10.2.1.2.5. Paccanīkaokāsa
analyzed: paccanīka okāsa
translated: .... The reverse order

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yattha vā pana sotindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tattha sotindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā  yattha vā pana sotindriyam na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Is it the case that where the eye faculty does not arise, the ear faculty does not arise? Yes.🔽Or is it the case that where the ear faculty does not arise, the eye faculty does not arise? Yes.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Is it the case that where the eye faculty does not arise, the nose faculty does not arise? Yes.

original: Yattha vā pana ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or is it the case that where the nose faculty does not arise, the eye faculty does not arise?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Asaññasatte arūpe tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha asaññasatte arūpe tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the fine-material sphere, the nose faculty does not arise there, but the eye faculty does arise there. In the immaterial state and in the case of the non-percipient beings, neither the nose faculty nor the eye faculty arises.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where the eye faculty does not arise, there the ear faculty … the nose faculty … the tongue faculty … the body faculty … the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty does not arise, does it?

original: Yattha vā pana purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or where the masculinity faculty does not arise, there the eye faculty does not arise?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Asaññasatte arūpe tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha asaññasatte arūpe tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the fine-material sphere, the masculinity faculty does not arise there, but the eye faculty does arise there. In the immaterial state and in the case of the non-percipient beings, neither the masculinity faculty nor the eye faculty arises.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: Where the eye faculty does not arise, there the life faculty does not arise, does it? It arises.

original: Yattha vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.🔽Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi  yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or where the life faculty does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise there? There is none.🔽Where the eye faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty not arise there? Yes.

original: Yattha vā pana somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or where the joy faculty does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise there? Yes.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Where the eye faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty not arise there?

original: Arūpe tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Asaññasatte tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: arūpe tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha no ca tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha asaññasatte tattha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the formless, there the eye faculty does not arise, but there the equanimity faculty does not not arise. In the immaterial beings, there both the eye faculty and the equanimity faculty do not arise.

original: Yattha vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or where the equanimity faculty does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise there? Yes.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “Where there is no arising of the eye faculty, is there no arising of the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty?”

original: Arūpe tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Asaññasatte tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: arūpe tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha no ca tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha asaññasatte tattha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjittha manindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the formless, there is no arising of the eye faculty, but there is no non-arising of the mind faculty. In the case of the non-percipient beings, there is no arising of the eye faculty and there is no arising of the mind faculty.

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā cakkhundriya mūlaka  yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “Where there is no arising of the mind faculty, is there no arising of the eye faculty?” The reverse is to be stated. (Eye faculty.)🔽“Where there is no arising of the nose faculty, is there no arising of the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty?” The reverse is to be stated.

original: Yattha vā pana purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “Where there is no arising of the masculinity faculty, is there no arising of the nose faculty?” The reverse is to be stated.

original: Yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: “Where there is no arising of the nose faculty, is there no arising of the life faculty?” It arises.

original: Yattha vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yattha vā pana jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: Where the life faculty does not arise, does the nose faculty not arise there? There is none.

original: Yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Where the nose faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty not arise there?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.🔽Asaññasatte arūpe tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha  asaññasatte arūpe tattha ghāna indriyañca na uppajjittha somanassa indriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: In the fine-material sphere, the nose faculty does not arise there, but the joy faculty does not not arise there.🔽In the immaterial and non-percipient beings, the nose faculty does not arise, and the joy faculty does not arise there.

original: Yattha vā pana somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where the joy faculty does not arise, does the nose faculty not arise there? In the sensuous realm, the joy faculty does not arise there, but the nose faculty does not not arise there.

original: Yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Where the nose faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty not arise there?

original: Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tattha upekkhindriyaṁ
analyzed: rūpāvacare arūpāvacare tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tattha upekkhindriya
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial spheres, the nose faculty does not arise there, but the equanimity faculty does not not arise there.

analyzed: yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacare tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tattha somanassa indriyam na
translated: Where the male faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty not arise there?

analyzed: uppajjittha asaññasatte arūpe tattha purisa indriyañca na uppajjittha somanassa indriyañca na uppajjittha

In the immaterial and non-percipient beings, the male faculty does not arise, and the joy faculty does not arise there.🔽Or where the joy faculty does not arise, does the male faculty not arise there?

original: Yattha vā pana somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā

analyzed: yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacare arūpāvacare tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tattha upekkhindriya
translated: “Where the male faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty not arise there?🔽In the fine-material and immaterial realms, the male faculty does not arise there, but the equanimity faculty does.

original: na uppajjittha. Asaññasatte tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjittha asaññasatte tattha purisa indriyañca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of the non-percipient beings, the male faculty does not arise there, and the equanimity faculty does not arise there.

original: Yattha vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “Where the equanimity faculty does not arise, does the male faculty not arise there?

original: Yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “Where the male faculty does not arise, does the faith faculty not arise there? …🔽In the fine-material and immaterial realms, the male faculty does not arise there, but the mind faculty does.

original: Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Asaññasatte tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: rūpāvacare arūpāvacare tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha asaññasatte tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjittha manindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of the non-percipient beings, the male faculty does not arise there, and the mind faculty does not arise there.

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Purisindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā purisa indriya mūlaka
translated: Or where the mind faculty does not arise, there the male faculty does not arise? Answer: No. (The section based on the male faculty.)

original: Yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.
analyzed: yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi
translated: Where the life faculty does not arise, there the joy faculty does not arise? No such case exists.

original: Yattha vā pana somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yattha vā pana somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: Or where the joy faculty does not arise, there the life faculty does not arise? It arises.

original: Yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Natthi.🔽Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati natthi  yattha vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha jīvitindriya mūlaka
translated: Where the life faculty does not arise, there the equanimity faculty … the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty does not arise? No such case exists.🔽Or where the mind faculty does not arise, there the life faculty does not arise? It arises. (The section based on the life faculty.)

original: Yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where the joy faculty does not arise, there the equanimity faculty does not arise? Answer: Yes.

original: Yattha vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or where the equanimity faculty does not arise, there the joy faculty does not arise? The same.

original: Yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where the joy faculty does not arise, there the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty does not arise? The same.

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā somanassindriya mūlaka
translated: Or where the mind faculty does not arise, there the joy faculty does not arise? The same. (The base of joy.)

original: Yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where the equanimity faculty does not arise, there the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty does not arise? The same.

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā upekkhindriya mūlaka
translated: Or where the mind faculty does not arise, there the equanimity faculty does not arise? The same. (The base of equanimity.)

original: Yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjittha tattha paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where the faith faculty does not arise, there the understanding faculty … the mind faculty does not arise? The same.

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā saddhindriya mūlaka  yattha paññindriyam na uppajjittha tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or where the mind faculty does not arise, there the faith faculty does not arise? Yes. (The faith faculty.)🔽Where the wisdom faculty does not arise, there the mind faculty does not arise? Yes.

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tattha paññindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā paññindriya mūlaka
translated: Or where the mind faculty does not arise, there the wisdom faculty does not arise? Yes. (The wisdom faculty.)

original: 10.2.1.2.6. Paccanīkapuggalokāsa🔽Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: paccanīka puggala okāsa  yassa yattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha sotindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: .... The reverse order of persons and bases🔽Where the eye faculty does not arise, there the ear faculty does not arise? Yes.🔽Or where the ear faculty does not arise, there the eye faculty does not arise? Yes.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Where the eye faculty does not arise, there the nose faculty does not arise? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ🔽na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati  rūpa avacarānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriya  na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca
translated: Or, if anyone’s nose-faculty does not arise in a certain state, his eye-faculty does not arise there?

original: na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjittha cakkhu indriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the form realm, his nose-faculty does not arise there, but his eye-faculty does arise there. In the case of those in the pure abodes, non-percipient beings, and the formless realm, his nose-faculty does not arise there, and his eye-faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: If anyone’s eye-faculty does not arise in a certain state, his femininity faculty … his masculinity faculty does not arise there?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati  rūpa avacarānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriya
translated: Or, if anyone’s masculinity faculty does not arise in a certain state, his eye-faculty does not arise there?

original: na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca
analyzed: na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha purisa indriyañca
translated: In the case of those in the form realm, his masculinity faculty does not arise there, but his eye-faculty does arise there. In the case of those in the pure abodes, non-percipient beings, and the formless realm, his masculinity faculty does not arise there, and his eye-faculty does not arise there.

original: na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjittha cakkhu indriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: but not the eye faculty.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati  asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: When someone does not acquire the eye faculty, does he not acquire the life faculty?

original: jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha
analyzed: jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjittha

analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā

translated: “When anyone’s eye faculty does not arise, does his equanimity faculty not arise?🔽“Those in the formless realm, for whom the eye faculty does not arise, for them the equanimity faculty does not arise.

translated: For those in the Pure Abodes and non-percipient beings, for whom the eye faculty does not arise, for them the equanimity faculty does not arise.🔽“When anyone’s equanimity faculty does not arise, does his eye faculty not arise?

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ

translated: “When anyone’s eye faculty does not arise, does his faith faculty … his mindfulness faculty … his concentration faculty … his wisdom faculty … his mind faculty not arise?

original: na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha
analyzed: na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjittha

original: manindriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.

translated: and the mind faculty has arisen, the eye faculty has not arisen.🔽Or, where the mind faculty has not arisen, the eye faculty has not arisen there? Answer: Yes.🔽Where the nose faculty has not arisen, the female faculty … the male faculty has not arisen there? Answer: Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā

analyzed: uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: has not arisen there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or does the nose faculty not arise in one in whom the life faculty has arisen?

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati  rūpa avacarānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriya  na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca
translated: In whom the nose faculty does not arise, in him the joy faculty does not arise.

original: na uppajjittha somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjittha somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material sphere, the nose faculty does not arise in them, but the joy faculty does not not arise in them. In the case of those in the Pure Abodes and non-percipient beings and the immaterial-sphere, the nose faculty does not arise in them, and the joy faculty does not arise in them.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or in whom the joy faculty does not arise, in him the nose faculty does not arise?

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: In whom the nose faculty does not arise, in him the equanimity faculty does not arise.🔽In the case of those in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, the nose faculty does not arise in them, but the equanimity faculty does not not arise in them.

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes, the nose faculty does not arise in them, and the equanimity faculty does not arise in them.

original: tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha ghānindriyañca

original: na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjittha

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? translated: But in the case of those in the immaterial becoming, the nose faculty does not arise,🔽and neither does the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty.🔽In the case of those in the fine-material becoming and in the immaterial becoming, the nose faculty does not arise,

original: tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: tattha man indriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyañca
translated: but the mind faculty does arise. In the case of those in the Pure Abodes and in the case of non-percipient beings, the nose faculty does not arise,

original: na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: and neither does the mind faculty.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Ghānindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.

translated: Or, if anyone’s nose faculty does not arise in a certain state, his mind faculty does not arise there?🔽(The nose faculty is to be combined with the mind faculty in the same way as the eye faculty.)🔽If anyone’s femininity faculty does not arise in a certain state, his masculinity faculty does not arise there?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā …pe….
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā pe
translated: Or, if anyone’s masculinity faculty does not arise in a certain state, his femininity faculty does not arise there?

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na

translated: If anyone’s masculinity faculty does not arise in a certain state, his life faculty does not arise there?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, their masculinity faculty does not arise there, but their life faculty does arise there.

original: uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes, their masculinity faculty does not arise there, and their life faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or, where the faculty of life is not arisen, is there the faculty of manliness not arisen? Yes.

original: na uppajjittha somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjittha somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the form worlds, there the faculty of manliness is not arisen, but there the faculty of joy is not non-arisen. original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or, where the faculty of joy is not arisen, is there the faculty of manliness not arisen? Yes.

analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā purisa indriya mūlaka
translated: Or, if anyone’s mind faculty does not arise in any given case, his man’s faculty does not arise in that case?🔽The same method applies to the man’s faculty.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: If anyone’s life faculty does not arise in any given case, his joy faculty does not arise in that case?🔽The same method applies to the joy faculty.

analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati

analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca na uppajjittha jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: his joy faculty does not arise in that case, and his life faculty does not arise in that case.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Has anyone’s life faculty not arisen when his equanimity faculty has? … his faith faculty? … his mindfulness faculty? … his concentration faculty? … his understanding faculty? … his mind faculty?

original: Asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriya  na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha manindriyaṃ ca
translated: Has anyone’s mind faculty not arisen when his life faculty has?🔽In the case of those without perception, their mind faculty has not arisen, but their life faculty has.

original: na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjittha. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na uppajjittha jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjittha jīvitindriya mūlaka
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes whose rebirth-linking consciousness has arisen, their mind faculty and their life faculty have not arisen.

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Has anyone’s equanimity faculty not arisen when his joy faculty has?

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ dutiye citte vattamāne tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha,🔽no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam dutiye citte vattamāne tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha  no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam asaññasattānam
translated: When the second type of mind occurs in the Pure Abodes, then in their case the faculty of joy does not arise,🔽but their faculty of mind does arise. When those reappearing in the Pure Abodes and in the Non-percipient Beings

original: tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca na uppajjittha manindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: in their case the faculty of joy does not arise and the faculty of mind does not arise.🔽Or anyone else’s in any other case?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā somanassindriya mūlaka
translated: When anyone’s faculty of mind does not arise, in that case his faculty of joy does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When anyone’s faculty of equanimity does not arise, in that case his faculty of faith … his faculty of understanding … his faculty of mind does not arise?🔽Or anyone else’s in any other case?🔽When anyone’s faculty of mind does not arise, in that case his faculty of equanimity does not arise?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā upekkhindriya mūlaka
translated: Or anyone else’s in any other case?

original: Yassa yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā saddhindriya mūlaka
translated: “When someone has not made an end of suffering and stress, has he not made an end of the eye faculty? Has he not made an end of the ear faculty? Has he not made an end of the nose faculty? Has he not made an end of the tongue faculty? Has he not made an end of the body faculty? Has he not made an end of the intellect faculty?”

original: Yassa yattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha paññindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “When someone has not made an end of the intellect faculty, has he not made an end of the eye faculty? Has he not made an end of the ear faculty? Has he not made an end of the nose faculty? Has he not made an end of the tongue faculty? Has he not made an end of the body faculty? Has he not made an end of the intellect faculty?”🔽“When someone has not made an end of the intellect faculty, has he not made an end of the body faculty?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽10.2.1.3. Anāgatavāra
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyam na uppajjittha ati āmantā paññindriya mūlaka  anāgatavāra
translated: “When someone has not made an end of the body faculty, has he not made an end of the intellect faculty?”🔽The future method

original: 10.2.1.3.1. Anulomapuggala🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa sotindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: anuloma puggala  yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tassa sotindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: The forward progression for individuals🔽“When someone’s eye faculty will arise, will his ear faculty arise?”

original: Yassa vā pana sotindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana sotindriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: “When someone’s ear faculty will arise, will his eye faculty arise?”

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tassa ghāna indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When the eye faculty arises in him, does the nose faculty arise in him?

original: Ye rūpāvacaraṁ upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati, no
analyzed: ye rūpāvacaram upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati no
translated: In those who arise in the fine-material sphere and attain Nibbāna there, the eye faculty arises, but the nose faculty does not arise. In the others it arises.

original: ca tesaṁ ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati ghānindriyañca uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: ca tesam ghāna indriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjissati ghāna indriyam ca uppajjissati  yassa vā pana ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: In those in whom the nose faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise? In those in whom the eye faculty arises, does the ear faculty arise?🔽In those who arise in the fine-material sphere and attain Nibbāna there, the eye faculty arises, but the ear faculty does not arise. In the others it arises.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa itthindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Ye rūpāvacaraṁ upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti ye ca purisā eteneva bhāvena katici
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tassa itthi indriyam uppajjissati iti  ye rūpāvacaram upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti ye ca purisāḥ etena iva bhāvena katicid
translated: In those in whom the eye faculty arises, does the femininity faculty arise?

original: bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ itthindriyaṁ🔽uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati itthindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam itthi indriya 🔽uppajjissati itaresam tesam cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In those who arise in the fine-material sphere and attain Nibbāna there, and in those who, as males, will attain Nibbāna in that same existence, the eye faculty arises, but the femininity faculty does not arise. In the others it arises.

original: Yassa vā pana itthindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana itthi indriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: Or, if the femininity faculty arises in anyone, does the eye faculty arise in him?

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa purisindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Ye rūpāvacaraṁ upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tassa purisa indriyam uppajjissati iti  ye rūpāvacaram upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti yā ca itthiyo etena iva bhāvena katicid
translated: If the eye faculty arises in anyone, does the masculinity faculty arise in him?

original: bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ purisindriyaṁ
analyzed: bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam purisa indriya
translated: In those due to arise in the fine-material sphere and attain extinction there, and in those women who, after manifesting this or that plane, attain extinction in that same state of existence, the eye faculty will arise, but not the masculinity faculty.

original: uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati purisindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjissati itaresam tesam cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjissati purisa indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the others the eye faculty will arise and the masculinity faculty will also arise.

original: Yassa vā pana purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana purisa indriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā  yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: Or, if the masculinity faculty arises in anyone, does the eye faculty arise in him?🔽If the eye faculty arises in anyone, does the life faculty arise in him?

original: Yassa vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana jīvitindriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Or, if the life faculty arises in anyone, does the eye faculty arise in him?

original: Ye arūpaṁ upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: ye arūpam upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam jīvitindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: For those who will attain Nibbāna without exertion after arising in the formless world, the life faculty will arise in them, but not

original: cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: cakkhundriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: the eye faculty. For the rest, the life faculty will arise in them and the eye faculty will also arise.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Ye sacakkhukā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati,
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tassa somanassa indriyam uppajjissati iti  ye sa cakkhukāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati
translated: “When the eye faculty arises in a person, does the joy faculty also arise in that person?”🔽For those who, possessing eyes, will attain Nibbāna through exertion after arising in the realm of neither perception nor non-perception, the eye faculty will arise in them,

original: no ca tesaṁ somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati
analyzed: no ca tesam somanassa indriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: but not the joy faculty. For the rest, the eye faculty will arise in them and

original: somanassindriyañca uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: somanassindriyañca uppajjissati  yassa vā pana somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: the joy faculty will also arise.🔽“When the joy faculty arises in a person, does the eye faculty also arise in that person?”

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tassa upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: “When the eye faculty arises in a person, does the equanimity faculty also arise in that person?”

original: Ye sacakkhukā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati,
analyzed: ye sa cakkhukā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati
translated: Those who are due to reappear in a happy destination through a happy mind and will attain Nibbāna there without ever returning from that world — for them the eye faculty will arise.

original: no ca tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati
analyzed: no ca tesam upekkhindriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam cakkhundriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: But for them the equanimity faculty will not arise. For the rest, the eye faculty will arise and

original: upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: the equanimity faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: “Those for whom the equanimity faculty will arise, will their eye faculty arise?”

original: Ye arūpaṁ upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca🔽tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: ye arūpam upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam upekkhindriyam uppajjissati no ca  tesam cakkhundriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca uppajjissati  yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: Those who will attain Nibbāna without ever returning from the realm of infinite consciousness — for them the equanimity faculty will arise, but not🔽the eye faculty. For the rest, the equanimity faculty will arise and the eye faculty will arise.🔽“Those for whom the eye faculty will arise, will their faith faculty … their mindfulness faculty … their concentration faculty … their wisdom faculty … their mind faculty arise?”

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: “Those for whom the mind faculty will arise, will their eye faculty arise?”

original: Ye arūpaṁ upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ🔽cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ manindriyañca uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: ye arūpam upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam  cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam manindriyam ca uppajjissati cakkhu indriyam ca
translated: Of those who will be reborn in the formless (world) and will attain Parinibbāna there, the mind faculty will arise, but not🔽their eye faculty. For the rest, their mind faculty will arise and their eye faculty will also arise.

original: uppajjissati. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjissati cakkhu indriya mūlaka
translated: (The same method applies as in the case of the eye faculty.)

original: Yassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa itthindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa gha an indriyam uppajjissati tassa itthi indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: For those who will arise from the nose faculty, will the femininity faculty arise?

original: Ye purisā eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ ghānindriyaṁ🔽uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ itthindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ ghānindriyañca
analyzed: ye purisāḥ etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesam gha an indriya  uppajjissati no ca tesam itthi indriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam ghāna indriyam ca
translated: For those who are men, who will attain Parinibbāna in this very existence, their nose faculty will arise, but not

original: uppajjissati itthindriyañca uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana itthindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca uppajjissati  yassa vā pana itthi indriyam uppajjissati tassa gha an indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: their femininity faculty. For the rest, their nose faculty will arise and their femininity faculty will also arise.🔽For those who will arise from the femininity faculty, will their nose faculty arise?

original: Yassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa purisindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tassa purisa indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: For those who will arise from the nose faculty, will the masculinity faculty arise?

original: Yā itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tāsaṁ ghānindriyaṁ
analyzed: yāḥ itthiyaḥ etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tāsam gha an indriya
translated: The nose-faculty will arise in those women who, after manifesting this state, will attain Nibbāna in that same existence.

original: uppajjissati, no ca tāsaṁ purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ ghānindriyañca
analyzed: uppajjissati no ca tāsam purisa indriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam ghāna indriyam ca
translated: The nose-faculty will arise in them, but the male faculty will not arise. The nose-faculty will arise in those who are not women,

original: uppajjissati purisindriyañca uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: uppajjissati purisa indriyañca uppajjissati  yassa vā pana purisa indriyam uppajjissati tassa gha an indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: and the male faculty will arise in those who are men.🔽“Those in whom the male faculty will arise, will their nose-faculty arise?”

original: Yassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: “Those in whom the nose-faculty will arise, will their life faculty arise?”

original: Yassa vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana jīvitindriyam uppajjissati tassa ghānindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: “Those in whom the life faculty will arise, will their nose-faculty arise?”

original: Ye rūpāvacaraṁ arūpāvacaraṁ upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati,
analyzed: ye rūpāvacaram arūpāvacaram upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam jīvitindriyam uppajjissati
translated: The life faculty will arise in those who will attain Nibbāna through non-percipient attainment,

original: no ca tesaṁ ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati
analyzed: no ca tesam ghāna indriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: but their nose-faculty will not arise. The life faculty will arise in those who are not women,

original: ghānindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: ghānindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: and their nose-faculty will arise.

original: Yassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tassa somanassa indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: If the nose faculty arises in anyone, does the joy faculty arise in them?

original: Ye saghānakā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati,
analyzed: ye sa ghānakāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam ghāna indriyam uppajjissati
translated: In those who, being of a sensual realm, having been arisen with equanimity, will attain Nibbāna, the nose faculty will arise in them.

original: no ca tesaṁ somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ ghānindriyañca uppajjissati🔽somanassindriyañca uppajjissati.

translated: Those who will arise in the form or formless worlds and attain final Nibbāna there, and those women who will attain final Nibbāna in the same state in which they were reborn, will have the equanimity faculty arising,🔽but they will not have the male faculty arising. Those who will arise in the form or formless worlds and attain final Nibbāna there, and those men who will attain final Nibbāna in the same state in which they were reborn, will have the equanimity faculty arising🔽and the male faculty arising.🔽As to those in whom the male faculty arises, in all of them the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty arises.🔽As to those in whom the mind faculty arises, in all of them the male faculty arises.🔽Those who will arise in the form or formless worlds and attain final Nibbāna there, and those women who will attain final Nibbāna in the same state in which they were reborn, will have the equanimity faculty arising,🔽but they will not have the male faculty arising.

original: purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ manindriyañca uppajjissati purisindriyañca
analyzed: purisa indriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam manindriyam ca uppajjissati purisa indriyam ca
translated: the male faculty will arise. In the case of the rest of them, both the mind faculty and the male faculty will arise.

original: uppajjissati. (Purisindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjissati purisa indriya mūlaka
translated: the male faculty will arise. In the remaining of those whose life faculty will arise, the mind faculty will arise and the male faculty will arise.🔽(The section based on the male faculty.)

original: Yassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa jīvitindriyam uppajjissati tassa somanassindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When the life faculty arises, does the joy faculty arise?

original: Yassa cittassa anantarā upekkhāsampayuttapacchimacittaṁ uppajjissati tesaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ🔽uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ jīvitindriyañca
analyzed: yassa cittassa anantarā upekkhā sampayutta pacchimacittam uppajjissati tesam jīvitindriya  uppajjissati no ca tesam somanassindriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam jīvitindriyañca
translated: For those who, immediately after the mind that is accompanied by equanimity, will arise in the last mind, the life faculty will arise.

original: uppajjissati somanassindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjissati somanassindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: But for them the joy faculty will not arise. In the remaining of those whose life faculty will arise, the life faculty will arise and the joy faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: When the joy faculty arises, does the life faculty arise?

original: Yassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa jīvitindriyam uppajjissati tassa upekkhindriyam uppajjissati iti

analyzed: yassa cittassa anantarā somanassa sampayutta pacchimacittam uppajjissati tesam jīvitindriya
translated: For those who, immediately after the mind that is accompanied by joy, will arise in the last mind, the life faculty will arise.

original: uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ jīvitindriyañca🔽uppajjissati upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati.

original: Yassa vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhindriyam uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: But for those in whom the equanimity faculty arises, will their life faculty arise? It may arise.

original: Yassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa jīvitindriyam uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: For those in whom the life faculty arises, will their faith faculty … their mindfulness faculty … their concentration faculty … their wisdom faculty … their mind faculty arise? It may arise.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā jīvitindriya mūlaka

original: Yassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Yassa cittassa anantarā somanassasampayuttapacchimacittaṁ uppajjissati tesaṁ somanassindriyaṁ

translated: For those in whom the joy faculty arises, will their equanimity faculty arise?🔽For those in whom the last mind element and the last mind-consciousness element that are associated with joy arise, their joy faculty will arise,

analyzed: uppajjissati upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: or the heart-faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Yassa cittassa anantarā upekkhāsampayuttapacchimacittaṁ uppajjissati tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati tassa somanassa indriyam uppajjissati iti  yassa cittassa anantarā upekkhā sampayutta pacchimacittam uppajjissati tesam upekkhindriya
translated: “Or, when someone’s heart-faculty will arise, will his joy-faculty arise?

original: Yassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana man indriyam uppajjissati tassa somanassa indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: “Or, when someone’s mind-faculty will arise, will his joy-faculty arise?

original: Yassa cittassa anantarā upekkhāsampayuttapacchimacittaṁ uppajjissati tesaṁ manindriyaṁ

When the last type of consciousness belonging to the joy-cognizance element arises, his mind-faculty will arise and his joy-faculty will also arise.

analyzed: uppajjissati no ca tesam somanassindriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam manindriyam ca

original: uppajjissati somanassindriyañca uppajjissati. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjissati somanassa indriyaṃ ca uppajjissati somanassa indriya mūlaka
translated: and the joy faculty will arise. (The section based on the joy faculty.)

analyzed: yassa upekkhindriyam uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: When the equanimity faculty arises, does the faith faculty … the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty arise? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Yassa cittassa anantarā somanassasampayuttapacchimacittaṁ uppajjissati tesaṁ manindriyaṁ

translated: When the mind faculty arises, does the equanimity faculty arise?🔽For those in whom the last type of consciousness belonging to the sense sphere and associated with joy arises immediately after the mind faculty, for them the mind faculty will arise

analyzed: uppajjissati no ca tesam upekkhindriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam manindriyam ca

translated: and the equanimity faculty will arise. (The section based on the equanimity faculty.)

original: Yassa saddhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa saddhi indriyam uppajjissati tassa paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: When the faith faculty arises, does the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty arise? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa paññindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.

translated: Or, if the mind faculty will arise in anyone, will the faith faculty arise in him? To be determined. (The faith faculty is the root.)🔽If the understanding faculty will arise in anyone, will the mind faculty arise in him? To be determined.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa paññindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjissati tassa paññindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā paññindriya mūlaka
translated: Or, if the mind faculty will arise in anyone, will the understanding faculty arise in him? To be determined. (The understanding faculty is the root.)

original: 10.2.1.3.2. Anulomaokāsa🔽Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha sotindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: anuloma okāsa  yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tattha sotindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: ..... The Direction of Arising🔽In what states where the eye faculty will arise, will the ear faculty arise? To be determined.

original: Yattha vā pana sotindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana sotindriyam uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: Or, in what states where the ear faculty will arise, will the eye faculty arise? To be determined.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: In what states where the eye faculty will arise, will the nose faculty arise?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Kāmāvacare tattha cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati ghānindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjissati no ca tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati kāmāvacare tattha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjissati ghāna indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the fine-material sphere, the eye faculty will arise there, but the nose faculty will not arise there. In the sense-sphere, the eye faculty will arise there and the nose faculty will arise there.

original: Yattha vā pana ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: Or where the nose faculty will arise, will the eye faculty arise there? Yes.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Where the eye faculty arises, will the femininity faculty arise there?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Kāmāvacare tattha cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati purisindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjissati no ca tattha purisa indriyam uppajjissati kāmāvacare tattha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjissati purisa indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the fine-material sphere, the eye faculty will arise there, but not the femininity faculty. In the sensual sphere, the eye faculty and the femininity faculty will arise there.

original: Yattha vā pana purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana purisa indriyam uppajjissati tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā  yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: Or where the femininity faculty will arise, will the eye faculty arise there? Yes.🔽Where the eye faculty arises, will the life faculty arise there? Yes.

original: Yattha vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana jīvitindriyam uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Or where the life faculty will arise, will the eye faculty arise there?

original: Asaññasatte arūpe tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati. Pañcavokāre tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati.🔽Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: asaññasatte arūpe tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati no ca tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjissati pañcavokāre tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca uppajjissati  yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: In the immaterial state, there the faculty of life will arise, but there the eye faculty will not arise. In the five-constituent state, there both the faculty of life and the eye faculty will arise.

original: Yattha vā pana somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā  yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: “Where the eye faculty arises, will the faculty of sorrow arise there?” Answer: “Or where the faculty of sorrow arises, will the eye faculty arise there?” Answer: “Where the eye faculty arises, will the faculty of pleasure arise there?” Answer: “Or where the faculty of pleasure arises, will the eye faculty arise there?”

original: Yattha vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: “Where the eye faculty arises, will the faculty of delight arise there?” Answer: “Or where the faculty of delight arises, will the eye faculty arise there?”

original: Arūpe tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati. Pañcavokāre tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: arūpe tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati no ca tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjissati pañcavokāre tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: “In the immaterial state, there the faculty of delight will arise, but there the eye faculty will not arise. In the five-constituent state, there both the faculty of delight and the eye faculty will arise.”🔽“Where the eye faculty arises, will the faculty of equanimity arise there?” Answer: “Or where the faculty of equanimity arises, will the eye faculty arise there?”

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjissati tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: “When the eye faculty will arise there, will the faith faculty … the paññā faculty … the mind faculty arise there?”

original: Yattha vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana manindriyam uppajjissati tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: “Or when the mind faculty will arise there, will the eye faculty arise there?”

original: Arūpe tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjissati. Pañcavokāre tattha manindriyañca uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca uppajjissati. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: arūpe tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjissati pañcavokāre tattha manindriyam ca uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca uppajjissati cakkhundriya mūlaka
translated: “In the immaterial state, there will be the arising of the mind faculty there, but there will be no arising of the eye faculty there. In the five-constituent state, there will be the arising of both the mind faculty and the eye faculty there.” (Eye Faculty)

original: Yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: “When the nose faculty will arise there, will the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty arise there?”

original: Yattha vā pana purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana purisa indriyam uppajjissati tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: “Or when the masculinity faculty will arise there, will the nose faculty arise there?”🔽“When the nose faculty will arise there, will the life faculty arise there?”

original: Yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: “When the life faculty will arise there, will the nose faculty arise there?”

analyzed: yattha vā pana jīvitindriyam uppajjissati tattha ghānindriyam uppajjissati iti

original: Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Kāmāvacare tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati ghānindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: rūpāvacare arūpāvacare tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati no ca tattha ghānindriyam uppajjissati kāmāvacare tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial realms the life faculty will arise there, but not the nose faculty. In the sensual realm the life faculty will arise there, and the nose faculty will arise there too.

original: Yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: Where the nose faculty will arise, will the joy faculty arise there?

original: Yattha vā pana somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tattha ghānindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Or where the joy faculty will arise, will the nose faculty arise there?

original: Rūpāvacare tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Kāmāvacare tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjissati ghānindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: rūpāvacare tattha somanassindriyam uppajjissati no ca tattha ghānindriyam uppajjissati kāmāvacare tattha somanassindriyam ca uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the fine-material realm the joy faculty will arise there, but not the nose faculty. In the sensual realm the joy faculty will arise there, and the nose faculty will arise there too.

original: Yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: Where the nose faculty will arise, will the equanimity faculty arise there?

original: Yattha vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?

original: Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Kāmāvacare tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati ghānindriyañca uppajjissati.
