original: ca tesaṁ itthindriyaṁ uppajjati. Itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha🔽itthindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: ca tesam itthi indriyam uppajjati itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha  itthi indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: When those who are becoming women, the life faculty arises in them and also the female faculty.

original: Yassa itthindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa somanassindriyaṁ …pe… upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa itthi indriyam uppajjati tassa somanassindriyam pe upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the female faculty arises, does the joy faculty … the base-of-all faculty … the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the mind faculty arise? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa itthindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana man indriyam uppajjittha tassa itthi indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or when the mind faculty arises, does the female faculty arise?

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam na itthīnam upapajjantānam tesam manindriyam uppajjittha no
translated: When those who are dying and not becoming women, the mind faculty arises in them, but not the female faculty.

original: ca tesaṁ itthindriyaṁ uppajjati. Itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ manindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: ca tesam itthi indriyam uppajjati itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam man indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: When women are being reborn, their mind faculty and

original: itthindriyañca uppajjati. (Itthindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa purisindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: itthi indriyam ca uppajjati itthi indriya mūlaka  yassa purisa indriyam uppajjati tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: their femininity faculty arise.🔽When anyone’s male faculty arises, does his life faculty arise? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa purisindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana jīvita indriyam uppajjittha tassa purisa indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or, when anyone’s life faculty arises, does his male faculty arise?

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha,
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam na purisānam upapajjantānam tesam jīvitindriyam uppajjittha
translated: When all those who die and are not being reborn as men, their life faculty arises,

original: no ca tesaṁ purisindriyaṁ uppajjati. Purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ jīvitindriyañca
analyzed: no ca tesam purisa indriyam uppajjati purisānam upapajjantānam tesam jīvitindriyam ca
translated: but not their male faculty. When men are being reborn, their life faculty

original: uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: and their male faculty arise.

original: Yassa purisindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa somanassindriyaṁ …pe… upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa purisa indriyam uppajjati tassa somanassindriyam pe upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When anyone’s male faculty arises, does his joy faculty … his equanimity faculty … his faith faculty … his mindfulness faculty … his concentration faculty … his understanding faculty … his mind faculty arise? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa purisindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no
analyzed: yassa vā pana man indriyam uppajjittha tassa purisa indriyam uppajjati iti  sabbesam cavantānam na purisānam upapajjantānam tesam manindriyam uppajjittha no
translated: Or, when someone’s mind faculty arises, does his masculinity faculty also arise?🔽When anyone dies and is not being reborn in a certain plane, his mind faculty arises,

original: ca tesaṁ purisindriyaṁ uppajjati. Purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ manindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: ca tesam purisa indriyam uppajjati purisānam upapajjantānam tesam man indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: but his masculinity faculty does not arise. When anyone is being reborn in a certain plane, his mind faculty arises

original: purisindriyañca uppajjati. (Purisindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: purisa indriyam ca uppajjati purisa indriya mūlaka  yassa jīvitindriyam uppajjati tassa somanassindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: and his masculinity faculty also arises.🔽When anyone’s life faculty arises, does his joy faculty also arise?

original: Yassa vā pana somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or, when anyone’s joy faculty arises, does his life faculty also arise?

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha,
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam somanassa indriyam uppajjittha
translated: When anyone dies and his consciousness reappears in a certain plane, his joy faculty arises,

original: no ca tesaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte cittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: no ca tesam jīvitindriyam uppajjati sabbesam upapajjantānam pavatte cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: but his life faculty does not arise. When anyone is being reborn in a certain plane, his joy faculty arises

original: tesaṁ somanassindriyañca uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam somanassa indriyañca uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca uppajjati
translated: and his life faculty also arises.

original: Yassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa jīvitindriyam uppajjati tassa upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the life faculty arises in anyone, does the equanimity faculty … the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the mind faculty arise in them too?

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or when the mind faculty arises in anyone, does the life faculty arise in them too?

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjittha,
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam manindriyam uppajjittha
translated: In those dying and in those whose consciousness is breaking up at the end of an existence, the mind faculty arises,

original: no ca tesaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati. Sabbesaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte cittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: no ca tesam jīvitindriyam uppajjati sabbesam upapajjantānam pavatte cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: but the life faculty does not arise. In all those being reborn and in those whose consciousness is arising at the beginning of an existence,

original: tesaṁ manindriyañca uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca uppajjati. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: tesam man indriyam ca uppajjittha jīvit indriyam ca uppajjati jīvit indriya mūlaka
translated: the mind faculty arises and the life faculty arises too. (The life faculty is the root.)

original: Yassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa somanassa indriyam uppajjati tassa upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the joy faculty arises in anyone, does the equanimity faculty arise in them too?

original: Yassa vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa somanassindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or when the equanimity faculty arises in anyone, does the joy faculty arise in them too?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe somanassavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe somanassa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannāna
translated: In all those whose consciousness is breaking up, in those whose consciousness is arising who are not possessed of joy, in those attained to the cessation ,

original: asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ somanassindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam somanassindriyam uppajjati
translated: For those in the non-percipient realm, the faculty of equanimity arises, but not the faculty of joy.

original: Somanassena upapajjantānaṁ pavatte somanassasampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ
analyzed: somanassena upapajjantānam pavatte somanassa sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: For those who are reborn with joy, and at the moment of the arising of the mind associated with joy in the course of an existence,

original: upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjati
translated: both the faculty of equanimity and the faculty of joy arise.

original: Yassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa somanassa indriyam uppajjati tassa saddhi indriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the faculty of joy arises, does the faculty of faith … the faculty of wisdom … the faculty of mind arise?

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana man indriyam uppajjittha tassa somanassa indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or when the faculty of mind arises, does the faculty of joy arise?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe somanassavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe somanassa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannāna
translated: At the moment of the break up of the consciousness of all, at the moment of the arising of the mind not associated with joy, in those attained to the cessation of perception and feeling,

original: asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ somanassindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam man indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam somanassa indriyam uppajjati
translated: the faculty of mind arises, but not the faculty of joy.

original: Somanassena upapajjantānaṁ pavatte somanassasampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ
analyzed: somanassena upapajjantānam pavatte somanassa sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: For those who are reborn with joy, and at the moment of the arising of the mind associated with joy in the course of an existence,

original: manindriyañca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjati. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: manindriyam ca uppajjittha somanassindriyam ca uppajjati somanassindriya mūlaka
translated: and the mind faculty. (The triad based on the joy faculty.)

original: Yassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa saddhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa upekkhindriyam uppajjati tassa saddhindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the equanimity faculty arises, does the faith faculty also arise?

original: Yassa vā pana saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana saddhi indriyam uppajjittha tassa upekkhindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or when the faith faculty arises, does the equanimity faculty also arise?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannānaṃ
translated: At the moment of the break up of the consciousness of all those who die mindfully and equanimity is absent,

original: asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam saddhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam upekkhindriyam uppajjati
translated: the faith faculty has arisen and the equanimity faculty has not arisen.

original: Upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāsampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ saddhindriyañca
analyzed: upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam saddhindriyaṃ ca
translated: But for those who are dying mindfully and equanimity arises, at the moment of the arising of the consciousness accompanied by equanimity, the faith faculty has arisen

original: uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjati
translated: and the equanimity faculty has also arisen.

original: Yassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa upekkhindriyam uppajjati tassa paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the equanimity faculty arises, does the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty arise?

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjittha tassa upekkhindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or, when someone’s mind faculty arises, does his equanimity faculty also arise?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannānaṃ
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the mind of all who are dying, at the moment of the arising of the mind of those attaining cessation,

original: asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati.🔽Upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāsampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ manindriyañca
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam manindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam upekkhindriyam uppajjati  upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam man indriyaṃ ca
translated: and of those non-percipient beings who are percipient at the moment of rebirth-linking, his mind faculty arises, but not his equanimity faculty.

original: uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjati. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjittha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjati upekkhindriya mūlaka
translated: But when someone arises mindfully, at the moment of the arising of the mind accompanied by equanimity in the course of an existence, his mind faculty arises and his equanimity faculty also arises.

original: Yassa saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa paññindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa saddhi indriyam uppajjati tassa paññindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When someone’s faith faculty arises, does his understanding faculty also arise?

original: Yassa vā pana paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana paññā indriyam uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or, when someone’s understanding faculty arises, does his faith faculty also arise?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe saddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannānaṃ
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the mind of all who are dying, at the moment of the arising of the mind of those attaining cessation,

original: asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam paññindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam saddhindriyam uppajjati
translated: of those without perceptions, the faculty of wisdom arises, but their faculty of faith does not arise.

original: Sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāsampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ paññindriyañca
analyzed: sa hetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam paññindriyam ca
translated: In those with causes who are being reborn, when mind-consciousness element accompanied by faith is arising, their faculty of wisdom

original: uppajjittha saddhindriyañca uppajjati.🔽Yassa saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: uppajjittha saddhindriyam ca uppajjati  yassa saddhā indriyam uppajjati tassa manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: and their faculty of faith arise.🔽“When someone’s faculty of faith arises, does their faculty of mind arise?”

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe saddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ🔽asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati.🔽Sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāsampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ manindriyañca
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyam uppajjati iti  sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannānaṃ  asaññasattānam tesam man indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam saddhindriyam uppajjati  sa hetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam man indriyam ca
translated: “Or when someone’s faculty of mind arises, does their faculty of faith arise?”

original: uppajjittha saddhindriyañca uppajjati. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjittha saddhindriyam ca uppajjati saddhindriya mūlaka
translated: At the moment of the breakthrough to the fruit of stream-entry, at the moment of the breakthrough to the fruit of once-returning, at the moment of the breakthrough to the fruit of non-returning, at the moment of the breakthrough to perfection, at the moment of the arising of the first mind, at the moment of the arising of the mind-consciousness element, at the moment of the arising of the mind-faculty, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of mind, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of pleasure, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of equanimity, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of life, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of faith, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of energy, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of mindfulness, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of concentration, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of wisdom, at the moment of the arising of right view, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of what is and what is not the path, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the Dhamma, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the diversity of the Dhamma, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the categories of the Dhamma, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the teaching, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the meaning, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of inspired speech, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the Dhamma, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the analytical knowledges, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of recollection of past lives, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the future, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the divine eye, at the moment of the arising of the faculty of understanding of the divine

original: Yassa paññindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa paññā indriyam uppajjati tassa manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the faculty of wisdom arises in anyone, does the faculty of mind arise in that same person?

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa paññindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjittha tassa paññindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or when the faculty of mind arises in anyone, does the faculty of wisdom arise in that same person?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe ñāṇavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannānaṃ
translated: In the case of all those whose consciousness is perishing at the moment of rebirth-linking, and in the case of those who have attained cessation,

original: asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ paññindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam manindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam paññindriyam uppajjati
translated: the faculty of mind arises in them but not the faculty of wisdom.

original: Ñāṇasampayuttānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇasampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ
analyzed: ñāṇa sampayuttānam upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: In the case of those who are being reborn mindfully, and in the case of those consciousnesses associated with knowledge that arise in the course of an existence,

original: manindriyañca uppajjittha paññindriyañca uppajjati. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: manindriyam ca uppajjittha paññindriyam ca uppajjati paññindriya mūlaka
translated: the faculty of mind arises and the faculty of wisdom arises in them.🔽The faculty of wisdom is treated in the same way as the faculty of mind.

original: 10.2.1.4.2. Anulomaokāsa
analyzed: anuloma okāsa
translated: The Direction of Arising🔽In what is called the “direction of arising” treatment, the method is as follows.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tattha sotindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? …pe….🔽10.2.1.4.3. Anulomapuggalokāsa
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tattha sotindriyam uppajjittha ati pe anuloma puggala ukāsa
translated: In what is called the “person-direction” treatment, the method is as follows.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha sotindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha sotindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: In what is called the “person-direction-of-arising” treatment, the method is as follows.

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha
translated: When those beings who are without eye-sensitivity are being reborn in the Pure Abodes, eye-sensitivity arises in them there, but

original: sotindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: sotindriyam uppajjittha itaresam sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca
translated: ear-sensitivity does not arise in them there. But when those with eye-sensitivity are being reborn there, eye-sensitivity arises in them there, and

original: uppajjati sotindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjati sotindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: ear-sensitivity arises in them there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha sotindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjati iti  pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha
translated: But when ear-sensitivity arises in anyone anywhere, does eye-sensitivity arise in him there too?🔽When those beings who are without eye-sensitivity are being reborn in the sense-desire realm, ear-sensitivity arises in them there,

original: uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ
analyzed: uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam
translated: but eye-sensitivity does not arise in them there. But when those with eye-sensitivity are being reborn there,

original: tesaṁ tattha sotindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha sotindriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjati
translated: ear-sensitivity arises in them there, and eye-sensitivity arises in them there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati 🔽rūpāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha
translated: When eye-sensitivity arises in anyone, does nose-sensitivity arise in him too?🔽When those being reborn in the fine-material realm, eye-sensitivity arises in them there, but

original: ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Sacakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: ghāna indriyam uppajjittha sa cakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca
translated: for those who are without eye-consciousness and are being reborn in the sense-sphere, eye-consciousness arises there,

original: uppajjati ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjati ghānindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: and nose-consciousness arises there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ🔽uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati iti  kāmāvacarā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghānindriya  uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukānam kāmāvacara
translated: But for those who have nose-consciousness arising, does eye-consciousness arise there?🔽For those who are dying in the sense-sphere and being reborn in the sense-sphere without eyes, nose-consciousness arises there,🔽but eye-consciousness does not arise there. For those who are dying in the sense-sphere and being reborn in the sense-sphere with eyes, nose-consciousness arises there,

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: and eye-consciousness arises there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: For those who have eye-consciousness arising, does the femininity faculty arise there? … does the masculinity faculty arise there?🔽For those who are being reborn in the fine-material sphere, eye-consciousness arises there,

original: Rūpāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: rūpāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha
translated: but the femininity faculty does not arise there.

original: purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Sacakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: purisa indriyam uppajjittha sa cakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha
translated: for those who are without eye-sensitivity and who are being reborn in the sense-sphere, eye-sensitivity and

original: cakkhundriyañca uppajjati purisindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjati purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: the masculinity faculty arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: But for those who have the masculinity faculty arising, does the eye-sensitivity faculty arise?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ🔽uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacarā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha purisa indriya  uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukānam kāmāvacara
translated: For those who are dying in the sense-sphere and being reborn in the sense-sphere without eye-sensitivity, the masculinity faculty🔽arises for them, but their eye-sensitivity does not arise. But for those who are being reborn in the sense-sphere with eye-sensitivity, the masculinity faculty

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: and eye-sensitivity arise.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: For those who have the eye-sensitivity faculty arising, does the life faculty arise?

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha
translated: For those who are being reborn in the Pure Abodes, the eye-sensitivity faculty arises for them, but the life faculty

original: jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: jīvitindriyam uppajjittha itaresam sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca
translated: And those with eyes who are being reborn, for them there the eye faculty

original: uppajjati jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjati jīvita indriyam ca
translated: and the life faculty arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjati iti
translated: But those who have the life faculty arising, do they have the eye faculty arising?

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha,
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam acakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha
translated: For all who are dying and who are without eyes, and who are being reborn, for them there the life faculty

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha
translated: arises, but not for them there the eye faculty arises. But for those with eyes who are being reborn, for them there

original: jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjati
translated: the life faculty arises and the eye faculty arises.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha
translated: For those who have the eye faculty arising, do they have the joy faculty arising?🔽For those being reborn in the Pure Abodes, for them there the eye faculty arises, but not for them there

original: somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: somanassindriyam uppajjittha itaresam sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha
translated: the joy faculty arises. But for those with eyes who are being reborn, for them there🔽the eye faculty arises and the joy faculty arises.

original: cakkhundriyañca uppajjati somanassindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjati somanassa indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: and the eye faculty arises, and the joy faculty arises.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati iti  pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassa indriya
translated: Or, when someone has the joy faculty arising, does the eye faculty arise in them?🔽When those without eyes die and are being reborn in the sense-sphere, the joy faculty arises in them.

original: uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ
analyzed: uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam
translated: But the eye faculty does not arise in them. When those with eyes are being reborn,

original: tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjati
translated: the joy faculty arises in them and the eye faculty arises.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: “When someone has the eye faculty arising, do they have the equanimity faculty arising?”

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha  upekkhindriyam uppajjittha itaresam sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca
translated: When those being reborn in the Pure Abodes have the eye faculty arising, the equanimity faculty does not arise in them.

original: uppajjati upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjati upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: But when those with eyes are being reborn, the eye faculty arises in them and the equanimity faculty arises.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjati iti  pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam arūpānam tesam tattha
translated: Or, where the equanimity faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise there?

original: upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ
analyzed: upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukāna
translated: In the case of those dying in the five-constituent becoming who are not without eye-consciousness and who are being reborn in the sense-sphere becoming or in the immaterial becoming, the equanimity faculty arises in them, but not the eye faculty.

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjati
translated: In the case of those with eyes being reborn, the equanimity faculty arises in them and also the eye faculty.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha saddhi indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Where the eye faculty arises, does the faith faculty arise there?

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha  saddhindriyam uppajjittha itaresam sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca
translated: In the case of those being reborn in the Pure Abodes, the eye faculty arises in them, but not the faith faculty.

original: uppajjati saddhindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjati saddhindriyam ca
translated: In the case of those with eyes being reborn elsewhere, the eye faculty arises in them and also the faith faculty.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha saddhi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or does the eye faculty arise in one in whom the faith faculty has arisen?

original: Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam arūpānam tesam tattha
translated: In those who are dying and being reborn in the sense-sphere element without eye faculty,

original: saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ
analyzed: saddhi indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukāna
translated: the faith faculty has arisen, but not the eye faculty. In those who are being reborn with eye faculty,

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjati
translated: the faith faculty has arisen and the eye faculty has arisen.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha
translated: In those in whom the eye faculty has arisen, has the mind faculty arisen?

original: manindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: manindriyam uppajjittha itaresam sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca
translated: In those who are being reborn in the Pure Abodes, the eye faculty has arisen, but not the mind faculty. In those who are being reborn with mind faculty,

original: uppajjati manindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjati manindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: the eye faculty has arisen and the mind faculty has arisen.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjati iti  pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam arūpānam tesam tattha
translated: Or, where the mind faculty arises, does the eye faculty arise there?

original: manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ
analyzed: manindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukāna
translated: When those of five-constituent beings who are without eye-sensitivity die and are being reborn in the sense-sphere or in the immaterial-sphere, the mind faculty arises in them there, but the eye faculty does not arise there.

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca uppajjati
translated: When those with eye-sensitivity are being reborn there, the mind faculty arises in them there, and the eye faculty arises there.

original: (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: cakkhu indriya mūlaka  yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā  yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: (The section on the eye faculty is finished.)🔽Where the nose faculty arises, does the femininity faculty arise there?🔽Or, where the masculinity faculty arises, does the nose faculty arise there?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacarā cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha purisa indriya
translated: When those of the sense-sphere who are without nose-sensitivity die and are being reborn in the sense-sphere, the masculinity faculty arises in them there,

original: uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati. Saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ
analyzed: uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati sa ghānakānam upapajjantānam
translated: for those with nose who are being reborn there,

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjati.🔽Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha ghāna indriyam ca uppajjati  yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: their male faculty has arisen and their nose faculty has arisen.🔽“When someone’s nose faculty has arisen, has their life faculty arisen?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: “When someone’s life faculty has arisen, has their nose faculty arisen?”

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha,
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam aghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha
translated: For all who are dying and being reborn without a nose, their life faculty has arisen

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati. Saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati sa ghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha
translated: but their nose faculty has not arisen. For those with a nose who are being reborn there,

original: jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjati
translated: their life faculty has arisen and their nose faculty has arisen.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “When someone’s nose faculty has arisen, has their joy faculty arisen?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or does the nose faculty arise when the joy faculty arises?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam
translated: When those in the sensual realm who are without nose sense die and are being reborn in the sensual realm, and when those in the fine-material realm …

original: tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati. Saghānakānaṁ
analyzed: tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati sa ghānakāna
translated: for them the joy faculty arises there, but not the nose faculty. For those with nose sense …

original: upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha ghānindriyam ca uppajjati
translated: for them both the joy faculty and the nose faculty arise.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the nose faculty arises in a certain person, does the equanimity faculty arise in him?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or when the equanimity faculty arises in a certain person, does the nose faculty arise in him?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: When those in the sensual realm who are without nose sense die and are being reborn in the sensual realm, and when those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm …

original: tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha ghānindriyam uppajjati
translated: for them the equanimity faculty arises there, but not the nose faculty.

original: Saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: sa ghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha ghānindriyam ca uppajjati
translated: When those with nose consciousness are reborn, nose-consciousness and equanimity arise in them.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When nose-consciousness arises in a person, does the faith faculty also arise in them? …

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghān indriyam uppajjati iti  cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: Does the mind faculty arise in a person in whom the nose faculty arises?🔽When those in the sensual realm die and are reborn in the sensual realm, and when those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm

original: tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjati.🔽Saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: tesam tattha man indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjati  sa ghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha man indriyam ca uppajjittha ghāna indriyam ca
translated: the mind faculty arises in them, but not the nose faculty.

original: uppajjati. (Ghānindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjati ghānindriya mūlaka
translated: When those with nose consciousness are reborn, the mind faculty and nose faculty arise in them.🔽(The section on the nose faculty is finished.)

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the female faculty arises in a person, does the male faculty arise in them?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjati iti  kāmāvacarā cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha purisa indriya
translated: Or does the female faculty arise in one in whom the male faculty arises?🔽In those who die as women and are not reborn in the sense-sphere element, the male faculty arises in them there,

original: uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjati. Itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ
analyzed: uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha itthi indriyam uppajjati itthīnam upapajjantīnam
translated: but the female faculty does not arise in them there. In those who are reborn as women,

original: tattha purisindriyañca uppajjittha itthindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: tattha purisa indriyañca uppajjittha itthi indriyañca uppajjati
translated: the male faculty arises in them there, and the female faculty arises in them there.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: In one in whom the female faculty arises, does the life faculty arise?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: In one in whom the life faculty arises, does the female faculty arise?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: In those who die in the sense-sphere element and are not reborn in the sense-sphere element, or in the fine-material or immaterial elements,

original: tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha jīvita indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha itthi indriyam uppajjati
translated: the life faculty arises in them there, but the female faculty does not arise in them there.

original: Itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha itthindriyañca uppajjati.🔽Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha jīvita indriyam ca uppajjittha itthi indriyam ca uppajjati  yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When women are being reborn — when life, the faculty of life, is arising in them — there the faculty of femininity and the faculty of pain are arising.🔽“When someone’s faculty of femininity is arising, is his/her faculty of pleasure also arising?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjati iti  cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam
translated: “When someone’s faculty of pleasure is arising, is his/her faculty of femininity also arising?”🔽When those in the sensual realm who are not women are being reborn — when life, the faculty of life, is arising in them — there the faculty of pleasure is arising, but not the faculty of femininity.

original: tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjati. Itthīnaṁ🔽upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha itthindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha itthi indriyam uppajjati  upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha somanassa indriyam ca uppajjittha itthi indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: When women are being reborn — when life, the faculty of life, is arising in them — there the faculty of pleasure and the faculty of femininity are arising.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “When someone’s faculty of femininity is arising, is his/her faculty of equanimity… faculty of conviction… faculty of discernment… faculty of persistence… faculty of mindfulness… faculty of concentration… faculty of discernment also arising?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjati iti  cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: Or, where the mind faculty arises, does the femininity faculty arise there?🔽When those in the sensual realm die and are not being reborn in the sensual realm, and when those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm

original: tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha man indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha itthi indriyam uppajjati
translated: the mind faculty arises there, but not the femininity faculty.

original: Itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha itthindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha man indriyam ca uppajjittha itthi indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: When women are being reborn there, both the mind faculty and the femininity faculty arise there.

original: (Itthindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: itthi indriya mūlaka
translated: (The femininity faculty is to be elaborated in the same way as the masculinity faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha jīvita indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When the masculinity faculty arises in a given person, does the life faculty arise in that person?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or, when the life faculty arises in a given person, does the masculinity faculty arise in that person?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: When those in the sensual realm die and are not being reborn as men in the sensual realm, and when those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm

original: tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjati.🔽Purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha jīvita indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam uppajjati  purisānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha purisindriyam ca uppajjati
translated: for them there is the arising of the life faculty there, but there is no arising of the male faculty there.🔽For those who are percipient of form and are reborn spontaneously in the form realm, there is the arising of the life faculty there and there is the arising of the male faculty there.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “When there is the arising of the male faculty, is there the arising of the joy faculty?” Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: “Or when there is the arising of the joy faculty, is there the arising of the male faculty?”

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam
translated: For those who die as human beings and are reborn as human beings, for those who die as human beings and are reborn in the form realm,

original: tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam uppajjati
translated: there is the arising of the joy faculty there, but there is no arising of the male faculty there.

original: Purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: purisānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: For those who die as human beings and are reborn as human beings, for those who die as human beings and are reborn in the form realm, there is the arising of the joy faculty there and there is the arising of the male faculty there.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Is the male faculty arisen in anyone’s continuum also the equanimity faculty arisen there? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or is the equanimity faculty arisen in anyone’s continuum also the male faculty arisen there?🔽Those in the sense-sphere realm who die as non-men and are reborn as men,

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: and those in the fine-material and immaterial realms,

original: tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjati.🔽Purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam uppajjati  purisānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: for them the equanimity faculty has arisen but not the male faculty.🔽For men who are being reborn, both the equanimity faculty and the male faculty have arisen.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Is the male faculty arisen in anyone’s continuum also the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty … the understanding faculty arisen there? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or is the understanding faculty arisen in anyone’s continuum also the male faculty arisen there?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: Of those who die as human beings and are not reborn in the sense-sphere, and of those who are reborn in the fine-material or immaterial sphere,

original: tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha man indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam uppajjati
translated: the mind faculty arises in them there, but not the male faculty.

original: Purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: purisānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha man indriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: Of those who are reborn as human beings, the mind faculty arises in them there, and also the male faculty.

original: (Purisindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: puris indriya mūlaka
translated: (The male faculty is to be treated in the same way as the female faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha🔽jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattam upapajjantānam tesam tattha  jīvitindriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha itaresa
translated: When the life faculty arises in any given person, does the joy faculty also arise in that person?🔽In the case of those who are reborn in the Pure Abodes, the life faculty arises in them at the moment of rebirth-linking consciousness, but not the joy faculty. In the case of the rest

original: catuvokāraṁ pañcavokāraṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte cittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: catuvokāram pañcavokāram upapajjantānam pavatte cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha
translated: who are reborn in the fourfold or fivefold kamma-resultant existence, the life faculty arises in them at the moment of the arising of the first rebirth-linking consciousness,

original: jīvitindriyañca uppajjati somanassindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: jīvitindriyañca uppajjati somanassindriyañca uppajjittha
translated: and also the joy faculty.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or, where the faculty of joy arises, does the faculty of life arise there?

original: Catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ🔽uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati. Catuvokāraṁ pañcavokāraṁ
analyzed: catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam tattha somanassa indriya  uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjati catuvokāram pañcavokāra
translated: In the case of those dying with four or five khandhas, in the process of dying, at the moment of the break-up of consciousness, the faculty of joy arises there,

original: upapajjantānaṁ pavatte cittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: upapajjantānam pavatte cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha somanassa indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: but the faculty of life does not arise there. In the case of those being reborn with four or five khandhas, in the process of rebirth, at the moment of the arising of consciousness, the faculty of joy arises there,

original: jīvitindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: jīvitindriyam ca uppajjati
translated: and the faculty of life arises there.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ asaññasattaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam asaññasattam upapajjantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriya
translated: Where the faculty of life arises, does the faculty of equanimity arise there?🔽In the case of those being reborn in the Pure Abodes and in the case of those being reborn as non-percipient beings, the faculty of life arises there,

original: uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokāraṁ pañcavokāraṁ
analyzed: uppajjati no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokāram pañcavokāra
translated: but the faculty of equanimity does not arise there. In the case of those being reborn with four or five khandhas,

original: upapajjantānaṁ pavatte cittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjati
analyzed: upapajjantānam pavatte cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjati
translated: At the reappearance of those consciousnesses, the life faculty arises there.

original: upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha
translated: And equanimity arises there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjati iti  catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam tattha upekkhindriya
translated: Or, when equanimity arises there, does the life faculty arise there?

original: uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati. Catuvokāraṁ pañcavokāraṁ
analyzed: uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjati catuvokāram pañcavokāra
translated: When the four-constituent and five-constituent beings die and are reappearing in the four-constituent and five-constituent becoming, at the moment of their reappearance the life faculty arises there.🔽But the equanimity faculty arises there.

original: upapajjantānaṁ pavatte cittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: upapajjantānam pavatte cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: When the four-constituent and five-constituent beings are being reborn into the four-constituent and five-constituent becoming, at the moment of their reappearance the equanimity faculty arises there.

original: jīvitindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: jīvitindriyam ca uppajjati
translated: And the life faculty arises there.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ asaññasattaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati 🔽suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam asaññasattam upapajjantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriya
translated: When the life faculty arises in any given state, does the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty arise there?🔽When the deities of the Pure Abodes are being reborn and when the non-percipient beings are being reborn, the life faculty arises there.

original: uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokāraṁ pañcavokāraṁ
analyzed: uppajjati no ca tesam tattha man indriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokāram pañcavokāra
translated: but their mind faculty has arisen there. It has arisen in those of four and five bases,

original: upapajjantānaṁ pavatte cittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjati
analyzed: upapajjantānam pavatte cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjati
translated: for some, there is the arising of the life faculty there, but not the arising of the mind faculty there. For the rest, when arising in the four-constituent and five-constituent (types of existence), at the time of the arising of consciousness in the life-continuum, there is the arising of the life faculty there,

original: manindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: manindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: and there is the arising of the mind faculty there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or, for those who have the arising of the mind faculty there, is there the arising of the life faculty there?

original: Catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ🔽uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjati. Catuvokāraṁ pañcavokāraṁ
analyzed: catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam tattha man indriya  uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjati catuvokāram pañcavokāra
translated: For those who are perishing in the four-constituent and five-constituent (types of existence), at the time of the break up of consciousness in the life-continuum, there is the arising of the mind faculty there,

original: upapajjantānaṁ pavatte cittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: upapajjantānam pavatte cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: but not the arising of the life faculty there. For those arising in the four-constituent and five-constituent (types of existence), at the time of the arising of consciousness in the life-continuum, there is the arising of the mind faculty there,

original: jīvitindriyañca uppajjati. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: jīvita indriyam ca uppajjati jīvita indriya mūlaka
translated: and there is the arising of the life faculty there. (The life faculty base is finished).

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: When anyone has the joy faculty arisen in him, does he have the equanimity faculty arisen in him? … the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjati iti
translated: Or when anyone has the mind faculty arisen in him, does he have the joy faculty arisen in him?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe somanassavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha🔽manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjati. Somanassena🔽upapajjantānaṁ pavatte somanassasampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe somanassa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha  man indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjati somanassena  upapajjantānam pavatte somanassa sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha man indriyam ca
translated: In the case of all those in whom the mind is disintegrating, in whom a mind without joy is arising,🔽the mind faculty has arisen, but not the joy faculty.

original: uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjati. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjittha somanassa indriyam ca uppajjati somanassa indriya mūlaka
translated: In the case of those reappearing in a happy existence, in whom a mind with joy is arising, the mind faculty has arisen and so has the joy faculty.

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: When anyone has the equanimity faculty arisen in him, does he have the faith faculty arisen in him?

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha  saddhindriyam uppajjittha itaresam upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā sampayutta cittassa
