When those who are attaining the Pure Abodes, their equanimity faculty arises and their faith faculty does not arise. When those who are attaining the

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjati saddhindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjati saddhindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: When those attaining the Pure Abodes, their equanimity faculty arises there, but their faith faculty does not arise there. But when those attaining through equanimity, at the time of the arising of their first consciousness associated with equanimity, their equanimity faculty arises there and their faith faculty arises there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha🔽saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati. Upekkhāya
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha saddhi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjati iti  sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha  saddhi indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjati upekkhāya
translated: Or, when someone’s faith faculty arises, does his equanimity faculty arise too?

original: upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāsampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca🔽uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha saddhindriyañca 🔽uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjati
translated: At the moment of the arising of the first resultant consciousness in one who attains the Pure Abodes, his faith faculty arises there but his equanimity faculty does not arise there. But when those attaining through equanimity, at the moment of the arising of their first resultant consciousness associated with equanimity, his faith faculty arises there and his equanimity faculty arises there.

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽manindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ pavatte upekkhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha  manindriyam uppajjittha itaresam upekkhāya upapajjantānam pavatte upekkhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: When someone has the equanimity faculty arisen in a certain case, does he have the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty arisen there too?

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjati manindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjati manindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: When those in the Pure Abodes arise in the immaterial becoming, in their case the equanimity faculty arises there, but not the mind faculty. In the case of those who arise in the fine-material becoming through equanimity, when the first impulsion arises in the cognitive series, the equanimity faculty arises there, but not the mind faculty. But when the second impulsion arises, the equanimity faculty arises there and the mind faculty arises there too.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjati iti  sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha
translated: When someone has the mind faculty arisen in a certain case, does he have the equanimity faculty arisen there too?🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking of all beings, at the moment of arising of consciousness without root-cause accompanied by equanimity,

original: manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjati. Upekkhāya upapajjantānaṁ
analyzed: manindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjati upekkhāya upapajjantāna
translated: the mind faculty has arisen there, but not the equanimity faculty. But when those who arise through equanimity are in the course of an existence, at the moment of arising of the first impulsion,

original: pavatte upekkhāsampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: pavatte upekkhā sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha man indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: At the instant of the arising of the mind accompanied by equanimity in the cognitive series, there is the arising of the eye faculty and

original: upekkhindriyañca uppajjati. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: upekkhā indriyam ca uppajjati upekkhā indriya mūlaka
translated: there is the arising of the equanimity faculty. (The triad with the equanimity faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa yattha saddhi indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha
translated: When someone has the eye faculty in a given state, does he have the understanding faculty in that state?🔽When those who are destined for the Pure Abodes arise there, the eye faculty arises in them there, but the

original: paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: paññindriyam uppajjittha itaresam sa hetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: understanding faculty does not arise in them there. When those who are destined for a happy rebirth arise there, and in the course of an existence, at the instant of the arising of the mind accompanied by faith,

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca uppajjati paññindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca uppajjati paññindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: the eye faculty arises in them there and the understanding faculty arises in them there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha paññindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: But when someone has the understanding faculty in a given state, does he have the eye faculty in that state?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe saddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha
translated: At the instant of the arising of the mind not accompanied by faith, the

original: paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati. Sahetukānaṁ🔽upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāsampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca
analyzed: paññindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha saddhindriyam uppajjati sa hetukāna  upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha paññindriyañca
translated: when the faculty of wisdom arises in them, but the faculty of faith does not arise in them.

original: uppajjittha saddhindriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjittha saddhindriyam ca uppajjati
translated: When those who have cause for the arising of the faculty of faith are being reborn, when the mind associated with faith is arising in them, then the faculty of wisdom arises in them and the faculty of faith arises in them.

original: Yassa yattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽manindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ sahetukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāsampayuttacittassa
analyzed: yassa yattha saddhi indriyam uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha  manindriyam uppajjittha itaresam sa hetukānam upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā sampayutta cittassa
translated: “When anyone’s faculty of faith arises, does his faculty of mind arise?”

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca uppajjati manindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca uppajjati manindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: When those in the Pure Abodes are being reborn, their faculty of faith arises, but their faculty of mind does not arise. When those who have cause for the arising of the faculty of faith are being reborn, when the mind associated with faith is arising in them, then their faculty of faith arises and their faculty of mind arises.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam uppajjati iti
translated: “When anyone’s faculty of mind arises, does his faculty of faith arise?”

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe saddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha
translated: At the instant of the arising of consciousness accompanied by faith, the mind faculty arises in them,

original: manindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjati. Sahetukānaṁ
analyzed: uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha saddhindriyam uppajjati sa hetukāna
translated: but the faith faculty does not arise in them.

original: upapajjantānaṁ pavatte saddhāsampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca
analyzed: upapajjantānam pavatte saddhā sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha man indriyam ca
translated: At the instant of the arising of consciousness accompanied by faith in the course of an existence in which it has arisen, the mind faculty arises in them

original: uppajjittha saddhindriyañca uppajjati. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: uppajjittha saddhindriyam ca uppajjati saddhindriya mūlaka  yassa yattha paññindriyam uppajjati tassa tattha manindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: and the faith faculty also arises in them.🔽When the faith faculty arises in a certain person, does the mind faculty arise in him?

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽manindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ ñāṇasampayuttānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ pavatte ñāṇasampayuttacittassa
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha paññindriyam uppajjati no ca tesam tattha  man indriyam uppajjittha itaresam ñāṇa sampayuttānam upapajjantānam pavatte ñāṇa sampayutta cittassa
translated: When the mind faculty arises in a certain person, does the faith faculty arise in him?🔽When the understanding faculty arises in a certain person, does the mind faculty arise in him?

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca uppajjati manindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha paññindriyam ca uppajjati manindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: When the mind faculty arises in a certain person, does the understanding faculty arise in him?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe ñāṇavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ🔽uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjati. Ñāṇasampayuttānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyam uppajjati iti  sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha man indriya  uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha paññindriyam uppajjati ñāṇa sampayuttānam upapajjantānam
translated: Or, in the case of anyone in whom the mind faculty arises, does the understanding faculty arise in him?🔽At the moment of the break-up of the consciousness of all who die and are not immediately reborn, and at the moment of the arising of the consciousness of those not normally obtaining the path who enter upon the normal course, and at the moment of the arising of the consciousness of those obtaining the path who enter upon the abnormal course, and at the moment of the arising of the consciousness of those who attain cessation, the mind faculty arises in them,

original: pavatte ñāṇasampayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjittha
analyzed: pavatte ñāṇa sampayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha man indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: but not the understanding faculty. At the moment of the arising of the consciousness of those not obtaining the path who enter upon the abnormal course, and at the moment of the arising of the consciousness of those obtaining the path who enter upon the normal course, the mind faculty arises in them,

original: paññindriyañca uppajjati. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽10.2.1.4.4. Paccanīkapuggala
analyzed: paññindriyam ca uppajjati paññindriya mūlaka  paccanīka puggala
translated: and the understanding faculty arises in them.🔽The Perversions

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa sotindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa sotindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: In coming to understand the perversions in this way, he should also understand the opposite of the perversions, that is, the four kinds of rightness. For the opposite should be understood of what is not the case.🔽The four kinds of rightness are rightness of what is seen, rightness of what is heard, rightness of what is sensed, and rightness of what is cognized.

original: Yassa vā pana sotindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Natthi.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa vā pana sota indriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti natthi 🔽yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: Herein, rightness of what is seen is the seeing of the seen as the seen, and the seeing of the unseen as the unseen.

original: Yassa vā pana ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Natthi.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa vā pana ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti natthi  yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha  yassa vā pana purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti natthi
translated: Or, if the nose faculty does not arise in someone, does the eye faculty not arise in them? There is no one in whom the nose faculty does not arise but the eye faculty does.🔽“If someone’s eye faculty does not arise, does their femininity faculty … or their masculinity faculty not arise?” It arises.🔽“Or, if someone’s masculinity faculty does not arise, does their eye faculty not arise?” There is no one in whom the masculinity faculty does not arise but the eye faculty does.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Natthi.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa somanassindriyaṁ …pe… upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha  yassa vā pana jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyam na uppajjati iti natthi  yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa somanassa indriyam pe upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: “If someone’s eye faculty does not arise, does their life faculty not arise?” It arises.🔽“Or, if someone’s life faculty does not arise, does their eye faculty not arise?” There is no one in whom the life faculty does not arise but the eye faculty does.🔽“If someone’s eye faculty does not arise, does their joy faculty … or their equanimity faculty not arise?” It arises.

original: Yassa vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhā indriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti natthi
translated: “Or, if someone’s equanimity faculty does not arise, does their eye faculty not arise?” There is no one in whom the equanimity faculty does not arise but the eye faculty does.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Natthi …pe….
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha  yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa cakkhundriyam na uppajjati iti natthi pe
translated: “When the eye faculty has arisen, has the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty arisen?” It has arisen.🔽“When the mind faculty has not arisen, has the eye faculty not arisen?” There is none.

original: Yassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa manindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: “When the wisdom faculty has not arisen, has the mind faculty not arisen?” It has arisen.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa paññindriyam na uppajjati iti natthi
translated: “When the mind faculty has not arisen, has the wisdom faculty not arisen?” There is none.

original: 10.2.1.4.5. Paccanīkaokāsa
analyzed: paccanīka okāsa
translated: … The reverse order

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? …pe….
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tattha sotindriyam na uppajjittha ati pe
translated: “Where the eye faculty has not arisen, has the ear faculty not arisen?” …

original: 10.2.1.4.6. Paccanīkapuggalokāsa
analyzed: paccanīka puggala okāsa
translated: … The reverse order in regard to individuals

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha sotindriyam na uppajjittha ati 🔽pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriya
translated: “When someone’s eye faculty has not arisen, has their ear faculty not arisen?”🔽When those without eyes die and are reborn in the sense-sphere, their eye faculty has not arisen,

original: na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāse parinibbantānaṁ
analyzed: na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha sotindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāse parinibbantāna
translated: for those in the Pure Abodes who attain Nibbāna without exertion,

original: asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati sotindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjati sotindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: and for those in the immaterial sphere, the eye faculty does not arise there, and the ear faculty has not arisen there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Suddhāvāse parinibbantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati iti  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha sotindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha  cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati suddhāvāse parinibbantānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: But if someone’s ear faculty has not arisen there, has their eye faculty not arisen there too?🔽For those being reborn in the Pure Abodes, the ear faculty has not arisen there, but their eye faculty has not arisen there.

original: tattha sotindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tattha sotindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati
translated: For those in the Pure Abodes who attain Nibbāna without exertion, and for those in the immaterial sphere, the ear faculty has not arisen there, and the eye faculty has not arisen there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “If someone’s eye faculty has not arisen there, has their nose faculty not arisen there too?”

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacarā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriya
translated: For those in the sensual realm who are dying and being reborn without eyes in the sensual realm,

original: na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacarā cavantānaṁ
analyzed: na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacarā
translated: for them the eye faculty does not arise there, but the nose faculty does not not arise there. For those passing away from the fine-material sphere

original: asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjati ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: and the immaterial sphere, the eye faculty and the nose faculty do not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, alternatively: for those whose nose faculty does not arise there, does the eye faculty not arise there too?

original: Rūpāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Rūpāvacarā cavantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ
analyzed: rūpāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati rūpāvacarā cavantānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: For those being reborn in the fine-material sphere, the nose faculty does not arise there, but the eye faculty does not not arise there. For those passing away from the fine-material sphere and the immaterial sphere,

original: tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjittha cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: the nose faculty and the eye faculty do not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati 🔽kāmāvacarā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriya
translated: In the case of those whose eye faculty does not arise, does the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty not arise too?🔽For those passing away from the fine-material and immaterial spheres and being reborn in the fine-material sphere, the eye faculty does not arise there,

original: na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacarā cavantānaṁ
analyzed: na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacarā
translated: for them the eye faculty does not arise there, but the male faculty does not not arise there. For those passing away from the fine-material sphere

original: asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati purisindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjati purisa indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: and immaterial beings, the eye faculty does not arise there, and the male faculty does not not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Rūpāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti  rūpāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: But those for whom the male faculty does not not arise, does the eye faculty not arise for them there?

original: tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Rūpāvacarā cavantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ
analyzed: tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati rūpāvacarā cavantānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: For those being reborn in the fine-material sphere, the male faculty does not not arise there, but the eye faculty does not arise there. For those passing away from the fine-material sphere and immaterial beings,

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjittha cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: the male faculty does not not arise there, and the eye faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: For those in whom the eye faculty does not arise, does the life faculty not arise for them there?

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati,
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam acakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati
translated: For all those passing away and being reborn without eye, the eye faculty does not arise there,🔽but the life faculty does not not arise there.

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāse parinibbantānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāse parinibbantānam
translated: but their life faculty does not not arise there. Those in the Pure Abodes who attain Nibbāna there

original: tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tattha cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjati jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: their eye faculty does not arise and their life faculty does not not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati iti  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: But anyone’s life faculty that does not arise there, does their eye faculty not arise there too?🔽Those in the Pure Abodes who reappear there their life faculty does not arise there,

original: tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Suddhāvāse parinibbantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca
analyzed: tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati suddhāvāse parinibbantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyañca
translated: but their eye faculty does not not arise there. Those in the Pure Abodes who attain Nibbāna there their life faculty

original: na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: na uppajjittha cakkhu indriyañca na uppajjati
translated: does not not arise and their eye faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Anyone’s eye faculty that does not arise, does their joy faculty not arise there too?

original: Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ
analyzed: pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriya
translated: Those in the five-constituent becoming who are dying and who are not blind and who are being reborn in the sense-sphere plane of existence, their eye faculty

original: na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāse parinibbantānaṁ
analyzed: na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāse parinibbantāna
translated: for those attaining Nibbāna in the Fine Material Sphere,

original: asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati sotindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjati sotindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: for those in the Immaterial Sphere, the eye faculty does not arise there, and the mind faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Suddhāvāse parinibbantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati iti  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati suddhāvāse parinibbantānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: Or, for those in whom the mind faculty does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise in them?🔽For those being reborn in the Pure Abodes, the mind faculty does not arise in them, but the eye faculty does arise there.

original: tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjittha cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: For those attaining Nibbāna in the Pure Abodes, for those in the Immaterial Sphere, the mind faculty does not arise there, and the eye faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: For those in whom the eye faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty not arise in them?

original: Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha🔽cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāse
analyzed: pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam arūpānam tesam tattha  cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāse
translated: When those without eye-sensitivity who are dying and being reborn in the sense-sphere are dying and being reborn in the formless-sphere, their eye-sensitivity does not arise there,

original: parinibbantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: parinibbantānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: but their equanimity-sensitivity does not not arise there. When those dying in the Pure Abodes and Non-percipient beings are dying, their eye-sensitivity and their equanimity-sensitivity do not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Suddhāvāse parinibbantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati iti  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati suddhāvāse parinibbantānam asaññasattānam tesam
translated: But when anyone’s equanimity-sensitivity does not arise there, does his eye-sensitivity not arise there too?

original: tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati
translated: When those being reborn in the Pure Abodes, their equanimity-sensitivity does not arise there, but their eye-sensitivity does arise there. When those dying in the Pure Abodes and Non-percipient beings are dying, their equanimity-sensitivity and their eye-sensitivity do not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha🔽cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāse
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati  pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam arūpānam tesam tattha  cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāse
translated: “When anyone’s eye faculty does not arise, does his mind faculty not arise too?”🔽When those of five-constituent becoming who are without eye faculty are being reborn in the sense-sphere realm or in the formless realm, their eye faculty does not arise, but their mind faculty does not not arise.

original: parinibbantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: parinibbantānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: When those in the Pure Abodes are attaining final Nibbāna, and when non-percipient beings are being reborn, their eye faculty does not arise and their mind faculty does not not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati iti  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: “When anyone’s mind faculty does not arise, does his eye faculty not arise too?”🔽When those being reborn in the Pure Abodes, their mind faculty does not not arise, but their eye faculty does not arise.

original: cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Suddhāvāse parinibbantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati suddhāvāse parinibbantānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha
translated: When those in the Pure Abodes are attaining final Nibbāna, and when non-percipient beings are being reborn, their mind faculty does not not arise and their eye faculty does not arise.

original: manindriyañca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: manindriyam ca na uppajjittha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjati cakkhundriya mūlaka
translated: and the mind faculty does not arise, the eye faculty does not arise. (The section based on the eye faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha itthi indriyam pe purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “When someone’s nose faculty does not arise, does his female faculty … his male faculty not arise?”

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacarā cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghānindriya
translated: When those in the sensual realm who are not percipient die and are reborn in the sensual realm, his nose faculty

original: na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ🔽tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati purisindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam  tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati purisa indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: does not arise there, but his male faculty does not not arise there.🔽When those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm die and are reborn in the fine-material realm, his nose faculty🔽and his male faculty do not arise there.🔽When someone’s male faculty does not arise, does his nose faculty not arise?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā 🔽yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “When someone’s nose faculty does not arise, does his life faculty not arise?”

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati,
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam a ghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati
translated: When those who die as non-percipient beings are reappearing in the non-percipient realm, at that time too their nose-faculty does not arise,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam tesam tattha ghānindriyañca
translated: but their life-faculty does not not arise. When those in the Pure Abodes are arising, at that time too their nose-faculty does not arise,

original: na uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: and their life-faculty does not not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: When anyone’s life-faculty does not not arise, does his nose-faculty not arise? Yes.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: When anyone’s nose-faculty does not arise, does his joy faculty not not arise?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ🔽tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.
analyzed: cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam  tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha
translated: When those in the sensual-desire realm who die as non-percipient beings are reappearing in the sensual-desire realm,🔽at that time too their nose-faculty does not arise, but their joy faculty does not not arise.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: When those in the Pure Abodes and non-percipient beings and those in the formless realm are arising, at that time too their nose-faculty does not arise, and their joy faculty does not not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: Or, in the case of those in whom the nose faculty does not arise, in whom does the joy faculty not arise?

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ🔽tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati  cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam  tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha man indriyam na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in whom the nose faculty does not arise, in whom does the equanimity faculty … the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty not arise?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material sphere and in the immaterial sphere,🔽the nose faculty does not arise in them, but the mind faculty does not not arise.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes and in the non-percipient beings, the nose faculty does not arise and the mind faculty does not not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Ghānindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā ghānindriya mūlaka
translated: Or, in the case of those in whom the mind faculty does not arise, in whom does the nose faculty not arise? In the case of those in the Pure Abodes …🔽(The nose faculty is to be taken in each case.)

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Whose female faculty does not arise there, in the case of those whose male faculty does not arise there?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriya  na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam
translated: Those who die as women in the sense-sphere and are reborn in the sense-sphere, their female faculty🔽does not arise there, but their male faculty does not not arise there. Those in the fine-material and immaterial realms,

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati purisindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati purisa indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: their female faculty does not arise there, and their male faculty does not not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: But whose male faculty does not not arise there, in the case of those whose female faculty does not arise there?

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Whose female faculty does not arise there, in the case of those whose life faculty does not arise there?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: Those who die as women in the sense-sphere and are reborn in the sense-sphere, in the fine-material and immaterial realms,

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha
translated: their female faculty does not arise there, but their life faculty does not not arise there.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjittha  yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes, the femininity faculty does not arise there, and the life faculty does not arise there.🔽As to “wherever the life faculty does not arise, the femininity faculty does not arise there”:

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ🔽tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati  cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam  tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha
translated: As to “wherever the femininity faculty does not arise, the joy faculty does not arise there”:🔽In the case of those in the immaterial becoming who are dying and being reborn in the immaterial becoming, and in the case of those in the Pure Abodes who are dying and being reborn in the Pure Abodes,🔽the femininity faculty does not arise there, but the joy faculty does not not arise there.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati somanassindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes and in the case of non-percipient beings and those in the immaterial becoming, the femininity faculty does not arise there, and the joy faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: As to “wherever the joy faculty does not arise, the femininity faculty does not arise there”:

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “When anyone’s female faculty does not arise, does his/her equanimity faculty … his/her faith faculty … his/her mindfulness faculty … his/her concentration faculty … his/her understanding faculty … his/her mind faculty not arise?”

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ🔽tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.
analyzed: cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam  tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha
translated: When those in the sensual realm who are not women are being reborn among those in the sensual realm and among those in the fine-material realm and among those in the immaterial realm,🔽their female faculty does not arise, but their mind faculty does not not arise.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Itthindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjittha  yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā itthi indriya mūlaka
translated: Among those in the Pure Abodes and among those non-percipient beings, their female faculty does not arise and their mind faculty does not not arise.🔽“When anyone’s mind faculty does not arise, does his/her female faculty not arise?”

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvita indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “When anyone’s male faculty does not arise, does his/her life faculty not arise?”

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: When those in the sensual realm who are not men are being reborn in the sensual realm, and when those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha
translated: die, their faculty of manliness does not arise there, but their faculty of life does not not arise there.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjittha  yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā
translated: When those in the Pure Abodes die, their faculty of manliness and their faculty of life do not arise there.🔽But when anyone’s faculty of life does not arise there, does his faculty of manliness not arise there too?

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati  cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam
translated: When anyone’s faculty of manliness does not arise in any given case, does his faculty of joy not arise there too?🔽When those in the sensual realm who are not men are being reborn in the sensual realm, and when those in the fine-material realm

original: tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha
translated: die, their faculty of manliness does not arise there, but their faculty of joy does not not arise there.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes and of non-percipient beings, the male faculty does not arise there, and the joy faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā  yassa yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: As to those in whom the joy faculty does not arise, does the male faculty not arise in them?🔽As to those in whom the male faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty … the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the mind faculty not arise in them?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ🔽tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.
analyzed: cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam  tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those who die in the sense-sphere and are reborn in the sense-sphere, in the fine-material sphere, or in the immaterial sphere,🔽the male faculty does not arise there, but the mind faculty does not not arise there.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes and of non-percipient beings, the male faculty does not arise there, and the mind faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Purisindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā purisa indriya mūlaka
translated: Or, if the male faculty does not arise in any given case, does the mind faculty not arise in that case?🔽

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or, in the case of anyone in whom the male faculty does not arise, does the faculty of life not arise in him there?🔽The case is the same.

original: Catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa
analyzed: catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam tattha jīvitindriya  na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa
translated: In the case of those dying in the four-constituent becoming and the five-constituent becoming, in the course of an existence, at the moment of the cognitive series’ dissolution, the faculty of life🔽does not arise in them there, but the faculty of sorrow does not not arise.

original: bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattā cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattā cavantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjati somanassindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those dying in the Pure Abodes, at the moment of the rebirth-linking consciousness’s dissolution, and in the case of those dying in the existence of the non-percipient beings, the faculty of life does not arise in them there, nor does the faculty of sorrow.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, in the case of anyone in whom the faculty of sorrow does not arise, does the faculty of life not arise in him there?

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa uppādakkhaṇe asaññasattaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe asaññasattam upapajjantānam tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those reappearing in the Pure Abodes at the moment of the rebirth-linking consciousness’s arising, and in the case of those reappearing in the existence of the non-percipient beings, the faculty of life

original: somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ🔽upapatticittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattā cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca
analyzed: somanassa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsāna  upapatti cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattā cavantānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyañca
translated: when the mind element and the mind-consciousness element have arisen and then are discontinued, and when beings are reborn in the Pure Abodes, then at the moment of death two faculties cease simultaneously, i.e. the life faculty and the mental faculty.🔽When the mind faculty has arisen and then is discontinued, and when beings are reborn in the Pure Abodes, then at the moment of death three faculties cease simultaneously, i.e. the life faculty, the mental faculty, and the joy faculty.

original: na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati.🔽Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati  yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: When the faculties have arisen and then are discontinued, and when beings are reborn in the Pure Abodes, then at the moment of death four faculties cease simultaneously, i.e. the life faculty, the mental faculty, the joy faculty, and the equanimity faculty.

original: Catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa
analyzed: catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam tattha jīvitindriya  na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa
translated: When the faculties have arisen and then are discontinued, and when beings are reborn in the Pure Abodes, then at the moment of death five faculties cease simultaneously, i.e. the life faculty, the mental faculty, the joy faculty, the equanimity faculty, and one of the faculties beginning with faith.🔽When the faculties have arisen and then are discontinued, and when beings are reborn in the Pure Abodes, then at the moment of death six faculties cease simultaneously, i.e. the life faculty, the mental faculty, the joy faculty, the equanimity faculty, and two of the faculties beginning with faith.

original: bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattā cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattā cavantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: When the faculties have arisen and then are discontinued, and when beings are reborn in the Pure Abodes, then at the moment of death seven faculties cease simultaneously, i.e. the life faculty, the mental faculty, the joy faculty, the equanimity faculty, and three of the faculties beginning with faith.🔽When the faculties have arisen and then are discontinued, and when beings are reborn in the Pure Abodes, then at the moment of death eight faculties cease simultaneously, i.e. the life faculty, the mental faculty, the joy faculty, the equanimity faculty, and four of the faculties beginning with faith.🔽When the faculties have arisen and then are discontinued, and when beings are reborn in the Pure Abodes, then at the moment of death nine faculties cease simultaneously, i.e. the life faculty, the mental faculty, the joy faculty, the equanimity faculty, and five of the faculties beginning with faith.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ asaññasattaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na🔽uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati iti  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam asaññasattam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam na  uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa
translated: Or, in the case of anyone in whom the mind faculty does not arise, does the life faculty not arise in him there?🔽In the case of those being reborn in the Pure Abodes and in the case of those being reborn among the non-percipient beings, the mind faculty does not arise in them there.

original: bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattā cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca
analyzed: bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattā cavantānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjittha jīvitindriyam ca
translated: But the life faculty does arise in them there. In the case of those being reborn in the Pure Abodes and in the case of those dying among the non-percipient beings, the mind faculty does not arise in them there,

original: na uppajjati. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na uppajjati jīvitindriya mūlaka
translated: and neither does the life faculty.

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: In the case of anyone in whom the joy faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty … the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty not arise in him there?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe somanassavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe somanassa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha
translated: In the case of all those at the moment of the dissolution of their mind elements and at the moment of rebirth-linking with a mind-element free from joy, the mind faculty does not arise in them there.

original: somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsaṁ
analyzed: somanassindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsa
translated: when the mind faculty has arisen, the joy faculty has not arisen there.🔽When those in the Pure Abodes

original: upapajjantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: upapajjantānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: are arising mindfully, or when those in the Non-percipient (Realm) are arising, the joy faculty has not arisen there, and the mind faculty has not arisen there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti? Āmantā. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjati iti āmantā somanassindriya mūlaka
translated: But if someone’s mind faculty has not arisen there, has the joy faculty not arisen there too? It may not have. (Joy faculty – mind faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: If someone’s equanimity faculty has not arisen there, has their faith faculty not arisen there too?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha🔽upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha  upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsāna
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the consciousness of all those whose minds are disassociated from equanimity, and at the moment of the arising of those whose minds are disassociated from equanimity,🔽the equanimity faculty has not arisen there, but their faith faculty has not arisen there. At the moment of the dissolution of the consciousness of those in the Pure Abodes,

original: upapatticittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati
analyzed: upapatti cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati
translated: and of those in the Non-percipient (Realm), the equanimity faculty has not arisen there, and the faith faculty has not arisen there.

original: saddhindriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: saddhindriyam ca na uppajjittha  yassa vā pana yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: and the faith faculty has arisen, the equanimity faculty has not arisen.🔽Or, when someone’s faith faculty has not arisen, has his equanimity faculty not arisen too?

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe
translated: Those who are being reborn in the Pure Abodes: the faith faculty has not arisen for them there,🔽but the equanimity faculty has not arisen. At the moment of the dissolution of the mind element and mind-consciousness element of those in the Pure Abodes, and of those in the immaterial realms,

original: tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: the faith faculty has not arisen and the equanimity faculty has not arisen.

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: When someone’s equanimity faculty has not arisen, has his wisdom faculty … his mind faculty not arisen?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe upekkhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe upekkhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the mind of all beings, and at the moment of the arising of the mind that is not accompanied by equanimity,

original: upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ
analyzed: upekkhindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsāna
translated: the equanimity faculty has not arisen for them, but the mind faculty has not arisen. At the moment of the dissolution of the mind of those in the Pure Abodes,

original: upapatticittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati
analyzed: upapatti cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking in the non-percipient realm, in the case of those without consciousness, the faculty of equanimity …

original: manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: manindriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: and the faculty of mind do not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjati iti  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha  upekkhindriyam na uppajjati suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe
translated: Or alternatively, in the case of those in whom the faculty of mind does not arise, does the faculty of equanimity not arise in them?🔽In the case of those who attain the fourth jhāna of the pure abodes, the faculty of mind does not arise in them, but the faculty of equanimity does arise.

original: tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjati. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: tesam tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhindriya mūlaka
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking in the fourth jhāna of the pure abodes, in the case of those without consciousness, the faculty of mind and the faculty of equanimity do not arise.

original: Yassa yattha saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: In the case of those in whom the faculty of faith does not arise, does the faculty of understanding … the faculty of mind not arise?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe saddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha
translated: At the time of the arising of consciousness of those who are without faith,

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe ñāṇavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam tattha paññindriya  na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa
translated: At the instant of the dissolution of consciousness of all who are dying, and at the instant of the arising of the mind-element of those dying with a mind-element, the faculty of wisdom🔽does not arise in them, but the faculty of mind does not not arise. At the instant of the dissolution of the rebirth-linking consciousness of those beings who are percipient of the Pure Abodes,

original: bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: bhaṅga kkhaṇe asaññasattānam tesam tattha paññindriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: the faculty of wisdom does not arise in them, and the faculty of mind does not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyam na uppajjati iti  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: But if anyone’s faculty of mind does not arise, does his faculty of wisdom not arise too?

original: paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Suddhāvāsānaṁ upapatticittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: paññindriyam na uppajjati suddhāvāsānam upapatti cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe
translated: When those beings who are percipient of the Pure Abodes are being reborn, the faculty of mind does not arise in them, but the faculty of wisdom does not not arise. At the instant of the dissolution of the rebirth-linking consciousness of those beings who are percipient of the Pure Abodes, and of those who are non-percipient,

original: tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjittha paññindriyañca na uppajjati. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽10.2.1.5. Paccuppannānāgatavāra
analyzed: tesam tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjittha paññindriyam ca na uppajjati paññindriya mūlaka
translated: the faculty of mind does not arise in them, and the faculty of wisdom does not arise. (The faculty of wisdom.)🔽The Present and Future Method

original: 10.2.1.5.1. Anulomapuggala
analyzed: anuloma puggala
translated: The Direct Method in Regard to Persons

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa sotindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa sotindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When the eye faculty arises in anyone, does the ear faculty arise in them?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ pañcavokāraṁ upapajjantānaṁ ye ca arūpaṁ upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti🔽tesaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ sotindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam pañcavokāram upapajjantānam ye ca arūpam upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti  tesam upapajjantānam tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam sotindriyam uppajjissati
translated: In those who are dying and reappearing in the five-constituent becoming, and in those who are dying and reappearing in the formless becoming,🔽when they are reappearing, their eye faculty arises but their ear faculty does not arise.

original: Itaresaṁ sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyañca uppajjati sotindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjati sotindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In those who are dying and reappearing with eyes, when they are reappearing, their eye faculty arises and their ear faculty arises.

original: Yassa vā pana sotindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ sotindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no
analyzed: yassa vā pana sota indriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjati iti  sabbesam cavantānam acakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam sotindriyam uppajjissati no
translated: But when the ear faculty arises in anyone, does their eye faculty arise?🔽In all who are dying and in those who are dying and reappearing without eyes, their ear faculty will arise but

original: ca tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ sotindriyañca
analyzed: ca tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam sotindriyam ca
translated: their eye faculty does not arise. In those who are dying and reappearing with eyes, their ear faculty will arise and

original: uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjissati cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: their eye faculty arises.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa ghāna indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When the eye faculty arises in anyone, does the nose faculty arise in them?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ pañcavokāraṁ upapajjantānaṁ ye ca rūpāvacaraṁ arūpāvacaraṁ upapajjitvā🔽parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam pañcavokāram upapajjantānam ye ca rūpāvacaram arūpāvacaram upapajjitvā  parinibbāyissanti tesam upapajjantānam tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam
translated: When those destined for rebirth in the five-constituent becoming are being reborn, and when those who will attain Nibbāna in the fine-material or immaterial becoming are being reborn,🔽then in those who are being reborn, the eye faculty arises,

original: ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: ghāna indriyam uppajjissati itaresam sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam cakkhu indriyam ca
translated: but their nose faculty does not arise. In those who are being reborn and who possess eyes, their eye faculty arises

analyzed: uppajjati ghānindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: and their nose faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?🔽Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati,
analyzed: yassa vā pana ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjati iti  sabbesam cavantānam acakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam ghānindriyam uppajjissati
translated: But in the case of those whose nose faculty will arise, does their eye faculty arise?🔽In all those who die and are not being reborn with eyes, their nose faculty will arise,

translated: but their eye faculty does not arise. In those who are being reborn and possess eyes, their nose faculty will arise

original: uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjissati cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjati
translated: and their eye faculty arises.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati tassa itthindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam uppajjati tassa itthi indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When the eye faculty arises in a given person, does the femininity faculty arise in that person?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ pañcavokāraṁ upapajjantānaṁ ye ca rūpāvacaraṁ arūpāvacaraṁ upapajjitvā
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam pañcavokāram upapajjantānam ye ca rūpāvacaram arūpāvacaram upapajjitvā
translated: When those destined for rebirth in the five-constituent becoming are being reborn,🔽and when those who will attain Nibbāna in the fine-material or immaterial becoming are being reborn,

analyzed: parinibbāyissanti ye ca purisāḥ etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti  tesam upapajjantānam tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no ca tesam itthi indriyam uppajjissati
translated: and when men are being reborn in the same becoming with the same potentialities as those who will attain Nibbāna after showing the path,🔽then their eye faculty arises and their femininity faculty will not arise.

original: Itaresaṁ sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ cakkhundriyañca uppajjati itthindriyañca uppajjissati.

translated: But when those with eye faculty are being reborn, their eye faculty arises and their femininity faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana itthindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjatīti?

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ itthindriyaṁ uppajjissati,🔽no ca tesaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjati. Sacakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ itthindriyañca
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam acakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam itthi indriyam uppajjissati  no ca tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjati sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam itthi indriyam ca

analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam pañcavokāram upapajjantānam tesam cakkhu indriyam uppajjati no  ca tesam jīvitindriyam uppajjissati itaresam sa cakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam

translated: But when the life faculty arises in anyone, does the eye faculty arise in him?

original: Sabbesaṁ cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati,
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam acakkhukānam upapajjantānam tesam jīvitindriyam uppajjissati

original: uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca uppajjati.

analyzed: no ca tesam ghāna indriyam uppajjati sa ghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam jīvitindriyam ca

translated: Of those reappearing in the sensual-sphere existence, of those reappearing in the same state of existence with equanimity, and of those who will attain Nibbāna there without accumulating kamma for a fresh existence, the nose-faculty arises and the equanimity faculty will arise.

analyzed: uppajjati somanassa indriyam ca uppajjissati

analyzed: yassa vā pana somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tassa gha an indriyam uppajjati iti

translated: In the case of all those who are dying and are not being reborn as women, their life faculty will arise, but not their femininity faculty. In the case of those women who are being reborn, their life faculty will arise and their femininity faculty arises.

original: Yassa itthindriyaṁ uppajjati tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?

analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam itthīnam upapajjantīnam yāḥ ca itthiyaḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti

analyzed: tāsam upapajjantīnam tāsam itthi indriyam uppajjati no ca tāsam somanassindriyam uppajjissati
