translated: but the faculty of equanimity does not not arise. At the moment of the dissolution of the last consciousness accompanied by equanimity,

original: na uppajjati. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na uppajjati upekkhindriya mūlaka
translated: of those possessed of the last consciousness accompanied by joy, the faculty of mind does not not arise, and the faculty of equanimity does not arise.🔽(The section based on the faculty of equanimity.)

original: Yassa saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa saddhi indriyam na uppajjati tassa paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: If the faith faculty has arisen in him, has the understanding faculty … the mind faculty arisen?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe saddhāvippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ🔽asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe saddhā vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannānaṃ  asaññasattānam tesam saddhi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam manindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the consciousness of all who die and are reborn in the immaterial state, at the moment of the rebirth-linking of those who are percipient at rebirth, at the moment of the reappearance of consciousness of those who reappear without percipient, at the moment of attaining cessation, of those attaining cessation,🔽the faith faculty has not arisen, and the mind faculty has not arisen.

original: Pacchimacittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ saddhindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: pacchimacittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam saddhindriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the last consciousness of those dying in the immaterial state, of those dying in the non-percipient realm, of those whose consciousness is disturbed, the faith faculty has not arisen, and the mind faculty has not arisen.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Pacchimacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyam na uppajjati iti  pacchimacittassa uppāda khaṇe tesam manindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam saddhindriya
translated: If the mind faculty has not arisen in him, has the faith faculty arisen?🔽At the moment of the arising of the first consciousness of those reborn in the immaterial state, of those reborn in the non-percipient realm, of those whose consciousness is disturbed, the mind faculty has not arisen, and the faith faculty has not arisen.

original: na uppajjati. Pacchimacittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ manindriyañca na uppajjissati saddhindriyañca🔽na uppajjati. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na uppajjati pacchimacittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam manindriyam ca na uppajjissati saddhindriyañca 🔽na uppajjati saddhi indriya mūlaka
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the last consciousness of those dying in the immaterial state, of those dying in the non-percipient realm, of those whose consciousness is disturbed, the mind faculty has not arisen, and the faith faculty has not arisen.

original: Yassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa paññindriyam na uppajjati tassa manindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: When the faculty of wisdom does not arise, does the faculty of mind not arise?

original: Sabbesaṁ cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe ñāṇavippayuttacittassa uppādakkhaṇe nirodhasamāpannānaṁ
analyzed: sabbesam cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe ñāṇa vippayutta cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe nirodha samāpannānaṃ
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the mind of all who are dying, at the moment of the arising of the mind of those devoid of full awareness, of those attained to the cessation ,

original: asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ paññindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam paññindriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam manindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: of those in the existence of the non-percipient beings, the faculty of wisdom does not arise, but the faculty of mind does not not arise.

original: pacchimacittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ paññindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: pacchimacittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam paññindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the last consciousness of those dying in the existence of the non-percipient beings, the faculty of wisdom does not arise, and the faculty of mind does not not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Pacchimacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ paññindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjati. Pacchimacittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ manindriyañca na uppajjissati paññindriyañca
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjissati tassa paññindriyam na uppajjati iti  pacchimacittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam manindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam paññindriya  na uppajjati pacchimacittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam manindriyam ca na uppajjissati paññindriyañca
translated: When the faculty of mind does not not arise, does the faculty of wisdom not arise?🔽At the moment of the arising of the last consciousness of those dying in the existence of the non-percipient beings, the faculty of mind does not not arise, but the faculty of wisdom does not arise.

original: na uppajjati. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na uppajjati paññindriya mūlaka
translated: At the moment of the dissolution of the last consciousness of those dying in the existence of the non-percipient beings, the faculty of mind does not not arise, and the faculty of wisdom does not arise.🔽(The faculty of wisdom is to be combined with the faculty of mind in the same way as the faculty of concentration was combined with the faculty of understanding.)

original: 10.2.1.5.5. Paccanīkaokāsa
analyzed: paccanīka okāsa
translated: The reverse order.

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? …pe….
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tattha sotindriyam na uppajjissati iti pe
translated: “Where the eye faculty does not arise, does the ear faculty not arise there?” …

original: 10.2.1.5.6. Paccanīkapuggalokāsa
analyzed: paccanīka puggala okāsa
translated: … The section on individuals and on directions in reverse order.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?🔽Pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ acakkhukānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha sotindriyam na uppajjissati iti  pañcavokārā cavantānam acakkhukānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha cakkhundriya
translated: “When someone’s eye faculty does not arise, does their ear faculty not arise there?”

original: na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Pañcavokāre parinibbantānaṁ
analyzed: na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha sotindriyam na uppajjissati pañcavokāre parinibbantāna
translated: When those without eyes who are dying and being reborn in the sense-sphere die, their eye faculty does not arise there, but their ear faculty does not not arise there. When those in the five-constituent becoming who are entering Nibbāna die,

original: asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati sotindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjati sotindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: and when non-percipient beings and those in the formless becoming die, their eye faculty does not arise there, and their ear faculty does not not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: “When someone’s ear faculty will not arise there, does their eye faculty not arise there?”

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ pañcavokāraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam pañcavokāram upapajjantānam tesam tattha sotindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: When those in the five-constituent becoming who are being reborn in the five-constituent becoming die, their ear faculty will not arise there,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjati. Pañcavokāre parinibbantānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati pañcavokāre parinibbantānam asaññasattānam
translated: but their eye faculty does not not arise there. Those attaining Nibbāna in the five-constituent becoming, and non-percipient beings,

original: arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha sotindriyañca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: arūpānam tesam tattha sotindriyam ca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: and those in the immaterial becoming: their ear faculty will not arise and their eye faculty does not arise there.

analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: “Those in whom the eye faculty does not arise, does their nose faculty not arise too?”

analyzed: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: and those in the immaterial realm in their last existence: their life faculty does not arise and their nose faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: “Those whose nose faculty does not arise, does their pleasant faculty not arise too?”

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam
translated: Those in the sensual realm passing away and being reborn in the sensual realm, and those in the fine-material realm

original: tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: whose nose faculty does not arise there, but their pleasant faculty does not not arise there.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam arūpānam

original: ye ca upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: ye ca upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cavantānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca
translated: and those who will attain Nibbāna through aspiration: their nose faculty does not arise and

original: na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: their pleasant faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Pacchimabhavikānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ ye ca saghānakā upekkhāya upapajjitvā🔽parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,🔽no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati iti  pacchimabhavikānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam ye ca saghānakāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā  parinibbāyissanti tesam upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjissati  no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare
translated: Or, in the case of those who will not generate the joy faculty there, will the nose faculty not arise?🔽In the case of those beings in the realm of desire who are being reborn in the realm of desire, and in the case of those who, having been reborn in the realm of desire through equanimity, will attain final Nibbāna there, the joy faculty will not arise in those being reborn,

original: pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ ye ca upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti🔽tesaṁ cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati ghānindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam arūpānam ye ca upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti  tesam cavantānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjissati ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: but the nose faculty will arise. In the case of those who are attaining final Nibbāna in the realm of desire, in the case of those who are being reborn in the realm of form, in the case of those beings in the immaterial realm, and in the case of those who, having been reborn in the realm of desire through equanimity, will attain final Nibbāna there, the joy faculty will not arise in those who are dying,🔽and the nose faculty will not arise either.🔽“In the case of those who have not made an end of suffering, has the nose faculty … the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty … the body faculty … the mind faculty … the body-consciousness faculty … the mind-consciousness faculty arisen?

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: “In the case of those who have not made an end of suffering, has the nose faculty … the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty … the body faculty … the mind faculty … the body-consciousness faculty … the mind-consciousness faculty not arisen?”

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: of those in the sensual-desire realm who die and are being reborn below, in the sensual-desire realm, and of those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm,

original: tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: the nose faculty does not arise there, and the equanimity faculty does not not arise there.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam
translated: of those in the sensual-desire realm who are attaining Nibbāna, of those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm in their last existence, and of those beings who are non-percipient,

original: ye ca somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: ye ca somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cavantānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam ca
translated: and of those who, dying with joy, will attain Nibbāna, the nose faculty does not arise there,

original: na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: and the equanimity faculty does not not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Pacchimabhavikānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ ye ca saghānakā somanassena upapajjitvā
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati iti  pacchimabhavikānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam ye ca saghānakā somanassena upapajjitvā
translated: But whose equanimity faculty does not arise there?

original: parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,
analyzed: parinibbāyissanti tesam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: of those in the sensual-desire realm who are being reborn below, in the sensual-desire realm, and of those who, dying with joy, will attain Nibbāna, the equanimity faculty does not arise there,🔽and the nose faculty does not not arise there.

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare🔽arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ ye ca somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare  arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam ye ca somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: but their nose faculty does not not arise there. Those dying in the sensual realm and being reborn in the fine-material realm,

original: tesaṁ cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati ghānindriyañca na uppajjati.🔽Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ aghānakānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: tesam cavantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca na uppajjati  yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti  cavantānam aghānakānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: those dying in the sensual realm and being reborn in the immaterial realm, those dying in the immaterial realm and being reborn in the immaterial realm, those dying in the immaterial realm and being reborn in the sensual realm, those who attain Nibbāna in the interval, and non-percipient beings: their equanimity faculty and nose faculty do not arise there.

original: tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: Those in whom the nose faculty does not arise, in them the mind faculty does not not arise.🔽Those dying in the sensual realm and not obtaining the nose, those dying in the sensual realm and being reborn in the sensual realm, those dying in the sensual realm and being reborn in the fine-material realm, those dying in the sensual realm and being reborn in the immaterial realm, those dying in the fine-material realm and being reborn in the fine-material realm, those dying in the fine-material realm and being reborn in the immaterial realm, those dying in the immaterial realm and being reborn in the immaterial realm, those dying in the immaterial realm and being reborn in the sensual realm, those who attain Nibbāna in the interval: their nose faculty does not arise, but their mind faculty does not not arise.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam
translated: Those dying in the sensual realm and attaining Nibbāna, those dying in the fine-material realm and attaining Nibbāna, those dying in the immaterial realm and attaining Nibbāna, non-percipient beings,

original: tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: for them there the nose faculty does not arise and the mind faculty will not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, for whomsoever the mind faculty will not arise, for them the nose faculty does not arise?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ saghānakānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam saghānakānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: For those in the last life, who are not without sense-desire, and are being reborn, for them the mind faculty will not arise,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare
translated: but the nose faculty does not not arise. For those in the sensual realm who are attaining Nibbāna, and for those in the fine-material realm

original: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjissati
analyzed: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: and for those in the immaterial realm, in the last life, and for those beings devoid of perception, for them the mind faculty will not arise,

original: ghānindriyañca na uppajjati. (Ghānindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na uppajjati ghāna indriya mūlaka
translated: and the nose faculty does not arise. (The nose faculty base.)

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: For whomsoever the female faculty does not arise, for them the male faculty will not arise?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam tesam tattha itthi indriya
translated: For those in the sensual realm who are passing away and being reborn in the sensual realm, but who are not women, for them the female faculty

original: na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ
analyzed: na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati kāmāvacare parinibbantāna
translated: For those in the sensual realm attaining Nibbāna,

original: rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
analyzed: yā ca itthiyo etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
translated: for those in the form realm and formless realm, and for those women who, having shown some existence in this very state,

original: parinibbāyissanti tāsaṁ cavantīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati purisindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: parinibbāyissanti tāsam cavantīnam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati purisa indriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: will attain Nibbāna, for them as they are passing away, neither the female faculty nor the male faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, for whomsoever, in whom the male faculty will not arise, in him the female faculty will not arise?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici bhave
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam itthīnam upapajjantīnam yā ca itthiyo etena iva bhāvena katici bhave
translated: For those in their last existence who are women and are being reborn, and for those women who, having shown some existence in this very state,

original: dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tāsaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,
analyzed: dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tāsam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati
translated: will attain Nibbāna, for them as they are being reborn, the male faculty will not arise,

original: no ca tāsaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: no ca tāsam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacarānam
translated: but for them the female faculty will not not arise. For those in the sensual realm attaining Nibbāna, for those in the form realm and formless realm,

original: arūpāvacarānaṁ yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: yā ca itthiyaḥ etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: and of those women of the formless worlds who, after manifesting this or that becoming, will attain Nibbāna there,

original: tāsaṁ cavantīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjissati itthindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tāsam cavantīnam tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: when they are passing away, the male faculty does not arise in them and the female faculty does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: When someone’s female faculty does not arise, does his life faculty not arise too?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: When those in the sensual realm who are not women are being reborn in the sensual realm, and when those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: the female faculty does not arise in them, but their life faculty does not not arise.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha
translated: When those in the sensual realm attain Nibbāna, and when those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm are in their last existence,

original: itthindriyañca na uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: the female faculty does not arise in them and the life faculty does not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: When someone’s life faculty does not arise, does his female faculty not arise too?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,🔽no ca tāsaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati  no ca tāsam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare
translated: of women reappearing in a later existence in the immaterial sphere, the life faculty will not arise in them,🔽but their femininity faculty will arise. Of those dying in the sensual-sphere and reappearing in the fine-material sphere,

original: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati itthindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: of those dying in the sensual sphere and reappearing in the immaterial sphere, of those dying in the sensual sphere and passing away from the last existence, of those dying in the fine-material sphere and passing away from the last existence, of those dying in the immaterial sphere and passing away from the last existence, the life faculty will not arise and their femininity faculty will not arise.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: “Where the femininity faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty not arise there?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam
translated: Of those dying in the sensual-sphere and not reappearing in the sensual sphere, of those dying in the sensual sphere and reappearing in the fine-material sphere,

original: tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: the femininity faculty does not arise in them, but their joy faculty will not not arise.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: Of those dying in the sensual sphere and passing away from the last existence, of those dying in the fine-material sphere and passing away from the last existence, of non-percipient beings, of those dying in the immaterial sphere and passing away from the last existence,

original: yā ca itthiyo upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tāsaṁ cavantīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yāḥ ca itthiyaḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tāsam cavantīnam tesam tattha
translated: of those women who attain Nibbāna in the interval, the femininity faculty does not arise in them, and their joy faculty will not arise.🔽“Where the femininity faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty not arise there?

original: itthindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: itthi indriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: and the female faculty does not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?🔽Pacchimabhavikānaṁ itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ yā ca itthiyo upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti  pacchimabhavikānam itthīnam upapajjantīnam yāḥ ca itthiyaḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: Or, when someone’s faculty of joy will not arise, his faculty of femininity does not arise?

original: tāsaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tāsaṁ tattha
analyzed: tāsam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tāsam tattha
translated: In the case of women in their last existence, of those who attain Nibbāna in the interval, of those who attain Nibbāna upon landing, of those who attain Nibbāna without any effort, of those who attain Nibbāna with effort, of those who go upstream, of those who go to the highest, and of those women who, being non-percipient, are reborn in a non-percipient realm,

original: itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ
analyzed: itthi indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam
translated: the faculty of joy will not arise, but not so the faculty of femininity.

original: asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ yā ca itthiyo upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tāsaṁ
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam yāḥ ca itthiyaḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tāsa
translated: In the case of those attaining Nibbāna in the fine-material realm, in the immaterial realm, and in the case of those who are without consciousness, and of those women who, being non-percipient, are reborn in a non-percipient realm,

original: cavantīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati itthindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: cavantīnam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca na uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: the faculty of joy will not arise, and the faculty of femininity also will not arise.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: In the case of those whose faculty of femininity does not arise, their faculty of equanimity will not arise?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: When those in the sensual realm who are not women are being reborn among the gods of the sensual realm, among the Brahmā-gods, and among the gods of the form realm,

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: at that time their female faculty does not arise, and their equanimity faculty does not not arise.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam
translated: When those in the sensual realm attain final Nibbāna, when those in the form realm and those in the formless realm are in their last existence, and when non-percipient beings

original: yā ca itthiyo somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tāsaṁ cavantīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yāḥ ca itthiyaḥ somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tāsam cavantīnam tesam tattha
translated: and when women who are being reborn with joy attain final Nibbāna, at the death of those women,

original: itthindriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: itthi indriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: their female faculty does not arise and their equanimity faculty does not not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: But whose equanimity faculty does not arise there, does their female faculty not arise there too?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ yā ca itthiyo somanassena upapajjitvā
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam itthīnam upapajjantīnam yā ca itthiyo somanassena upapajjitvā
translated: When women who are being reborn in their last existence, and when women who are being reborn with joy

original: parinibbāyissanti tāsaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,
analyzed: parinibbāyissanti tāsam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: attain final Nibbāna, at the rebirth of those women, their equanimity faculty does not arise there,

original: no ca tāsaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare
analyzed: no ca tāsam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare
translated: but it is not the case that the female faculty does not arise there.🔽Those in the sensual realm who are attaining Nibbāna, and those in the fine-material realm

original: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ yā ca itthiyo somanassena upapajjitvā
analyzed: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam yā ca itthiyo somanassena upapajjitvā
translated: and those in the immaterial realm in their last existence, and those beings who are non-percipient,🔽and those women who will be reborn mindfully and attain Nibbāna there:

original: parinibbāyissanti tāsaṁ cavantīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati
analyzed: parinibbāyissanti tāsam cavantīnam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: when they are passing away, the faculty of equanimity and

original: itthindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: the female faculty will not arise in them.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: In regard to those for whom the female faculty does not arise, the faculty of conviction … the faculty of understanding … the faculty of mindfulness … the faculty of concentration …

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na itthīnaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na itthīnam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: In those passing away in the sensual realm who are not women and are not being reborn in the sensual realm, and in those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm,

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: the female faculty does not arise there, but it is not the case that the faculty of concentration does not arise there.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam
translated: Those in the sensual realm who are attaining Nibbāna, and those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm in their last existence, and those beings who are non-percipient,🔽and those who are without citta.

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: for them there the femininity faculty does not arise and the mind faculty will not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, where the mind faculty will not arise, does the femininity faculty not arise there?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ itthīnaṁ upapajjantīnaṁ tāsaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam itthīnam upapajjantīnam tāsam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: For those in the last phase of becoming who are being reborn as women, the mind faculty will not arise there,

original: no ca tāsaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare
analyzed: no ca tāsam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare
translated: but the femininity faculty does not not arise there. For those in the sensual realm who are attaining Nibbāna, for those in the fine-material realm

original: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjissati
analyzed: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: and for those in the immaterial realm in the last phase of becoming, for those in the existence-as-perception-being, the mind faculty will not arise there

original: itthindriyañca na uppajjati. (Itthindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: itthi indriyam ca na uppajjati itthi indriya mūlaka
translated: and the femininity faculty does not arise there. (The femininity faculty is concluded.)

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: Where the masculinity faculty does not arise, does the life faculty not arise there?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: For those in the sensual realm who are dying and being reborn as men, for those in the fine-material realm and for those in the immaterial realm

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: their male faculty does not arise there, but their life faculty does not not arise there.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha
translated: Those dying in the sensual realm and those in their last existence in the fine-material and immaterial realms

original: purisindriyañca na uppajjati jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: their male faculty does not arise there and their life faculty does not not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: But those whose life faculty does not not arise, does their male faculty not arise there?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,🔽no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam purisānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati  no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare
translated: Those in their last existence who are men and are being reborn, their life faculty does not not arise there,🔽but their male faculty does not arise there. Those dying in the sensual realm and those in their last existence in the fine-material and immaterial realms

original: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati purisindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjissati purisindriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: their life faculty does not not arise there and their male faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: Those in whom the male faculty does not arise, does their joy faculty not not arise there?

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam
translated: when those who die as men and are being reborn in the sense-sphere who are being reborn in the fine-material sphere,

original: tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati
translated: at that time their male faculty has arisen, but their joy faculty has not yet arisen.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: when those who die in the sense-sphere attain Nibbāna, when those who die in the fine-material sphere and are being reborn in their next existence, when those beings who are non-percipient, when those beings who are formless,

original: ye ca purisā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: ye ca purisāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cavantānam tesam tattha
translated: and when those men who attain Nibbāna through exertion with joy, at the time of their death,

original: purisindriyañca na uppajjati somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: at that time their male faculty has arisen and their joy faculty has not yet arisen.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: But if someone’s joy faculty has not arisen, has his male faculty not arisen too?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ ye ca purisā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam purisānam upapajjantānam ye ca purisāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: when those who die as men and are being reborn in their next existence, and when those men who attain Nibbāna through exertion with joy,

original: tesaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: tesam upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha
translated: at the time of their rebirth, at that time their joy faculty has not arisen, but their male faculty has arisen.

original: purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ
analyzed: purisa indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam
translated: the male faculty does not arise. Of those who die in the Fine Material Sphere and are rearising in the Fine Material Sphere,🔽and of those who die in the Immaterial Sphere and are rearising in the Immaterial Sphere, and of those gods who are Non-percipient Beings, and of those men who attain Nibbāna in the interval, and of those who attain Nibbāna through exertion,

original: asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ ye ca purisā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam ye ca purisāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesa
translated: and of those who attain Nibbāna through non-exertion, at the time when their equanimity faculty has arisen, but their male faculty has not yet arisen, or has already disappeared,

original: cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati purisindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: cavantānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca na uppajjissati purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: then for them the male faculty does not arise, and the equanimity faculty does not not arise.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ🔽tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam na uppajjissati iti  cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam  tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: “Where the male faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty not arise there too?”

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam
translated: Of those dying in the sense-sphere and not being reborn in the sense-sphere, and of those dying in the sense-sphere and being reborn in the Fine Material Sphere, and of those dying in the sense-sphere and being reborn in the Immaterial Sphere,🔽and of those dying in the Fine Material Sphere and being reborn in the Fine Material Sphere, and of those dying in the Fine Material Sphere and being reborn in the Immaterial Sphere, and of those gods who are Non-percipient Beings, and of those men who attain Nibbāna in the interval, and of those who attain Nibbāna through exertion,

original: ye ca purisā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cavantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: ye ca purisā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cavantānam tesam tattha
translated: and of those who attain Nibbāna through non-exertion, at the time when their male faculty has arisen, but their equanimity faculty has not yet arisen, or has already disappeared,🔽then for them the male faculty does not arise, and the equanimity faculty does not not arise.

original: purisindriyañca na uppajjati upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: and the male faculty does not arise and the equanimity faculty does not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: Or, where the equanimity faculty does not arise, does the male faculty not arise there?

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ purisānaṁ uppajjantānaṁ ye ca purisā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti🔽tesaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam purisānam uppajjantānam ye ca purisāḥ somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti  tesam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those who die as men and are reborn spontaneously in the fine-material or immaterial realms,🔽the equanimity faculty does not arise in them there, but the male faculty does.

original: purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ
analyzed: purisa indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam
translated: In the case of those who die in the fine-material or immaterial realms or spontaneously in the immaterial realm,

original: asaññasattānaṁ ye ca purisā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ cavantānaṁ
analyzed: asaññasattānam ye ca purisā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam cavantāna
translated: and in the case of those who die in the fine-material realm and are reborn spontaneously in the immaterial realm,

original: tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati purisindriyañca na uppajjati.
analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjissati purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati
translated: the equanimity faculty does not arise and the male faculty does not arise in them there.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: “When someone’s male faculty does not arise, does his faith faculty … his wisdom faculty … his mind faculty not arise?”

original: Kāmāvacarā cavantānaṁ na purisānaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ upapajjantānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ
analyzed: cavantānam na purisānam kāmāvacaram upapajjantānam rūpāvacarānam a rūpāvacarānam
translated: When those in the sensual realm who are not men die and are reborn in the sensual realm, in the fine-material realm, or in the immaterial realm,

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: their male faculty does not arise there, but their mind faculty does not not arise there.

original: Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam
translated: When those in the sensual realm and in the fine-material realm attain final Nibbāna, and when those in the immaterial realm and the non-percipient beings die,

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjati manindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: their male faculty and their mind faculty do not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati iti
translated: “When someone’s mind faculty will not arise, will his male faculty not arise?”

original: Pacchimabhavikānaṁ purisānaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam purisānam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: When men who are destined for a happy destiny are reborn, their mind faculty will not arise there,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjati. Kāmāvacare parinibbantānaṁ rūpāvacare
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjati kāmāvacare parinibbantānam rūpāvacare
translated: but their male faculty does not not arise there. Of those dying in the Fine Material Sphere

original: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjissati
analyzed: arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: and the immaterial Sphere, of those in their last existence, and of those Non-percipient Beings, their mind faculty does not arise there,

original: purisindriyañca na uppajjati. (Purisindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: purisa indriyam ca na uppajjati purisa indriya mūlaka
translated: and their male faculty does not arise there either. (The Male Faculty)

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjati tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: When anyone’s life faculty does not arise in any given case, does his joy faculty not arise there too?

original: Catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānaṁ pavatte cittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇe tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ
analyzed: catuvokārā pañcavokārā cavantānam pavatte cittassa bhaṅga kkhaṇe tesam tattha jīvitindriya
