analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhindriyam uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: “Or, of those whose equanimity faculty arises, does their life faculty arise?”

original: Yassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ tesaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: yassa jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti  pacchima citta samaṅgīnam tesam jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha manindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: “Those whose life faculty arises, does their faith faculty … their mindfulness faculty … their concentration faculty … their understanding faculty … their bliss faculty … their joy faculty arise?”🔽Those in whom the life faculty arises, but not the mind faculty, are those in the last conscious moment. In the rest it arises.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjissati tassa jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā jīvitindriya mūlaka
translated: “Or, of those whose mind faculty arises, does their life faculty arise?”

original: Yassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa upekkhindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: “Those whose joy faculty arises, does their equanimity faculty arise?”

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ yassa cittassa anantarā somanassasampayuttapacchimacittaṁ
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam yassa cittassa anantarā somanassa sampayutta pacchima citta
translated: In those in the last conscious moment, in whom the last consciousness conjoined with joy arises immediately before the last consciousness,

original: uppajjissati tesaṁ somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjissati tesam somanassa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam upekkhindriyam uppajjissati
translated: For those in whom the joy faculty has arisen, the equanimity faculty has not arisen.

original: Itaresaṁ tesaṁ somanassindriyañca uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam tesam somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: For the rest, the joy faculty has arisen and the equanimity faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati tassa somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: But those in whom the equanimity faculty will arise, has their joy faculty arisen?

original: Yassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Those in whom the joy faculty has arisen, will their faith faculty … their mindfulness faculty … their concentration faculty … their wisdom faculty … their mind faculty arise?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ tesaṁ somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ somanassindriyañca uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: pacchimacitta samaṅgīnam tesam somanassindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha manindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: Those in the last conscious moment of the non-percipient, their joy faculty has arisen, but their mind faculty will not arise. For the rest, their joy faculty has arisen and their mind faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjissati tassa somanassindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā somanassindriya mūlaka
translated: But those in whom the mind faculty will arise, has their joy faculty arisen?🔽(The section on the joy faculty is to be expanded in the same way as the section on the faith faculty.)

original: Yassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When the faculty of equanimity arises in him, does the faculty of faith … the faculty of wisdom … the faculty of mind arise in him?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ tesaṁ upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam tesam upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha manindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In one in whom the faculty of equanimity arises, that faculty of equanimity arises, and also the faculty of mind arises.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjissati tassa upekkhindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā upekkhindriya mūlaka  yassa saddhi indriyam uppajjittha tassa paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Or in one in whom the faculty of mind is arising, does the faculty of equanimity arise?🔽In one in whom the faculty of faith arises, does the faculty of wisdom … the faculty of mind arise?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ tesaṁ saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ saddhindriyañca uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam tesam saddhi indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam saddhi indriyam ca uppajjittha manindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In one in whom the faculty of faith arises, that faculty of faith arises, and also the faculty of mind arises.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjissati tassa saddhindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā saddhindriya mūlaka
translated: Or, if the mind faculty has arisen in anyone, has the faith faculty arisen in that person?🔽(The faith faculty is the root.)

original: Yassa paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa paññā indriyam uppajjittha tassa manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: If the understanding faculty has arisen in anyone, has the mind faculty arisen in that person?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ tesaṁ paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ tesaṁ paññindriyañca uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam tesam paññindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam tesam paññindriyam ca uppajjittha manindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those possessing final-body consciousness, the understanding faculty has arisen in them but the mind faculty has not arisen. In the case of the rest, both the understanding faculty and the mind faculty have arisen.🔽Or, if the mind faculty has arisen in anyone, has the understanding faculty arisen in that person?

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa paññindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam uppajjissati tassa paññindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā paññindriya mūlaka
translated: (The understanding faculty is the root.)

original: 10.2.1.6.2. Anulomaokāsa
analyzed: anuloma okāsa
translated: ..... In the case of the faculties, in the case of the directions,

original: Yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tattha sotindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti? …pe….
analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tattha sotindriyam uppajjissati iti pe
translated: In whatever direction the eye faculty arises, does the ear faculty arise there?

original: 10.2.1.6.3. Anulomapuggalokāsa
analyzed: anuloma puggala ukāsa
translated: ..... In the case of the faculties, in the case of the directions, in the case of the persons,

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha sotindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha sotindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: In anyone in whatever direction the eye faculty has arisen, has the ear faculty arisen there?

original: Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: In the case of those of the five-constituent kind, the eye faculty arises there, but not their eye-consciousness element.

original: tattha sotindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca🔽uppajjittha sotindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: tattha sotindriyam uppajjissati itaresam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyañca  uppajjittha sotindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: Those of the five-constituent becoming who are due to reappear in a later existence, their eye-faculty has arisen there, but their ear-faculty will not arise there. Those of the five-constituent becoming, their eye-faculty has arisen there and their ear-faculty will arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or, those in whom the ear-faculty will arise, has their eye-faculty arisen there?

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Those in whom the eye-faculty has arisen, will their nose-faculty arise there?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha,🔽no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam rūpāvacarānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha  no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati itaresam kāmāvacarānam tesam tattha
translated: Those of the sensual-desire realm who are due to reappear in a later existence, and those of the fine-material realm, their eye-faculty has arisen there,

original: cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha ghānindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: cakkhu indriyañca uppajjittha ghāna indriyañca uppajjissati
translated: but their nose-faculty will not arise there. Those of the sensual-desire realm, their eye-faculty has arisen there and their nose-faculty will arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or, where the nose faculty will arise, will the eye faculty have arisen there?

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ ye ca purisā eteneva bhāvena katici bhave
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjissati iti  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam rūpāvacarānam ye ca purisāḥ etena iva bhāvena katici bhave
translated: Where the eye faculty has arisen, will the femininity faculty arise there?

original: dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm who will be reborn in the fine-material realm, and in the case of those men who will, in this very existence, show the path to a number of existences and then attain parinibbāna, the eye faculty has arisen there, but the femininity faculty will not arise there.

original: itthindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha🔽itthindriyañca uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: itthi indriyam uppajjissati itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjittha  itthi indriyañca uppajjissati  yassa vā pana yattha itthi indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: In the case of the rest of those in the sensual realm, the eye faculty has arisen there and the femininity faculty will arise there.🔽Or, where the femininity faculty will arise, will the eye faculty have arisen there?

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Where the eye faculty has arisen, will the masculinity faculty arise there?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici🔽bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam rūpāvacarānam yā ca itthiyā etena iva bhāvena katicid  bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: In the case of those of the sensual-desire realm who are in their last existence and are of the fine-material sphere, and in the case of women who, after showing themselves in some existence or other in this way, will attain extinction, the eye faculty arises in them there, but it does not do so in those who are not of such a nature.

original: tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca🔽uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: tattha purisa indriyam uppajjissati itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca  uppajjittha purisa indriyañca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those in the sensual-desire realm who will be reborn in the fine-material realm, and in the case of those women who will, after displaying a certain existence, attain final Nibbāna, their eye faculty has arisen and their male faculty will not arise. In the case of the rest in the sensual-desire realm, their eye faculty has arisen and their male faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or, in the case of those whose male faculty will arise, has their eye faculty arisen?

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti  pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati itaresam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyañca
translated: In the case of those whose eye faculty has arisen, will their life faculty arise?

original: uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those in the five-constituent becoming who are in their last existence, their eye faculty has arisen and their life faculty will not arise. In the case of the rest in the five-constituent becoming, their eye faculty has arisen and their life faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or, where the life faculty will arise, will the eye faculty arise there?

original: Asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha. Pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha  cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha pañcavokārānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those without perception and of those in the immaterial sphere, the life faculty will arise there, but not the eye faculty.

original: cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: cakkhu indriyañca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the five-constituent becoming, both the life faculty and the eye faculty will arise there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Where the eye faculty arises, will the joy faculty arise there?

original: Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca sacakkhukā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam ye ca sa cakkhukāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: In the case of those in the five-constituent becoming who will reappear in a later existence with mind, and of those who attain Nibbāna through exertion with mind,

original: tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati
translated: the eye faculty has arisen there, but not the joy faculty.

original: Itaresaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjittha somanassindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of the rest in the five-constituent becoming, both the eye faculty and the joy faculty will arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: Or, where the faculty of joy arises, does the faculty of the eye arise there?🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca sacakkhukā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati iti  pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam ye ca sa cakkhukā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.

original: tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati
translated: As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.

original: Itaresaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam ca uppajjittha upekkhā indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.

original: Arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ
analyzed: arūpānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha cakkhundriya
translated: As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye, the faculty of the eye does not arise.🔽As to those who have the eye, the faculty of the eye arises.🔽As to those who do not have the eye

original: uppajjittha. Pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjittha pañcavokārānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: for them there the faculty of equanimity and the faculty of the eye arise.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti  pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: When anyone’s faculty of the eye arises, does his faculty of faith … his faculty of understanding … his faculty of persistence … his faculty of mindfulness … his faculty of concentration … his faculty of wisdom … his faculty of the body … his faculty of the mind arise?🔽In the case of those with five faculties in their last rebirth, there the faculty of the eye arises, but there the faculty of the mind does not arise.

original: tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyañca🔽uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: tattha manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha cakkhundriyañca  uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those with five faculties, there the faculty of the eye arises and there the faculty of the mind arises.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or when anyone’s faculty of the mind arises, does his faculty of the eye arise?

original: Arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ
analyzed: arūpānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha cakkhundriya
translated: In the case of those in the immaterial sphere, there the faculty of the mind arises, but there the faculty of the eye does not arise.

original: uppajjittha. Pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: uppajjittha pañcavokārānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca
translated: In the case of those with five faculties, there the faculty of the mind arises and there the faculty of the eye arises.

original: uppajjittha. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjittha cakkhu indriya mūlaka
translated: (The base of the eye faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca purisā eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjissati iti  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam ye ca purisāḥ etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
translated: When the nose faculty arises in a certain person, does the femininity faculty arise in him?

original: parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ
analyzed: parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha itthi indriya
translated: In those in the sensual realm in their last existence, and in those who, as men, will attain Nibbāna in that very same existence, the nose faculty arises, but not the femininity faculty.

original: uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca uppajjittha itthindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjissati itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca uppajjittha itthi indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the rest in the sensual realm, both the nose faculty and the femininity faculty arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha itthi indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: But in those in whom the femininity faculty will arise, does the nose faculty arise?

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: In those in whom the nose faculty arises, does the masculinity faculty arise?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam yā ca itthiyo etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
translated: In those in the sensual realm in their last existence, and in those who, as women, will attain Nibbāna in that very same existence, the nose faculty arises, but not the masculinity faculty.

original: parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ
analyzed: parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha purisa indriya
translated: for them there the nose faculty has arisen, but there the male faculty

original: uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjissati itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: will not arise. For the rest of those in the sensual realm, there the nose faculty has arisen and there the male faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: But, where the male faculty will arise, will the nose faculty have arisen there?

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati itaresam kāmāvacarānam tesam tattha ghānindriyañca
translated: Where the nose faculty has arisen, will the life faculty arise there?🔽For those in the sensual realm in their last existence, there the nose faculty has arisen, but there the life faculty

original: uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: will not arise. For the rest of those in the sensual realm, there the nose faculty has arisen and there the life faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: But, where the life faculty will arise, will the nose faculty have arisen there?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: In the case of those material and immaterial beings whose life faculty arises there, their life faculty will arise there, but not their faculties of seeing, etc.

original: tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati🔽ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati  ghānindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: Those in the fine-material sphere and those in the immaterial sphere are “those in whom the life faculty will arise” there, but they are “not those in whom the nose faculty will arise” there. Those in the sensual-sphere realm are “those in whom the life faculty will arise” there and “also those in whom the nose faculty will arise” there.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca saghānakā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati iti  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam ye ca saghānakāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: As to those in whom the nose faculty arises, does the happy mind faculty arise in them?

original: tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati
translated: Those in the sensual-sphere realm in their last existence and those who reappear in the immaterial sphere after having been in the fine-material sphere through the attainment of fruition, and those in the sensual-sphere realm who attain Nibbāna in the interval and those who attain Nibbāna through exertion and those who attain Nibbāna without exertion, and those in the sensual-sphere realm who reappear in the immaterial sphere are “those in whom the nose faculty arises” but they are “not those in whom the happy mind faculty will arise” there.

original: Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca uppajjittha somanassa indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: The rest of those in the sensual-sphere realm are “those in whom the nose faculty arises” and “also those in whom the happy mind faculty will arise” there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: As to those in whom the happy mind faculty will arise, does the nose faculty arise in them?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ
analyzed: rūpa avacarānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriya
translated: In the case of those of the fine-material sphere, the faculty of joy will arise there but the nose faculty will not arise there.

original: uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjissati ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those of the sense sphere, the faculty of joy will arise there and the nose faculty will have arisen there.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: In regard to those in whom the nose faculty has arisen, will the equanimity faculty arise in them?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca saghānakā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam ye ca saghānakā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: In the case of those of the sense sphere in their last existence and those who, being normally liable to rebirth in any of the five destinies, attain Nibbāna through joy,

original: tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati
translated: the nose faculty has arisen in them but the equanimity faculty will not arise in them.

original: Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam ca uppajjittha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of the rest of those of the sense sphere, the nose faculty has arisen in them and the equanimity faculty will arise in them.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: In regard to those in whom the equanimity faculty will arise, has the nose faculty arisen in them?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam  tattha ghāna indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those attaining the form-sphere and formless-sphere jhānas, the faculty of equanimity will arise there, but the nose faculty will not arise there.

original: ghānindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: ghānindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm, the faculty of equanimity will arise there, and the nose faculty will arise there.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca
analyzed: yassa yattha ghānindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha man indriyam uppajjissati itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca
translated: In the case of those in whom the nose faculty arises, the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty will arise.🔽In the case of those in the sensual realm in their last existence, the nose faculty will arise, but the mind faculty will not arise.

original: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of the rest of those in the sensual realm, the nose faculty will arise, and the mind faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha ghān indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: In the case of those in whom the mind faculty will arise, the nose faculty will have arisen.

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those attaining the form-sphere and formless-sphere jhānas, the mind faculty will arise, but the nose faculty will not have arisen.

original: ghānindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjissati ghānindriyañca
analyzed: uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca
translated: In the case of those in the Fine-material Sphere, the mind faculty and the nose faculty have arisen.

original: uppajjittha. (Ghānindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjittha ghāna indriya mūlaka
translated: (The nose faculty is the basic.)

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjissati iti  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam yā ca itthiyo etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
translated: When the female faculty has arisen in any given person, has the male faculty arisen in that person?

original: parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ
analyzed: parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha purisa indriya
translated: In the case of those in the last becoming in the Sensuous Sphere, and in the case of those who, having manifested this state, will attain Nibbāna in that same existence, the female faculty has arisen in them, but the male faculty has not arisen in them.

original: uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca uppajjittha purisindriyañca uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: uppajjissati itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriyam ca uppajjissati  yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha ati āmantā
translated: In the case of the rest in the Sensuous Sphere, the female faculty and the male faculty have arisen.🔽Or, when the male faculty will arise in any given person, has the female faculty arisen in that person?

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When the female faculty has arisen in any given person, will the life faculty arise in that person?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati itaresam kāmāvacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm who will have a next existence, the femininity faculty has arisen in them and the life faculty will arise.

original: uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of the rest in the sensual realm, both the femininity faculty and the life faculty have arisen in them.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: Or, in the case of those in whom the life faculty will arise, has the femininity faculty arisen in them?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, the life faculty will arise in them but the femininity faculty has not arisen.

original: tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati🔽itthindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati  itthi indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm, both the life faculty and the femininity faculty will arise.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: In the case of those in whom the femininity faculty has arisen, will the joy faculty arise?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ yā ca itthiyo upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam yāḥ ca itthiyaḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm who will have a next existence, and in the case of women who attain Nibbāna in the interval after rebirth,

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati
translated: for them there the female faculty has arisen, but there the joy faculty will not arise.

original: Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca uppajjittha somanassindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: For the rest of those in the sensual realm, there both the female faculty and the joy faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacarānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha itthi indriya
translated: But, in regard to those in whom the joy faculty will arise, has the female faculty arisen?🔽For those in the fine-material realm, there the joy faculty will arise, but there the female faculty

original: uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjissati itthindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: has not arisen. For those in the sensual realm, there both the joy faculty and the female faculty will arise.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: In regard to those in whom the female faculty has arisen, will the equanimity faculty arise?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ yā ca itthiyo somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam yāḥ ca itthiyo somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: For those in the sensual realm in their last existence, and for those females who will attain Nibbāna through joy,

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati
translated: for them there the female faculty has arisen, but there the equanimity faculty has not yet arisen.

original: Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca uppajjittha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: For the rest there the female faculty and the equanimity faculty have arisen.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: But if someone’s equanimity faculty has arisen there, has their female faculty arisen there too?🔽For those in the realms of form and formlessness, there the equanimity faculty has arisen, but there

original: tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati
analyzed: tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: the female faculty has not arisen. For those in the sensual realm, there the equanimity faculty has arisen and

original: itthindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: itthi indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: the female faculty has arisen.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: If someone’s female faculty has arisen there, has their faith faculty … their diligence faculty … their mindfulness faculty … their concentration faculty … their wisdom faculty … their mind faculty arisen there too?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: For those in the sensual realm in their last existence, there the female faculty has arisen, but there

original: tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca
analyzed: tattha man indriyam uppajjissati itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca
translated: there the mind faculty will arise.🔽As for those in the sensual realm, the female faculty

original: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: has arisen and the mind faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: But, as for those in whom the mind faculty will arise, has the female faculty arisen in them?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha
translated: As for those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, the mind faculty will arise in them, but not the female faculty.

original: itthindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjissati itthindriyañca
analyzed: itthi indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca
translated: As for those in the sensual realm, the mind faculty will arise in them and the female faculty has arisen.

original: uppajjittha. (Itthindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjittha itthi indriya mūlaka
translated: (The section based on the female faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: As for those in whom the male faculty has arisen, will the life faculty arise in them?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: As for those in the sensual realm in their last existence, the male faculty has arisen in them, but not the life faculty.

original: tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca
analyzed: tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati itaresam kāmāvacarānam tesam tattha purisa indriyañca
translated: As for those in the sensual realm, the male faculty has arisen in them and the life faculty will arise.

original: uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: and the life faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: Or, when someone’s life faculty will arise, will his faculty of masculinity also arise?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, the life faculty will arise there, but not the faculty of masculinity.

original: tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjissati
analyzed: tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm, the life faculty will arise there,

original: purisindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: puris indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: and the faculty of masculinity will also arise.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca purisā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati iti  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam ye ca purisāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: When someone’s faculty of masculinity arises, will his faculty of joy also arise?🔽In the case of those in the sensual realm in their last existence and those who are reborn in the immaterial realm from the fine-material realm,

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati
translated: the faculty of masculinity will arise, but not the faculty of joy.

original: Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha somanassa indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of the rest in the sensual realm, the faculty of masculinity will arise, and the faculty of joy will also arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or does the personal-existence faculty arise when the joy faculty arises?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha purisa indriya
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material sphere, the joy faculty arises there but the personal-existence faculty does not arise there.

original: uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca uppajjissati purisindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam ca uppajjissati purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the sense sphere, both the joy faculty and the personal-existence faculty arise there.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca purisā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati iti  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam ye ca purisā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: In the case of those in the immaterial sphere, the equanimity faculty arises there but the personal-existence faculty does not arise there.

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those in the sense sphere and fine-material sphere in their last existence, and in the case of those who attain Nibbāna in the interval, the personal-existence faculty arises there but the equanimity faculty does not arise there.

original: Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of the rest in the sense sphere, both the personal-existence faculty and the equanimity faculty arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhā indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: Or does the femininity faculty arise when the equanimity faculty arises?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, the equanimity faculty arises in them, but not the femininity faculty.

original: tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati🔽purisindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati  puris indriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm, the equanimity faculty arises in them and also the femininity faculty.

original: Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca
analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha man indriyam uppajjissati itaresam kāma avacarānam tesam tattha purisa indriyañca
translated: In the case of those in whom the femininity faculty arises, does the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty arise?🔽In the case of those in the sensual realm in their last existence, the femininity faculty arises in them, but not the mind faculty.

original: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of the rest of those in the sensual realm, the femininity faculty arises in them and also the mind faculty.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha purisa indriyam uppajjittha ati  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha
translated: Or, where the mind faculty will arise, will the male faculty arise there?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material sphere and those in the immaterial sphere, the mind faculty will arise there, but not the male faculty.

original: purisindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Kāmāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjissati
analyzed: purisa indriyam uppajjittha kāma avacarānam tesam tattha man indriyam ca uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those in the sense sphere, the mind faculty will arise there and the male faculty will arise there.

original: purisindriyañca uppajjittha. (Purisindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: purisa indriyam ca uppajjittha purisa indriya mūlaka
translated: (The triad based on the male faculty should be treated in the same way as that based on the mind faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When the life faculty arises there, will the joy faculty arise there?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ yassa cittassa anantarā upekkhāsampayuttapacchimacittaṁ uppajjissati🔽asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam yassa cittassa anantarā upekkhā sampayutta pacchima cittam uppajjissati  asaññasattānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha somanassindriya
translated: In the case of those possessing the last mind of the past who will arise mind-accompanied in the future,🔽in the case of those in the non-percipient realm, the life faculty will arise there, but not the joy faculty.

original: uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca
analyzed: uppajjissati itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyañca
translated: In the case of those in the fourfold existence and the fivefold existence, the life faculty will arise there and the joy faculty will arise there.

original: uppajjittha somanassindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha somanassa indriyañca uppajjissati
translated: and the joy faculty has arisen.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or, when someone’s joy faculty will arise, has his life faculty arisen?

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam  tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those reappearing in the Pure Abodes, the joy faculty arises there, but not the life faculty.

original: somanassindriyañca uppajjissati jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: somanassa indriyañca uppajjissati jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the fourfold and fivefold existence, the joy faculty arises there and also the life faculty has arisen.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When someone’s life faculty has arisen, will his equanimity faculty arise?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ yassa cittassa anantarā somanassasampayuttapacchimacittaṁ
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam yassa cittassa anantarā somanassa sampayutta pacchima citta
translated: In the case of those possessed of the last consciousness, of those whose last consciousness is accompanied by joy,🔽the life faculty has arisen, but not the equanimity faculty.

original: uppajjissati asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: uppajjissati asaññasattānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those in the fourfold and fivefold existence, the life faculty has arisen and the equanimity faculty will arise.

original: upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca
analyzed: upekkhindriyam uppajjissati itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca
translated: When the life faculty arises there,

original: uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: the equanimity faculty arises there too.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: But when the equanimity faculty arises there, does the life faculty arise there too?🔽In the case of those reappearing in the Pure Abodes, the equanimity faculty arises there but not the life faculty.

original: tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha
translated: In the case of the rest, in the four-constituent kind and in the five-constituent kind,

original: upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha
translated: the equanimity faculty arises there and the life faculty arises there too.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When the life faculty arises, does the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty arise there too?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no
analyzed: pacchimacitta samaṅgīnam asaññasattānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha no
translated: In the case of those with the last kind of consciousness of the immaterial sphere and in the case of non-percipient beings, the life faculty arises there but not

original: ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: ca tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam
translated: in the case of those of the four and five bases,

original: tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: tattha jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: their life faculty and mind faculty arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: But if someone’s mind faculty arises there, does their life faculty arise there too?

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽jīvitindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha  jīvitindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca
translated: In the case of those who attain the Pure Abodes, their mind faculty arises there, but not their life faculty.🔽In the case of those of the four and five bases, their mind faculty and life faculty arise there.

original: uppajjissati jīvitindriyañca uppajjittha. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjissati jīvitindriyam ca uppajjittha jīvitindriya mūlaka
translated: (The faculty of life is concluded.)

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: If someone’s joy faculty has arisen, will their equanimity faculty have arisen?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ yassa cittassa anantarā somanassasampayuttapacchimacittaṁ
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam yassa cittassa anantarā somanassa sampayutta pacchima citta
translated: In the case of those with the last mind of the past, the last mind that is associated with joy,

original: uppajjissati tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ🔽uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca
analyzed: uppajjissati tesam tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriya  uppajjissati itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha somanassindriyañca
translated: but their faculty of equanimity has not yet arisen there.🔽In the case of those of four and five directions, their faculty of joy has arisen there,

original: uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: and their faculty of equanimity will arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsānaṁ dutiye citte vattamāne tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsānam dutiye citte vattamāne tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjissati no
translated: “Or, in the case of those whose faculty of equanimity will arise there, has their faculty of joy arisen there?”🔽In the case of those of the second mind in the Pure Abodes, their faculty of equanimity will arise there,

original: ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ🔽tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca uppajjissati somanassindriyañca uppajjittha.
analyzed: ca tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam  tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca uppajjissati somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha
translated: but their faculty of joy has not yet arisen there. In the case of those of four and five directions,🔽their faculty of equanimity will arise there, and their faculty of joy has arisen there.

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: “In the case of those whose faculty of joy has arisen, does their faculty of faith… their faculty of mindfulness… their faculty of concentration… their faculty of wisdom… their faculty of mind arise there?”

analyzed: pacchimacitta samaṅgīnam tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha

analyzed: manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha somanassindriyañca
