original: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: mind faculty will have arisen there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: Or those who have the mind faculty arisen there, have they the pleasure faculty arisen there?

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ dutiye citte vattamāne tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca🔽tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam dutiye citte vattamāne tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca  tesam tattha somanassindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam
translated: Those in the second mind-moment of the Pure Abodes have the mind faculty arisen there, but they do not have

original: tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca uppajjissati somanassindriyañca uppajjittha. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: tesam tattha manindriyam ca uppajjissati somanassindriyam ca uppajjittha somanassindriya mūlaka
translated: the pleasure faculty arisen there. Those of four and five kinds have the mind faculty arisen there and also the pleasure faculty🔽arisen there. (The section based on the pleasure faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: When anyone’s pleasure faculty arises, does his faith faculty … … his … … his … … his mind faculty arise there?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: Those acquiring mentality-materiality, for them there that equanimity faculty has arisen and

original: manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca
analyzed: manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca
translated: there that mind faculty will arise. For the rest, for those of four and five kinds, there that equanimity faculty has arisen and

original: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: there that mind faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha
translated: Or, where there is the arising of the mind faculty there is the arising of the equanimity faculty?🔽Those being reborn in the Pure Abodes, there their mind faculty will arise and

original: upekkhindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca
analyzed: upekkhindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catu vokārānam pañca vokārānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca
translated: there their equanimity faculty has arisen. For the rest, for those of four and five kinds, there their mind faculty will arise and

original: uppajjissati upekkhindriyañca uppajjittha. (Upekkhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjissati upekkhindriyam ca uppajjittha upekkhindriya mūlaka
translated: there their equanimity faculty has arisen. (The Equanimity Faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha saddhi indriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha paññindriyam pe manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Where there is the arising of the faith faculty there is the arising of the understanding faculty … the mind faculty?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha saddhindriyañca
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam tesam tattha saddhindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha  manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha saddhindriyam ca
translated: Those possessing the last consciousness in whom the faith faculty has arisen, in them the faith faculty has arisen and the mind faculty will arise. In those of four and five kinds, in them the faith faculty has arisen and the mind faculty has arisen.

original: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: Those who are dying with a mind associated with wrong view, or with a mind not associated with wrong view, but with wrong view as their object, for them the faith faculty has arisen, but not the mind faculty. For the rest, for those of four and five kinds, the faith faculty has arisen and the mind faculty will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?🔽Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽saddhindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha saddhindriyam uppajjittha ati  suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha  saddhindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catu vokārānam pañca vokārānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca
translated: Or those for whom the mind faculty will arise, has the faith faculty arisen in them?

original: uppajjissati saddhindriyañca uppajjittha. (Saddhindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjissati saddhindriyam ca uppajjittha saddhindriya mūlaka
translated: For those who are being reborn in the Pure Abodes, the mind faculty will arise in them, but not the faith faculty. For the rest, for those of four and five kinds, the mind faculty will arise and the faith faculty has arisen. (The faith faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha tassa tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha paññindriyam uppajjittha tassa tattha manindriyam uppajjissati iti
translated: Those for whom the wisdom faculty has arisen, has the mind faculty arisen in them?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: pacchimacitta samaṅgīnam tesam tattha paññindriyam uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: Those possessed of the last consciousness in whom the faculty of wisdom arises, in them that faculty arises without the faculty of mind arising. In the rest in whom the faculty of wisdom arises, that faculty arises and the faculty of mind also arises.🔽In whom the faculty of mind will arise, in them the faculty of wisdom has arisen?

original: manindriyaṁ uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha paññindriyañca🔽uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati.
analyzed: manindriyam uppajjissati itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha paññindriyam ca  uppajjittha manindriyañca uppajjissati
translated: In those who are being reborn in the Pure Abodes, the faculty of mind will arise in them without the faculty of wisdom arising. In the rest in whom the faculty of mind will arise, that faculty will arise and the faculty of wisdom also has arisen.🔽In whom the faculty of wisdom has arisen, in them the faculty of mind will arise?🔽In those possessed of the last consciousness, the faculty of mind has arisen in them without the faculty of wisdom arising. In the rest in whom the faculty of wisdom has arisen, that faculty has arisen and the faculty of mind also will arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati tassa tattha paññindriyaṁ uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam uppajjissati tassa tattha paññindriyam uppajjittha ati
translated: In whom the faculty of mind has arisen, in them the faculty of wisdom has arisen?🔽In those possessed of the first consciousness, the faculty of mind has arisen in them without the faculty of wisdom arising. In the rest in whom the faculty of mind has arisen, that faculty has arisen and the faculty of wisdom also has arisen.🔽In whom the faculty of wisdom will arise, in them the faculty of mind will arise?

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha🔽paññindriyaṁ uppajjittha. Itaresaṁ catuvokārānaṁ pañcavokārānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha manindriyam uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha  paññindriyam uppajjittha itaresam catuvokārānam pañcavokārānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca
translated: In those who are being reborn in the Pure Abodes, the faculty of wisdom will arise in them without the faculty of mind arising. In the rest in whom the faculty of wisdom will arise, that faculty will arise and the faculty of mind also will arise.🔽In whom the faculty of mind will arise, in them the faculty of wisdom has arisen?🔽In those possessed of the last consciousness, the faculty of mind will arise in them without the faculty of wisdom arising. In the rest in whom the faculty of mind will arise, that faculty will arise and the faculty of wisdom also has arisen.🔽In whom the faculty of wisdom has arisen, in them the faculty of mind will arise?

original: uppajjissati paññindriyañca uppajjittha. (Paññindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽10.2.1.6.4. Paccanīkapuggala
analyzed: uppajjissati paññindriyam ca uppajjittha paññindriya mūlaka  paccanīka puggala
translated: In those possessed of the first consciousness, the faculty of wisdom has arisen in them without the faculty of mind arising. In the rest in whom the faculty of wisdom has arisen, that faculty has arisen and the faculty of mind also will arise.🔽In whom the faculty of mind has arisen, in them the faculty of wisdom has arisen?

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa sotindriyam na uppajjissati iti natthi
translated: In those possessed of the first consciousness, the faculty of mind has arisen in them without the faculty of wisdom arising. In the rest in whom

original: Yassa vā pana sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa vā pana sotindriyam na uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: Or does the eye faculty not arise in one in whom the ear faculty does not arise? It arises.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa ghānindriyaṁ …pe… itthindriyaṁ …pe… purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa ghāna indriyam pe itthi indriyam pe puris indriyam na uppajjissati iti natthi
translated: “In one in whom the eye faculty does not arise, does the nose faculty … the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty not arise?” There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa vā pana purisa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: “Or does the masculinity faculty not arise in one in whom the eye faculty does not arise?” It arises.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Natthi.🔽Yassa vā pana jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.🔽Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa somanassindriyaṁ …pe… upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati iti natthi  yassa vā pana jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha  yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa somanassindriyam pe upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati iti natthi
translated: “In one in whom the eye faculty does not arise, does the life faculty not arise?” There is none.🔽“Or does the eye faculty not arise in one in whom the life faculty does not arise?” It arises.🔽“In one in whom the eye faculty does not arise, does the joy faculty … the equanimity faculty not arise?” There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa vā pana upekkhā indriyam na uppajjissati tassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: “Or does the equanimity faculty not arise in one in whom the eye faculty does not arise?” It arises.

original: Yassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti natthi
translated: “When the eye faculty has arisen, has the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the understanding faculty … the mind faculty arisen?” There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjissati tassa cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha cakkhundriya mūlaka
translated: “When the mind faculty has not arisen, has the eye faculty not arisen?” It has arisen. (Eye faculty.)

original: Yassa ghānindriyaṁ …pe… itthindriyaṁ … purisindriyaṁ … jīvitindriyaṁ … somanassindriyaṁ🔽… upekkhindriyaṁ … saddhindriyaṁ … paññindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa manindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjissatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa gha an indriyam pe itthi indriyam purisa indriyam jīvitindriyam somanassindriya  upekkhindriyam saddhindriyam paññindriyam na uppajjittha tassa manindriya  na uppajjissati iti natthi
translated: “When the nose faculty … the femininity faculty … the masculinity faculty … the life faculty … the joy faculty …🔽the equanimity faculty … the faith faculty … the understanding faculty has not arisen, has the mind faculty not arisen?” There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa paññindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa vā pana manindriyam na uppajjissati tassa paññindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: “When the mind faculty has not arisen, has the understanding faculty not arisen?” It has arisen.

original: 10.2.1.6.5. Paccanīkaokāsa
analyzed: paccanīka okāsa
translated: ..... The reverse order

analyzed: yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tattha sotindriyam na uppajjissati iti pe

original: 10.2.1.6.6. Paccanīkapuggalokāsa

translated: ..... The reverse order of persons

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha sotindriyam na uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: “Whose eye faculty does not arise there, in the same case their ear faculty will not arise?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha sotindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “Or, whose ear faculty will not arise there, in the same case their eye faculty does not arise?”

original: Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha sotindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha sotindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam  tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: In the case of those who are in the five-constituent becoming and in their last existence, there their ear faculty will not arise, but not there their eye faculty.

original: tattha sotindriyañca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: tattha sotindriyam ca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjittha  yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes and in the non-percipient beings and in the immaterial (realms), there their ear faculty will not arise and their eye faculty does not arise.🔽“Whose eye faculty does not arise there, in the same case their nose faculty will not arise?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “Or, whose nose faculty will not arise there, in the same case their eye faculty does not arise?”

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjissati,
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam rūpāvacarānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm and in their last existence and in the fine-material realm, there their nose faculty will not arise,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: but their eye faculty does not not arise there. Among those in the Pure Abodes, the non-percipient beings, and the immaterial beings,

original: tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjissati cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjittha  yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: their nose faculty does not arise and their eye faculty does not arise.🔽“If someone’s eye faculty does not arise in a certain place, does their femininity faculty not arise there too?”

original: Yassa vā pana yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ ye ca purisā eteneva bhāvena katici bhave
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam rūpāvacarānam ye ca purisāḥ etena iva bhāvena katici bhave
translated: “Or if someone’s femininity faculty does not arise in a certain place, does their eye faculty not arise there too?”

original: dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam  tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: In the case of those in the realm of sensual pleasure who are in their last existence and are bound for the realm of form, and in the case of men who, after manifesting this state, will attain final Nibbāna, their femininity faculty will not arise,🔽but their eye faculty does not not arise there. Among those in the Pure Abodes, the non-percipient beings, and the immaterial beings,

original: tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjissati cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: their femininity faculty does not arise and their eye faculty does not arise.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: Whose Eye Faculty does not arise there, in the same case, his Male Faculty does not arise there?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ rūpāvacarānaṁ yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam rūpāvacarānam yā ca itthiyā etena iva bhāvena katicid
translated: Or, in whose case, his Male Faculty does not arise there, in the same case, his Eye Faculty does not arise there?

original: bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca🔽tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ
analyzed: bhave dassetvā parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati no ca  tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam
translated: In the case of those in the Sensuous Element who are in their last existence in the Fine Material Sphere, and in the case of those women who, having shown the way to existence, will attain Emancipation, in their case, the Male Faculty does not arise there,🔽but their Eye Faculty does not not arise there. In the case of those in the Pure Abodes, in the case of those in the Non-percipient Beings’ existence, in the case of those in the Formless,

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjissati cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: in their case, the Male Faculty does not arise there, and the Eye Faculty does not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: Whose Eye Faculty does not arise there, in the same case, his Life Faculty does not arise there?

original: Asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those in the Non-percipient Beings’ existence, in the case of those in the Formless, their Eye Faculty does not arise there, but their Life Faculty does not not arise there.

original: jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Suddhāvāsānaṁ arūpe pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati suddhāvāsānam arūpe pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha
translated: the life faculty will not arise.🔽In the case of those in the Pure Abodes in the immaterial world who are in their last existence, there is no arising of the eye faculty there and

original: cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: cakkhu indriyañca na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati  yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: there is no arising of the life faculty there.

original: Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca🔽tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ arūpe pacchimabhavikānaṁ
analyzed: pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati no ca  tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam arūpe pacchimabhavikānaṃ
translated: But in the case of those in the five-constituent becoming who are in their last existence, there is no arising of the life faculty there,🔽but there is no non-arising of the eye faculty there.

original: tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: tesam tattha jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjittha  yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes in the immaterial world who are in their last existence, there is no arising of the life faculty there and there is no arising of the eye faculty there.🔽In the case of those in the five-constituent becoming who are in their last existence, there is no arising of the eye faculty there and there is no arising of the joy faculty there.🔽But in the case of those in the five-constituent becoming who are in their last existence, there is no arising of the joy faculty there,

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: but there is no non-arising of the eye faculty there.

original: Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca sacakkhukā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam ye ca sa cakkhukāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: of those reappearing in the five-constituent becoming who, having reappeared there, will make an end of suffering without having attained the meditative development of loving-kindness,

original: tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na🔽uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca
analyzed: tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na  uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyaṃ ca
translated: there is no arising of the joy faculty, but there is no non-arising of the eye faculty there.

original: na uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjissati cakkhu indriyañca na uppajjittha
translated: But there is no arising of the joy faculty and there is no arising of the eye faculty🔽in the case of those in the Pure Abodes and in the case of those non-percipient beings and those in the immaterial becoming.

original: Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: “Where there is no arising of the eye faculty, is there no arising of the equanimity faculty there?”

original: Arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjissati. Suddhāvāsānaṁ arūpe pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: arūpānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha upekkhā indriya  na uppajjissati suddhāvāsānam arūpe pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha
translated: In the case of those in the immaterial becoming, there is no arising of the eye faculty there, but there is no non-arising of the equanimity faculty there.

original: cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: cakkhu indriyañca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: But there is no arising of the eye faculty and there is no arising of the equanimity faculty🔽in the case of those in the Pure Abodes in their last existence and in the case of those non-percipient beings.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or, where the faculty of equanimity does not arise, does the eye faculty not arise there?

original: Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca sacakkhukā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam ye ca sa cakkhukā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: In the five-constituent becoming, in the last phase of life of those who are without eye and who will attain Nibbāna mindfully,

original: tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na
analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha cakkhundriyam na
translated: there the faculty of equanimity does not arise, but the eye faculty does not not arise there.

original: uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ arūpe pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca
analyzed: uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam arūpe pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyaṃ ca
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes in the last phase of life, and in the case of those in the immaterial becoming and of those in the existence of the non-percipient beings, there the faculty of equanimity does not arise,

original: na uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: na uppajjissati cakkhu indriyañca na uppajjittha  yassa yattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: and the eye faculty does not arise either.🔽Where the eye faculty does not arise, does the faith faculty … the faculty of understanding … the faculty of final knowledge … the faculty of right knowledge … the faculty of coming to know the unknown … the faculty of understanding … the faculty of concentration … the faculty of mindfulness … the faculty of equanimity not arise there?

original: Arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ
analyzed: arūpānam tesam tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha manindriya
translated: In the immaterial becoming, the eye faculty does not arise there, but the faculty of equanimity does not not arise there.

original: na uppajjissati. Suddhāvāsānaṁ arūpe pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: na uppajjissati suddhāvāsānam arūpe pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha
translated: they will not arise. In the case of those in the Pure Abodes, in the immaterial world, in their last existence, and in the Non-percipient Beings,

original: cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: cakkhu indriyam ca na uppajjittha manindriyam ca na uppajjissati  yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: the eye faculty has not arisen and the mind faculty will not arise.

original: Pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: pañcavokāre pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: But in the case of those in the five-constituent becoming, in their last existence, the mind faculty will not arise,

original: tattha cakkhundriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Suddhāvāsānaṁ arūpe pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: tattha cakkhu indriyam na uppajjittha suddhāvāsānam arūpe pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam
translated: but the eye faculty has not arisen. In the case of those in the Pure Abodes, in the immaterial world, in their last existence, and in the Non-percipient Beings,

original: tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyañca na uppajjittha. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: tesam tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjissati cakkhundriyam ca na uppajjittha cakkhundriya mūlaka
translated: the mind faculty will not arise and the eye faculty has not arisen. (Eye Faculty)

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: In the case of those in whom the nose faculty has not arisen, the femininity faculty will not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca purisā eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā🔽parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha ati  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam ye ca purisāḥ etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā  parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriya
translated: Or, where the femininity faculty does not arise, does the nose faculty not arise there?🔽In the case of those in the sensual realm in their last existence, and in the case of those who, as men, will attain final Nibbāna in that very same birth after having shown the way for some time,🔽the femininity faculty does not arise there, but the nose faculty does not not arise there.

original: na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjissati
analyzed: na uppajjittha rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material realm and in the immaterial realm, the femininity faculty does not arise and

original: ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: ghānindriyam ca naḥ uppajjittha  yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: the nose faculty does not not arise there.🔽Where the nose faculty does not arise, does the masculinity faculty not arise there?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or, where the masculinity faculty does not arise, does the nose faculty not arise there?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam yā ca itthiyo etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm in their last existence, and in the case of those who, as women, will attain final Nibbāna in that very same birth after having shown the way for some time,

original: parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha
translated: for them there the male faculty will not arise, but not for them there🔽

original: ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca
analyzed: ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha purisa indriyañca
translated: for them there the male faculty will not arise, but there is no (such case as) their nose faculty not arising. For those in the form and formless worlds there the male faculty will not arise,

original: na uppajjissati ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: and the nose faculty also will not arise.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati iti  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: If anyone’s nose faculty does not arise, there the life faculty will not arise.

original: tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam
translated: For those in the form and formless worlds there the nose faculty does not arise, but there is no (such case as) their life faculty not arising. For those in the form world and formless world in their last existence there the nose faculty will not arise, and the life faculty will not arise.

original: tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: tattha ghāna indriyañca na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati 🔽yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: But if anyone’s life faculty will not arise, there the nose faculty will not arise.

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam  tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacare arūpāvacare
translated: In the case of those in the sensuous worlds who are in their last rebirth, the nose faculty will not arise for them there, and the life faculty will not arise for them there.

original: tattha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tattha jīvitindriyam ca na uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material and immaterial worlds who are in their last rebirth, the nose faculty will not arise for them there, and the life faculty will not arise for them there.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjissati. Rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa yattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati iti  rūpa avacarānam tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriya  na uppajjissati rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha
translated: “In the case of those whose nose faculty does not arise, does their faculty of sorrow not arise?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material world, the nose faculty does not arise for them there, but the faculty of sorrow does not not arise for them there.

original: ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: ghāna indriyañca naḥ uppajjittha somanassa indriyañca naḥ uppajjissati
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material and immaterial worlds who are in their last rebirth, and of non-percipient beings, the nose faculty does not arise for them there, and the faculty of sorrow does not arise for them there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghāna indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: “In the case of those whose faculty of sorrow does not arise, does their nose faculty not arise?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca saghānakā upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam ye ca saghānakāḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: of those reappearing in the sensual-sphere who will make an end without having entered upon the third jhāna,

original: tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na🔽uppajjittha. Rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca
analyzed: tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha ghāna indriyam na  uppajjittha rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyaṃ ca
translated: there the faculty of joy will not arise, but it is not the case that there their faculty of smell will not arise.🔽In the case of those reappearing in the fine-material sphere and in the immaterial sphere, and in the case of those non-percipient beings, there the faculty of joy will not arise

original: na uppajjissati ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: and neither will the faculty of smell.

original: Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati iti  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati rūpāvacare arūpāvacare
translated: “Where the faculty of smell does not arise, does the faculty of equanimity not arise there too?🔽In the case of those reappearing in the fine-material sphere and in the immaterial sphere, there the faculty of smell does not arise,🔽but it is not the case that there their faculty of equanimity does not arise. In the case of those reappearing in the fine-material sphere and in the immaterial sphere, and in the case of those non-percipient beings,

original: asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: asaññasattānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam ca na uppajjittha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: there the faculty of smell does not arise, and neither does the faculty of equanimity.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or, where the nose faculty does not arise, does the equanimity faculty not arise there?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca saghānakā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam ye ca saghānakā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm who die in their last existence and those who, having been reborn in the sensual realm with joy, will make an end to suffering,

original: tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha
translated: the equanimity faculty does not arise there, but the nose faculty does not not arise there.

original: Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca
analyzed: rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm who die in their last existence, and in the case of those non-percipient beings, the equanimity faculty does not arise there,

original: na uppajjissati ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: na uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca na uppajjittha  yassa yattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: and the nose faculty does not arise there.🔽Where the nose faculty does not arise, does the faith faculty … the mindfulness faculty … the concentration faculty … the wisdom faculty … the mind faculty not arise there?

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha ghānindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm, the nose faculty does not arise there, but the mind faculty does not not arise there.

original: tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: tattha man indriyam na uppajjissati rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam
translated: there the mind faculty will not arise.🔽In the case of those in the fine-material or immaterial realms, or in their last existence, or in the Non-percipient or the Immaterial realms,

original: tesaṁ tattha ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha ghāna indriyam ca na uppajjittha manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: there the nose faculty has not arisen and the mind faculty will not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha ghān indriyam na uppajjittha ati  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: Or those in whom the mind faculty will not arise, does their nose faculty not arise?🔽In those in the sensual realm in their last existence, the mind faculty will not arise, but their nose faculty has not ceased.

original: tattha ghānindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: tattha gha anindriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam
translated: In those in the fine-material or immaterial realms, or in their last existence, or in the Non-percipient or the Immaterial realms,

original: tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjissati ghānindriyañca na uppajjittha. (Ghānindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: tesam tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjissati ghānindriyam ca na uppajjittha ghānindriya mūlaka
translated: there both the mind faculty and the nose faculty will not arise.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati iti āmantā
translated: In those in whom the female faculty has not arisen, has their male faculty not arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or, where the male faculty does not arise, does the female faculty not arise there too?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ yā ca itthiyo eteneva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam yā ca itthiyo etena iva bhāvena katici bhave dassetvā
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm who will be reborn in their last existence, and in the case of those who, having shown the way of existence by this very state,

original: parinibbāyissanti tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: parinibbāyissanti tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha
translated: will attain final Nibbāna, the male faculty does not arise there, but the female faculty

original: itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca
analyzed: itthi indriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha purisa indriyañca
translated: does not not arise there. In the case of those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm, the male faculty

original: na uppajjissati itthindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: does not arise there, and the female faculty does not arise there either.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati iti  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: Where the female faculty does not arise, does the life faculty not arise there too?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm, the female faculty does not arise there, but the life faculty🔽does not not arise there. In the case of those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm who will be reborn in their last existence, the female faculty

original: tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam
translated: does not arise there, and the life faculty does not arise there either.

original: tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tattha itthi indriyañca na uppajjittha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: Herein, the femininity faculty has not arisen and the life faculty will not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?🔽Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha jīvita indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha ati  kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: Or, where the life faculty will not arise, has the femininity faculty not arisen there?🔽In the case of those in the sensual realm in their last existence, the life faculty will not arise there, but not because the femininity faculty has not arisen there.

original: tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ
analyzed: tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material realm and those in the immaterial realm in their last existence,

original: tattha jīvitindriyañca na uppajjissati itthindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: tattha jīvita indriyam ca na uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: the life faculty will not arise and the femininity faculty has not arisen.

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati iti  rūpa avacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam tattha somanassa indriya
translated: Where the femininity faculty has not arisen, will the joy faculty not arise there?🔽In the case of those in the fine-material realm, the femininity faculty has not arisen there, but not because the joy faculty will not arise there. In the case of those in the fine-material realm in their last existence, of non-percipient beings, and of those not generally reborn,

original: na uppajjissati. Rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: na uppajjissati rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha
translated: the femininity faculty has not arisen and the joy faculty will not arise.

original: itthindriyañca na uppajjittha somanassindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: itthi indriyañca na uppajjittha somanassa indriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: and the female faculty will not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or, if the faculty of joy will not arise in any given case, will the female faculty not arise in that case?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ yā ca itthiyo upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam yāḥ ca itthiyaḥ upekkhāya upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: In the case of those in the sensual realm who will be reborn in their final existence, and of those females who will attain Nibbāna without exertion,🔽the faculty of joy will not arise, but the female faculty will arise.

original: tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na🔽uppajjittha. Rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ arūpānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca
analyzed: tesam tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha itthi indriyam na  uppajjittha rūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam arūpānam tesam tattha somanassa indriyaṃ ca
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material realm who will be reborn in their final existence, of those in the immaterial realm, and of those not destined to be reborn, the faculty of joy will not arise,

original: na uppajjissati itthindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjittha

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati iti

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam

analyzed: tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati rūpāvacare arūpāvacare
translated: In the case of those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, and in the case of those in the last life in the sensual realm,🔽and in the case of those in the existence with no thought,

analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam yāḥ ca itthiyo somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti

analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha
translated: the faculty of equanimity does not arise, but the faculty of femininity does arise.

original: na uppajjissati itthindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: na uppajjissati itthi indriyam ca na uppajjittha

original: Yassa yattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?🔽Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha itthindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. analyzed: yassa yattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha itthi indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha man indriyam na uppajjissati rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam

original: tesaṁ tattha itthindriyañca na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjissati.

analyzed: yassa yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjissati iti  rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam
translated: When someone’s male faculty has not arisen in a certain place, has his life faculty not arisen there too?🔽In the case of those in the form and formless worlds, their male faculty has not arisen there, but

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ ye ca purisā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam ye ca purisā somanassena upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti
translated: In the fine-material sphere and the immaterial sphere in the last stage of existence, in the non-percipient beings, in those who are reborn-headless in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, in those who attain Nibbāna in the intermediate state, in those reborn in the fine-material and immaterial spheres in a resultant abiding without thought, in those who attain Nibbāna through exertion, in those who attain Nibbāna through non-exertion, in those who are reborn-headless in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, in the non-percipient beings, in those who attain Nibbāna in the intermediate state, in those reborn in the fine-material and immaterial spheres in a resultant abiding without thought, in those who attain Nibbāna through exertion, in those who attain Nibbāna through non-exertion, in those who are reborn-headless in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, in the non-percipient beings, in those who attain Nibbāna in the intermediate state, in those reborn in the fine-material and immaterial spheres in a resultant abiding without thought, in those who attain Nibbāna through exertion, in those who attain Nibbāna through non-exertion, in those who are reborn-headless in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, in the non-percipient beings, in those who attain Nibbāna in the intermediate state, in those reborn in the fine-material and immaterial spheres in a resultant abiding without thought, in those who attain Nibbāna through exertion, in those who attain Nibbāna through non-exertion, in those who are reborn-headless in

original: tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na🔽uppajjittha. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha🔽upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati purisindriyañca na uppajjittha.🔽Yassa yattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha purisa indriyam na  uppajjittha rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam tesam tattha  upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjissati purisa indriyam ca na uppajjittha  yassa yattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: for them there is no arising of the faculty of equanimity there, but there is no arising of the faculty of masculinity there.🔽for those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, and for those not generally destined to a happy rebirth, and for those in the existence at the most superior grade, there is no arising of the faculty of equanimity there, and there is no arising of the faculty of masculinity there.

original: Rūpāvacarānaṁ arūpāvacarānaṁ tesaṁ tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ
analyzed: rūpāvacarānam arūpāvacarānam tesam tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam  tattha man indriyam na uppajjissati rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam
translated: When someone has no arising of the faculty of masculinity there, does he have no arising of the faculty of faith there? …

original: tesaṁ tattha purisindriyañca na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: tesam tattha purisa indriyam ca na uppajjittha manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: for those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, there is no arising of the faculty of masculinity there, but there is no arising of the faculty of mind there.🔽for those in the fine-material and immaterial realms, and for those not generally destined to a happy rebirth, and for those in the existence at the most superior grade, there is no arising of the faculty of masculinity there, and there is no arising of the faculty of mind there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or when someone has no arising of the faculty of mind there, does he have no arising of the faculty of masculinity there?

original: Kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacare pacchimabhavikānam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam
translated: Those in the sensuous worlds who are in their last rebirth and those in the fine-material and immaterial worlds who are in their last rebirth and non-percipient beings are devoid of both the mental faculty and the femininity faculty.

original: tattha purisindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ🔽tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjissati purisindriyañca na uppajjittha. (Purisindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: tattha purisa indriyam na uppajjittha rūpāvacare arūpāvacare pacchimabhavikānam asaññasattānam  tesam tattha man indriyam ca na uppajjissati purisa indriyam ca na uppajjittha purisa indriya mūlaka
translated: Those in the sensuous worlds who are in their last rebirth are devoid of the femininity faculty but not of the mental faculty. Those in the fine-material and immaterial worlds who are in their last rebirth and non-percipient beings are devoid of both the femininity faculty and the mental faculty.🔽When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faculty of sorrow also not arise? It arises.🔽Or, when a given person’s faculty of sorrow does not arise, does his life faculty also not arise? It arises.🔽When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faculty of joy also not arise? It arises.🔽When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faculty of pleasure also not arise? It arises.🔽When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faculty of equanimity also not arise? It arises.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha.
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjissati iti uppajjissati  yassa vā pana yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha
translated: When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faith faculty also not arise? It arises.🔽When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faculty of energy also not arise? It arises.🔽When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faculty of mindfulness also not arise? It arises.🔽When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faculty of concentration also not arise? It arises.

original: Yassa yattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ …pe… saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti? Uppajjissati.
analyzed: yassa yattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam pe saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti uppajjissati
translated: When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faculty of wisdom also not arise? It arises.🔽When the life faculty does not arise in a given person, does his faculty of mind also not arise? It arises.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti? Uppajjittha. (Jīvitindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha jīvitindriyam na uppajjittha ati uppajjittha jīvitindriya mūlaka
translated: Or, if the life faculty does not arise in anyone, does the mind faculty not arise in him? It does arise. (The life faculty.)

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: Or, if the life faculty does not arise in any given case, does the mind faculty not arise in that case? It arises.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ dutiye citte vattamāne tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha,
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam dutiye citte vattamāne tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha
translated: When the second consciousness of the Pure Abodes is occurring, the joy faculty does not arise in them;

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati asaññasattānam tesam tattha somanassindriyañca
translated: but the equanimity faculty does not not arise in them. In the case of the non-percipient beings, the joy faculty does not arise and

original: na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: na uppajjittha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: the equanimity faculty does not not arise.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: Or, if the equanimity faculty does not arise in any given case, does the joy faculty not arise in that case?

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ yassa cittassa anantarā somanassasampayuttapacchimacittaṁ
analyzed: pacchima citta samaṅgīnam yassa cittassa anantarā somanassa sampayutta pacchima citta
translated: In the case of those possessing the last kind of consciousness who are entering the fourth jhana, the joy faculty does not arise in them;🔽but the equanimity faculty does not not arise in them.

original: uppajjissati tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ🔽na uppajjittha. Asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca na uppajjissati somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha.
analyzed: uppajjissati tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha somanassindriya  na uppajjittha asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam ca na uppajjissati somanassindriyam ca na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in neither-painful-nor-pleasant-feeling, the faculty of equanimity will not arise there, but the faculty of joy will not not arise there.🔽In the case of those in the immaterial-sphere existence, the faculty of equanimity will not arise there, and the faculty of joy will not not arise there.

original: Yassa yattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa yattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: In the case of those in the second absorption, the faculty of joy will not arise there, but the faculty of faith … the faculty of understanding … the faculty of concentration … the faculty of mind will not not arise there.

original: Suddhāvāsānaṁ dutiye citte vattamāne tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha,
analyzed: suddhāvāsānam dutiye citte vattamāne tesam tattha somanassindriyam na uppajjittha
translated: In the case of those in the Pure Abodes, when the second cognizance is occurring, the faculty of joy will not arise there,

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha somanassindriyañca
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati asaññasattānam tesam tattha somanassindriyañca
translated: but the faculty of mind will not not arise there. In the case of those in the immaterial-sphere existence, the faculty of joy will not arise there,

original: na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjissati.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjissati 🔽yassa vā pana yattha man indriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha somanassa indriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: and the faculty of mind will not not arise there.🔽In the case of those in the second absorption, the faculty of mind will not not arise there, but the faculty of joy will not arise there.

original: Pacchimacittasamaṅgīnaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati, no ca tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: pacchimacitta samaṅgīnam tesam tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati no ca tesam tattha
translated: Those who are dying with a mind associated with equanimity, for them that faculty of mind does not arise there,

original: somanassindriyaṁ na uppajjittha. Asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha manindriyañca na uppajjissati
analyzed: somanassindriyam na uppajjittha asaññasattānam tesam tattha manindriyam ca na uppajjissati
translated: but their faculty of equanimity does not not arise there. For those in the immaterial state, that faculty of mind does not arise there,

original: somanassindriyañca na uppajjittha. (Somanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyaṁ …pe… paññindriyaṁ …pe… manindriyaṁ na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: somanassa indriyam ca na uppajjittha somanassa indriya mūlaka  yassa yattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha tassa tattha saddhindriyam pe paññindriyam pe manindriyam na uppajjissati iti
translated: and their faculty of equanimity does not arise there. (The pair with the faculty of equanimity.)🔽“When anyone’s faculty of equanimity does not arise, does his faculty of faith…his faculty of wisdom…his faculty of mind not arise?

original: Suddhāvāsaṁ upapajjantānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjittha, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: suddhāvāsam upapajjantānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha no ca tesam

original: tattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati. Asaññasattānaṁ tesaṁ tattha upekkhindriyañca
analyzed: tattha manindriyam na uppajjissati asaññasattānam tesam tattha upekkhindriyañca
translated: but their faculty of mind does not not arise there. For those in the immaterial state, that faculty of equanimity

original: na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjissati.
analyzed: na uppajjittha manindriyañca na uppajjissati
translated: does not arise there, and their faculty of mind does not arise there.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha manindriyaṁ na uppajjissati tassa tattha upekkhindriyaṁ na uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha manindriyam na uppajjissati tassa tattha upekkhindriyam na uppajjittha ati
translated: But when anyone’s faculty of mind does not arise, does his faculty of equanimity not arise?
